hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: In desperate need of renovation but can't beat the location
desc: Reception was busy when I arrived, but I was checked in relatively quickly by a friendly receptionist. I was assigned a room in the Peninsula tower; the other tower is called Excelsior, thus the double name of the hotel. The receptionist said that the rooms in both towers are equal in terms of quality and size. The room was small, almost cramped, and screamed 1995 all over the place. It was worn out but clean. The bed was rock hard and gave me back pain, but on request, they brought an extra mattress pad the next day and after that it was okay. Make sure to ask for that if necessary. There was no socket by the bed (who would have needed that in 1995?). The room came with a desk+chair, armchair+coffee table, fridge (was turned off), safe (was broken), A/C (worked fine) and wifi

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 5 days in Singapore
desc: We had fun touring the City in the Garden as locals describes Singapore. There are lots of friendly people. The Hotel's location is walking distance to most of the attractions. It has a comfortable bed, friendly staff and nice food. We'll come back again to Peninsula when we visit Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Old refurnished
desc: Have my stay in the hotel last Jan 2015 during a conference meeting. Overall hotel staff are helpful Meeting room is rather worn out Guest room i am staying linger with cig smokes. Toilet furnishing are abit dirty due to worn out My colleague's room is fine its very clean

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: At the Centre of Singapore
desc: The location is perfect. The best convenience for a tourist to stay near local transportation. The hotel is located just 500 mts away City Hall MRT and just couple of minutes walking distance from Clarke Quay. You can avail Singapore Tourist Pass from City Hall MRT, it is an ez-link card that offers tourist unlimited travel on Singapore's basic bus services, MRT and LRT trains for the duration that it is valid. You can roam whole Singapore from here by the public transportation. It is one of the memorable experience at the hotel, I want to share- we reached there by early morning but they had arranged the room for us before our scheduled time and moreover an upgraded room. The staff are well mannered and polite. The breakfast was awesome with combination of every tastes around

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Stunning view across the harbour
desc: This hotel is clean, centrally located and easy to reach from the airport by the subway. Easy to go any sightseeing place in Singapore city. The view at night across the harbour to the casino was amazing. Good gym and nice pool.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent Location
desc: This hotel is one of the best located in the Lion City. Situated in the heart of town, it is near to MRT station, bus routes and taxis are readily available. Close by are excellent shops and delicious eateries. Staff were polite and friendly.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel in great location
desc: I thought the location was nice and central. Was near a metro station as well. The room was pleasant and inns a wonderful view of Singapore. The buffet in the restaurant was tasty. Friendly and helpful staff also. I've stayed there a few times now. For the money it's a very nice place.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel in walking distance to main attractions
desc: Great hotel within walking distance to Raffles for a Singapore Sling, Raffles Shopping Centre and continuing on to the Waterfront Promanade, Marina Bay Sands area and Gardens by the Bay attractions. Take a map and off you go! Our room was very modern, clean and comfortable. We arrived during the Chinese New Year celebrations, the hotel was fully booked. On arrival early morning we were told that our room would not be ready until the afternoon 1-2pm. This is something to consider as if you've flown from afar and fly out in February you may find the problem we did. Being extremely tired and having no room to lay our head for several hours. We eventually found that we could leave our luggage at a location on the ground floor with concierge and then half awake wandered the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Location
desc: I liked: 1) Our room was on the 21st floor with wonderful view 2) Good Location: very near MRT station and within walking distance to Clark Quay where there are restaurants & bars 3) Two complimentary bottles of water daily 4) Big safety box inside closet I did not like: 1) Not enough closet space and not enough drawers 2) Toilet poorly ventilated 3) Staff not very knowledgeable: We asked tourist questions to front desk & were referred to concierge office staff who also did not know. Also when when we asked questions about New Year's Eve at the same hotel, they did not provide information 4) Gym is not new and not very clean

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Singapore stopover
desc: I didn't choose this hotel, my travel agent did and she picked a great one. The room was very comfortable and the hotel is in a good location to get to Marina Bay or the nearest MRT station. There is a Sky Lounge where you can grab a cocktail and stand outside to marvel at the view (it looks especially good at night). Cocktails aren't too expensive - I paid 18.00 for a Singapore Sling as I wanted to make sure I had one (although I did visit the Long Bar and have more the following day) I had two nights here as a stopover on the way home to the UK from Australia and would definitely stay again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Second visit
desc: Stayed for the second time ( and probably again this year) because we like where it is. Not too far from Clarke Quay, nice night view to Marina Bay hotel from a short stroll down the street, and it's just around the corner from the Raffles shopping centre ( our favourite) . You can walk probably 20 mins to Orchard Road.. we did walk to marina bay shopping mall and hotel too through a series of underground tunnels. Hotel is old but has 2 nice pools, the rooms are nice, tidy clean and of a reasonable size. Perfectly ok. Reception area always busy and so is the excursion desk downstairs. Staff helpful though ...

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Perfect 2-night stay!
desc: We stayed here after our cruise and were delighted to be able to check in to our room earlier than expected. I've stayed in 5-star Singapore hotels when there for work and this hotel I felt has much more personality. The location is ideal, close to shopping and an abundance of eateries. We never ate in the hotel as there are lots of local fun places to dine for breakfast, lunch and dinner just down on the street level and in the malls below. The hotel pools were really relaxing and a nice place to chill after a big day out. Also, Fort Canning Park is just a couple blocks away and a beautiful place for an early morning workout. One drawback which was nothing to do with the hotel is that getting a taxi from the taxi rank outside can take forever....we gave up and used Uber

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Location Is Great
desc: Was in a sudden plan to visit Singapore, accompanied my sister and nieces. Had a short time to book a hotel and got this Peninsula Excelsior. The hotel is quite old but clean at the lobby area. However, we must pay attention in the room cleanliness quality. Staffs were ok.....mixed of nationalities.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel, great location
desc: This hotel is about as central to the downtown ( Parliament, City Hall ) as you can get. Its got lots of little restaurants and Kaya places all around. The hotel is very large and mid to high for the market but its clean, excellent staff and decent sizes rooms. I would recommend this of the "5 stars" that charge double the money. Its not as ritzy but just as good for half the cost. Two thumbs up

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not good internet
desc: I stayed almost week here when participated in food exhibition! Overall not so nice hotel, central location near to metro station! Breakfast not so good, nice pool! Rooms so so, very big problems with internet! You need to buy internet and still connection poor! I spend hours to call to staff and ask solve this problem...finally they asked anyway pay full price for such bad service! Will not return here!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel in the centre of Singapore
desc: This is a nice hotel. Strange that the lobby is on the first floor and you have to give your bags on the ground floor. There are only 3 elevators and it's a very high building. When we were there one of the elevators didn't work so you had to wait a long time to go up or down. That is very irritating. Breakfasdt is good. The staff is friendly.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great family hotel
desc: Great staff, great rooms, great breakfast. Nothing can be faulted with this hotel. Very close walking distance to local public transport and also easily accessible from the airport. Fantastic convenance store just around the corner

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A good place to stay
desc: In general it was a nice stay, eventhough the view could have been better. I guess I was in Excelsior tower and the Peninsula tower shielded my view to MarinaBay Sands hotel and around. My room wasn't the cleanest room I have ever seen, but I guess the high humidity might have played its role. The location is perfect, close from everything. Tip for runners: go eraly in the morning or late in the night and take a bottle of water. I went @ 7am and came after 5km wet to the bone. The humidity was insane.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great View, Walking Distance to Marina Bay! (1-hr walk :D )
desc: The hotel location is BEST for us. It was a family travel and this hotel is near to almost great tourist spots in Singapore. Walking distance to City Hall train station, Malls and restaurants. One thing that makes this hotel HIGHLY recommended... you can walk from Peninsula hotel to Marina Bay, Esplanade etc through the underground/Subway. GREAT EXPERIENCE! We left the hotel at 0800hr and returned at 2230hrs. The only taxi ride we made was from Marina Bay Sands to Clarke Quay and back to hotel. We walked from Peninsula to Harbourfront to Marina Bay and explored all the tourist spots within about 7 to 10km radius by walking. That is how near Peninsula hotel to Marina Bay :D The room itself has the view of the Marina Bay. the Eye etc. great to colors at night, a sight to

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good - again
desc: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and I was there again last June (just before the neighbouring Funan sadly closed). As usual I found the stay to be very satisfactory. What I didn't mention in my last review is how nice the pools are; there are 2 of them at the lobby level (a few floors above ground) and the one opposite the check-in counter is worthy of any 5 star hotel which makes it a great selling point for the Peninsula-Excelsior. By Singaporean standards the room prices are quite reasonable so this is always on my list of hotels to check when I book a trip to Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central location and easy to go anywhere
desc: The rooms are pretty good. I have been staying in the hotel quite often. Breakfast is decent. The view was good. And they have a new executive lounge. Is new so not much experience I guess. Rooms are clean and up to standard.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central location in Singapore
desc: Arriving on a early morning Singapore Airlines flight, we were stopping over at the hotel on a stop over deal. The reception staff were excellent, allowing us in early as they had a room available with twin beds. The room was quiet and a good size, with comfortable beds. The wifi was fast and included in the stopover price. Included was breakfast, though we found the breakfast disappointing compared to other hotels we have previous stayed in Singapore that were in a similar price range. The hotel is in an ideal location for catching a Singapore Airlines stop-over bus that stops within 50m of the front entrance. We would consider staying at the hotel again, due it location in Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel
desc: Nice place 2 stay after working all day, with the good room and the good view of Spore. Closer with Clarke Quay to hang out at night. Nearly with the MRT station 2 go every where we want 2 go. Food is delicous n the staff so hospitality.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very pleasant stay here, will come again.
desc: Excellent facilities, 2 swimming pools, rooms nice and clean and specious. Location very central. Metro close by. The hotel is mid range and very comfortable. The restaurants were a bit too expensive but there are cheap and good eating places very close by.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Conveniently located. Old fashioned. Value for money
desc: Old hotel but surprisingly good and clean room. Perfect for families with small children. Good city view, very easy to get taxi. However, going out is a bit difficult for children, not that close to MRT (underground trains).

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Location Decent Room
desc: The location is good and has always been one of my choice for short stay in Singapore. They have 2 buildings - peninsula and excelsior. Now the key is try to get a room in EXCELSIOR because it is a newer building and the room is much nicer (for the same price). You can probably request this when checkin. The Peninsula tower is older and smells a bit strange sometimes. But it is located in the city and near MRT station, shopping malls and convenience store - I would recommend it.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Singapore Family Tour
desc: Peninsula Excelsior is a recommended hotel for family, business traveller,friends etc.The swimming pool is intended for adult and kids.The room is clean,amenities are well maintained and food in restaurant are delicious.The staff are helpful.It was a great,relaxing and enjoyable stay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Swimming in Glass Swimming Pool
desc: Most elegant and luxurious foyer. Slept like an angel as the rooms were so comfortable.The children chilled out by swimming in the glass swimming pool which was such a treat. Food and beverages were well-above standard. Location, Location, Location. Booked downstairs to catch a coach to the Singapore Zoo. The Best Zoo in the World. Totally engaging stay overall. Business/Family/Pleasure.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excelsior Club
desc: The amenities,view ,food and service are excellent. The hotel is very centrally located. The hotel has two towers and the first tower affords the Club Lounge. The Club lounge has views of Singapore Harbour and is great to relax after a busy day

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointed - not 4 star Hotel Standard
desc: Location was good, but that's all. Staff member on check in acted like we were an inconvenience and she didn't want to help. Ended up looking at 5 rooms each (2 rooms were booked) before agreeing on staying in one for the night - each room had mould and dirt, and unpleasant smells. Even the rooms we settled on (because we couldn't get a refund to go to another hotel), had mould around the aircon vents and wall and in bathroom. Housekeeping cleaned our room a number of times to remove mould and dust. Members of our group had reactions in rooms such as skin rashes and blocked noses, feeling light headed. Safe stopped working at least 3 times. Staff on front tourist desk weren't helpful. Only helpful person was a lovely lady who was one of the Duty Managers, who tried her

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Just a room
desc: We stayed 4 nights here as a bit of a stop over on the way to Phuket as we had never stayed in Singapore before. Chosen for close proximity to MRT and local viewing points, then its a great choice. We wouldn't choose it for any other reason. The view from our corner room on the 20th floor would have been spectacular except for the filthy windows you could hardly see out, which caused great disappointment for viewing the lazer display from the Bay Sands Hotel if staying in the room for this. The room in general was pretty dated and could do with an update. The huge bed looked welcoming but was a let down as it was no better than sleeping on concrete and we slept poorly because of this and the fact we were woken up early by sevice people wanting to know if we needed laundry done

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Singapore holiday
desc: Great location, close to public transport and very central for the highlights of the city and the shopping. The staff were all very obliging and helpful with organising tours for us. Awesome cafe beside the hotel, very reasonable. Only disappointment was the very hard bed.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very average
desc: We stayed as a stopover for 3 nights. The room and bathroom were small and the bed not so comfortable. It had a huge safe! Nothing in the minibar and staff not that interested in interacting. Pools looked okay but we didn't use. The restaurant was too expensive for us but the pictures looked very nice.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Have a funny trip at here
desc: easy on trans-traffic, good and comfortable facilities. friendness counter services. and here to clarke quey, city hall , changi airport and many other good place is convient so i recommanded here to other travellers

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent location
desc: We stayed 3 nights here and it was adequate in regards to the room, which wasn't large for the 3 of us. But it is well appointed and really central. We didnt spend much time in the room as there is so much to do in Singapore. Its quite expensive for what it is but everything is in Singapore. I would recommend it based on location

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Singapore stopover deal
desc: We had a stopover on the way to Europe and the room was good and bathroom was updated and clean The location good The waiting staff in restaurant were excellent.Slow service to the room though We had curdled milk and rang reception for replacement Had to ring 3 times and it took 3 hours to get it.Then we had a stopover on the way home and it was like a different hotel. The room was dingy and carpet stained The bathroom was awful, shower over the bath with shower curtain and no safety rail to get in and out of bath Air conditioner old and vents dirty There are 2 sections to this hotel and it seems one is fine and the other hasn't been updated at all. I would have recommended on the first stay but no way after the second. Just horrible.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Convenient Comfortable Clean
desc: Like many others, we took advantage of one of the Singapore Airlines stopover offers on our Australia/Europe travel recently. The hotel is conveniently located for a short walk downtown, or to the re-developed waterfront area, but it is in the economy price range and is showing its age. Service at check-in was excellent.....our room was clean and quiet and very comfortable for our one night stopover, and it provided the break we wanted. We would probably look for a hotel in a higher range if our stay was to be more than a day or two.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A welcome respite!
desc: Our recent trip from Davao to Singapore takes almost 8 hours, including pre/post departure procedures, actual flight plus air traffic and commuting via MRT. So, it was a pleasant surprise to find our hotel near the City Hall MRT station (50 meters from exit B). There is also a bus stop on the adjacent road, so going to the different attractions is easier and cheaper. When we get to the hotel, we were ushered into the elevator right away as the lobby is in the 6th floor. Checking in is super fast and the receptionists are accommodating and efficient. Our room was located at the Excelsior Tower, so the view we have is of the central fire station. The room was clean, and towels are changed daily even if not requested. TV has limited cable channels but hey, Wifi is very good.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointing
desc: I stayed at this hotel as part of a Singapore Aurlines Stopover Package so I wasn't offered a choice of hotels. There are a number of other hotels around the same price which were far superior. While the hotel might be in a central location, it's not a nice neighbourhood. There is a sex shop operating two doors down, along with the types of people who frequent it. The hotel entrance is on the ground floor but reception is on Level 1. As I arrived very early in the morning I had to lug my own luggage up to check in. The lobby was in a poor state of repair. Some cushions on the lounges were held together with masking tape and the toilets were dark and old. There were many people sleeping in the lobby waiting for checkin as their arrival was in the early hours. The hotel smells of

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel poor breakfast
desc: The hotel was nice with a good room and well located. However, the breakfast served in the main room is poor and very busy. You can however take breakfast on the top floor, but you need to wear trousers, the food is better quality but less choice. The hotel is centrally located and the staff were helpful.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Perfect location
desc: We spent 5 nights in the Excelsior Tower. Check-in was very quick and easy. The room was comfortable, clean and a nice view. It is in the perfect location, just a couple of minutes walk from Raffles, City Hall MRT, Clark Quay. Close by are a couple of food courts that sold delicious local dishes at a fraction of the cost elsewhere. Only had one problem, the toilet overflowed at 4.00am on our first night. A quick call to reception had maintenance men up to our room in minutes. Although they had the toilet fixed in a few minutes there was water everywhere and the bathroom smelt horrible. The maintenance man phone reception and we were asked to pack our things and someone come up with a key to another room. We hadn't even finished getting ourselves organised before the porter was

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: good rooms, average facilities
desc: Checked in and all seemed well. Rooms were nice and well kept however when proceeding to the bar, staff under poured drinks which just happened to be really expensive and wifi in rooms was horrible. had to go to common areas just to log on.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very comfortable hotel
desc: It is the 3rd time I have stayed here, and it is is a 3.5 star hotel. It is priced accordingly. It has everything you need for a stay in Singapore, especially if you want to get out and see the sights, then come back and shower or swim and go out again. It’s close to the MRT, Raffles, Chijmes and other attractions. Our room on the 15th floor had a view of the Marina Bay area, the Flyer, the Marina Bay Sands hotel, the laser show and it was magic. We could also see the Padang and the Supreme court and St Andrews church. I doubt that some of the other hotels in the Marina bay area, depending on their aspect, could have the same view. On arrival we were checked in by Li Ying who gave us a lovely corner room in the Peninsular Tower and then went to a lot of trouble to ensure that

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Location is the best thing
desc: I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. The first impression wasn't great. Check in was slow and the concierge staff who helped me with check in didn't seem helpful (you can see her angry face throughout the check in process). I got my room after 10 mins waiting at concierge. When I arrived in my room on 14th floor, there was a strong odour in the room from the painting in the opposite room! The odour was sooooooo strong and you could smell it in the corridor too. I couldn't believe the hotel actually left the room (which undergoing the painting work) door open. I immediately asked the housekeeping staff to spray my room. The soundproofing of the hotel was also not good. I could always hear the noise in the corridor very clearly. The best thing about the hotel is the location.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 5 star for the amazing view
desc: As an easy going person, I normally don't care much about service or staff attitude when staying at hotels as long as they are not rude. To me life is to enjoy and the most important thing in a hotel is a view for my eyes pleasure. So well-done PE! 5 stars for the unbeliveable view from my room.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Overall performance is not acceptable
desc: We have 2 adult, 1 7yrs old kid, and 1 2yrs old kid, We see the room can be fit 4 adult, so we think we will have enough space, but actually there is only a 3 feet bed x 2... only 2 adult can sleep , but pls remember not to turn when u sleeping...but how can a such small room can fit in 4 ppl ?? even is a baby still need a space, 1 7yrs old kind need at least 2.5 feet space to sleep...we ask the reception how this happen and the reply is very cruel ...(Simply tell us , u book a double room only...so is your problems) So we match the beds with chair together and go through the terrible nights....SO if u guy book hotel via AMOxx , pls don't trust them the room can fit 4 adult...btw the check in staff is completely not polite, how can u talk to your customer by not looking at

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: club room
desc: The club room is the best, although it is more expensive, it is worth it. The view of the Marina Bay Sands is so frontal. We also get the club facility at the top level. Personalize breakfast and evening drink.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Just a hotel
desc: Nice hotel located reasonably central. Used as a base for a Singapore stopover holiday. Bus stop only 30m from door so easy to get around. Rooms are on the small side, but are tidy and bathroom is very compact. The hotel has 2 pools.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Singapore hotel
desc: Stayed here for 3 nights as a break in our trip home from Australia. Nice hotel can only access floors in lift using room card. Had an issue when we arrived as we had booked and paid through our travel agent and had a voucher which they said they didn't have a booking. Paid for the first night by credit card as it was after midnight when we arrived and it couldn't be sorted till the morning. Went to desk next day and it was sorted out and money refunded for first night. Nice big clean rooms with a fridge but bathroom was really small and let it down a little. On our second night a lovely big plate of fruit was delivered to our room. Used the pool which was great and there is pool towels available. Didn't eat in hotel as prices were quite expensive. Good location for tourist

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Singapore Airlines Stopover Stay
desc: We usually spend a few days in Singapore, but with less than 24 hours between flights this time chose this hotel via Singapore Airlines as it was only AUD $122.00 for the night. In short - for that price it is a good hotel. I would not want to pay more. - Note the double room is literally a double bed - we are so used to doubles being Queens or even Kings this was a wee shock! We sleep in a King bed usually a would have preferred to have paid a little more for a bigger bed - the room had plenty of space for the same. I admit the room was furnished a bit better than I had hoped which was a pleasant surprise. We also had a cute view which was better than the side of buildings I usually land in Singapore. - The safe in our room was slightly malfunctioning as the numbers

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very good price/value ratio in the center of Singapore
desc: Good 4* hotel in the center of Singapore (business district, chinatown, old parliament, clark quay etc.). Very descent stuff, efficient processing if you consider over 600 rooms here. Lot's of international guest, not a family hotel. Rooms are pretty spacious and the price is very fair (8 nights about 1000 USD w/o breakfast). 24h room service which impressed me (very tasty and freshly cooked). Coffee/Tea and mini bar in the room. Lounge/Lobby bar is like in the US so not very beautiful but they offer happy hour every evening so again, good price/value. Pool is a bit weird because you see people outside like in a fish tank while you try to enjoy a cocktail or similar. I would recommend for both business and family trips.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Stopovers
desc: Chose this hotel as a Singapore airline stopover deal. Central and tour that I arranged picked up here. Check in was slow and complicated. Booked two double rooms only to be given two twin rooms. There is a dangerous step into the bathroom. Beds were hard. Clean and central. Close to the river eating areas and worth the walk to get a feed. There is also a street food food mall around the corner that is well used. Cold cheaper beer and soft drink as well.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Always a winner
desc: I have been here a number of times and it just seems that the attributes keep getting better. The biggest attribute has to be the staff (location is wonderful too) but from Irene and Shelley up in the Sky Lounge to Noordin, Eleana, Bernice and Sheila in The Coleman Court each goes way beyond customer service and makes you feel like treasured friends who deserve that little bit extra. As I've said before - definitely coming back here.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: Stayed at Peninsula Excelsior in August for 3 nights and was upgraded to a Excelsior Tower room. The room was very comfortable and clean. Best thing about the hotel is the location, right in the middle of the CBD and bus station just across the road.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice city hotel
desc: We stayed 3 nights on our way to Bali. The hotel is in a good location and is clean and comfortable. There are a couple of small pools and the breakfast buffet was nice. Taxis are easily available to and from the airport and reasonably priced.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Huge Gash on my Leg from the Toilet Paper Cover
desc: The PE was a great rate I found online. The room was great with a great view. They have these toilet paper covers made of metal covering the toilet paper. They have very sharp edges that I found out when I slipped on the tile floor and gashed my leg. I talked to management about the problem, and they offered me a DR. and to upgrade my room for an additional cost with some benefits to the lounge upstairs. Not my real deal. If you stay here, please watch out for these dangerous toilet paper covers.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location
desc: Well appointed rooms. Excellent location for Hop on Hop off Bus. Easy walk to Clark Quay. Staff were friendly and efficient. Easy check in and check out. Recommended for mid budget travelers. Very good local food places close. Delisious food and cheap prices.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A Good Hotel in A Good Location, But.
desc: I found this hotel to be okay in regard to location. I was disappointed with some of the check in staff. They appeared to have limited knowledge of their profession. Day 1 we were met with a very cool reception. Not really welcoming. I found the concierge staff to be good. Breakfast was disappointing on day 2 but okay for our third morning. The room required refurbishment. I think for Singapore one can do better.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very convenient Hotel
desc: Its been few times stay in here..since 2013 until now. Good location and nearby MRT also from airport is 1 line not to complicated, lovely to stay in here, long time ago the room for smoking is bigger and nice, but last time in here... why become small room hahaah otherwise keep coming back with pleasure. Lovely to be in cityhall neighboor hood. and near church, Good breakfast.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Singapore Stopover
desc: Great stopover with Singapore Airlines at cheaper rate and took advantage of upgrade to Club for free canapés and drinks. We also were treated to great view of fireworks at Marina Bay Sands. Room was very comfortable and clean. Highly recommended.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 1 Night Stay in Sep '16
desc: Very good hotel. SIA Singapore stopover on our way back from Europe. Walking distance to all Singapore attractions. My family enjoyed this short stopover very much. Next time when in Singapore, will book the hotel for few days minimum. I recommend this hotel very much. Thanks.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Check in was a nightmare
desc: We chose this hotel because of it's location, and it's in a great place! However, despite the fact that we had made the reservation, for 2 couples, (2 rooms with double beds, as specified on the reservation) 4 months earlier, they battled to find us rooms and we were not checked in until after 3:00 and after complaining to management.... Not a good start! We didn't utilise the hotel facilities, but the pools looked great. The wardrobes in the rooms are very tiny, fortunately we were only staying for a couple of days, because there is one drawer for all clothes and very little hanging space. The concierge was extremely helpful with directions and general information. The day we checked out there was no hot water in our room in the morning - this is not a budget hotel and

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location not best hotel
desc: Great location, close to MRT. Room was not best, AC was dripping on floor. Got "fixed" but didnt help. Friendly service overall. Poor breakfast: both offering and too crowded and cramped. Wanted to try this out but next time we will choose a different hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, convenient, rooms are decent and clean
desc: Hotel is very conveniently located next to everything central in Singapore. Very close to MRT station. Walking distance to eating and sightseeing places. Rooms are clean and decent. Breakfast is average. Main advantage of the hotel is location if you want to be close to that area.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Sort of good!
desc: OK: the hotel was in a great location if like me you can handle the heat, and want to walk around Singapore. The Singapore River with its bars and restaurants is a few minutes walk (don't automatically choose the first restaurant you come to). Even the flower domes are within walking distance. My only problem is that we paid (through the travel agent) for a room with two single beds for me and my son, plus a rollaway for my grandson. When we got there we had a room with a king size bed. To get a rollaway, for some reason meant I had to upgrade to "club" for more than double the cost. Getting back to the hotel, the staff were always really nice and friendly. The room was clean (but ours was very small) the food for breakfast plentiful. All in all I would recommend it - if only I

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but tired hotel
desc: Our experience of this hotel started at the front desk where it seemed the staff would have preferred to be elsewhere. We had adjoining rooms which while satisfactory were in need of a reno. The bathrooms were extremely small, mouldy in places, particularly near the blinds and the shower head in one room basically was a sprinkler that squirted everywhere. One day we had no hot water, apparently an issue for the whole hotel. The hotel was however in a good location and had easy access to the MRT.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Short stat
desc: Clean & tidy with good facilities and excellent service. Great location. Look out for 50% off meals at hotel restaurant. Walking distance to riverfront and close to Public transport. Overall very happy and reasonably priced.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A ggod choice closwe to the river.
desc: We stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel for an overnight on the way to the USA The staff are friendly and the rooms are quite large and comfortable. The rates are reasonable and it is an easy walk down to the river and the many eateries that are located there. We have a couple of favourites by the river so we chose to eat there rather than in the hotel but the menu looked interesting and it seemed popular. From memory in-house guests received a discount on the meals. I had planned to visit the Funan DigitaLife Mall, which is right next door to the hotel but it has closed which was somewhat disappointing.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good stay in a good location
desc: This is probably the best value for money hotel in the Marina Bay area with a swimming pool. The location is great, subway a block away and a $10 taxi ride into Marina Bay Sands area. Breakfast spread was good, stayed on the 8th floor in the Peninsular Excelsior building, Deluxe Twin view of the street.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Absolutely horrible
desc: Lol I dont know where to start in this "4star" hotel, you arrive and take a lift up to the lobby floor where as soon as the elevator doors open you are hit by the overwhelming stink of the bug spray that floods the entire hotel, after having to wait 4.5 hours for my room to be ready I finally get to my room, the windows are mouldy (see pics) the room stinks of stale cigarette smoke (non smoking floor) I couldn't even sit on the toilet as the bathroom is so narrow they have crammed a toilet seat into an area about 50cm across. The bed is he hardest thing I have ever witnessed. After trying to get some sleep for an hour I decided I'd rather get my money back and go find a new hotel, the beds, the mould, the stale smoke, the bug spray...after trying to talk to the ride lobby staff

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Comfortable and convenient
desc: A great place to stsy as it is within easy walking distance to Parliament, the river snd great Restuaraunts and bars, Raffles, convenience stores, money exchange, food courts, shopping and even McDonalds if that what you want. Approximately 200m to 500m from stop 5 & 7 of the red and yellow line of the Hop on Hop of bus, so what more could you want. The view from our room was excellent and very comfortable. 2 swiming pools make gor a relaxing time. When we stayed they had buy 1 get 1 fre for beer's and wines and were offering 50% discount from the cafe. I highly recommend the Asian Tapas for 2 it was very tasty. Staf were profesional polite and helpful.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great
desc: Great hotel. Location was very central and close to the train station. Very friendly and helpful staff. They offered me all of the amenities after I had checked out (as I had a Kate flight). Couldn't fault this hotel. Would stay there again :)

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hotel with excellent location except for....
desc: The hotel was strategically located in Singapore. Though the hotel entrance was a bit small, the concierge accommodated my group very well. Hotel lobby was not so big but my group was comfortable while waiting for us to be checked in. We just had an overnight stay because we had an early morning flight. 1. Checking In/Out: Since we had early reservations, checking in was a brezze. RATING: 5 out of 5 2. Rooms: Very clean and tidy. Bathrooms were also clean complete with fresh new towels and toiletries. The downside is that the toilet is not very comfortable because the tissue paper holder is exactly right beside the seat and it will hit your side while you use it. No time to complain because I only discovered it while we were on our way to check-out. RATING: 2.5 out of 5 3. Food:

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Close to amenities
desc: This hotel is reasonably priced, good location ie walking distance to Rafflescity shopping centre, raffles Long Bar and other shopping areas. Walk across the road from the hotel is the City Hall MRT which will take you to anywhere you want to go. At the station buy a Tourist Pass which is very convenient and cheaper. You can't get lost in Singapore ! The bed is firm and comfortable. The pillows are just the right height. Service is good and clean. Buffet breakfast is available at a discount. Buffet dinner is available on weekends only.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: poor value on day 1 of my present stay
desc: this is day 1 of my stay here, arrived at 11PM reception staff were nice but looked a bit bored and were not totally clear about the explanation about the services like gym , pool and breakfast. Arrived at room, not bad, good view of singapore. I noticed one table top lamp not working and bathroom smelled a bit. nice fruit basket made available. Ordered some room service. an old guy brought it up but the food was very nice, type of club sandwich. the guy seemed to want to tell me how to sign the bill but was unclear.Woke up at 6 AM to go to the gym,the gym is jst about okay, basic and a bit worn out but just about qualifies. The worst thing is breakfast. Really, you come down to L5, there are many tables/areas but where BF is is unclear, a rude lady stood and shouted room

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good service; helpful reception
desc: Service was a plus point for sure. However other aspects can be improved - particularly cleanliness of the room and breakfast. The air emanating from the air-conditioning ducts smelt stale; one did not feel comfortable in the room. Humidity control needs to be looked into.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Rude and Unhelpful Staff
desc: We stayed 3 nights at this Hotel, will never go back. Pros: - Location.. pretty close to everything.. very convenient - View... However the windows look like they haven't been cleaned in 5 years, very dirty - Nice Bed Cons: - Check in counter staff.. the lady we had did not say hello, didn't even make eye contact, didn't look at us.. very short with us, very unhelpful. Gave us the room key while making a joke with her co-worker and then ignored us. We had to guess how to get to our room. - Bugs.. so many little bugs in the room - Rude Breakfast staff.. Went to go get some breakfast.. wasn't interested.. told us we need to pay $50, we said no thanks too expensive.. THEN asked what type of breakfast we wanted. We went elsewhere. SO rude.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Overnight Stop-Over
desc: The Peninsula Excelsior is an average, yet reasonably modern hotel. It is close to shops and has a pool and free wi-fi. Staff not great, but the food was ok. Rooms were average, however the bathroom was not clean.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good hotel
desc: Good hotel for a low price considering ptice level in Singapore. Room ok, A/C worked very well...freezing, had to turn off. A good hotel, you get what you pau for. General score...1socks...10 amazing: Location: 8 Price: 8 Rooms: 5 Service: 6 Food: 7 Minibar: 4 Will I be back...yes, most probably

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Peninsula Excelsior Hotel
desc: I like this hotel. Our room was spacious with a good view of high rise buildings near Marina bay and partial view of Sands hotel. The room was clean, with flat screen tv, kettle, and refrigerator and safe. Breakfasts were great with lots of options. Everything was tasty. Location is excellent. It is about 50 m. (165 ft) from City Hall MRT (subway) station, about 100 m (330 ft) away from Clarke Quay and Clarke Quay MRT. By the way, trains from City Hall station run to airport.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location and facilities
desc: Well located near shopping malls, IT mall and MRT City Hall station. Rooms are clean and comfortable but not spacious (unless you get a corner suite). Prices vary greatly according to which agency you use.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Dated, old and an awful bathroom!
desc: I stopped at the Peninsular Excelsior Hotel during the F1 weekend, for ease of access to swisshotel, gate 3 and 4 and the padang area of the track its good. The same cannot be said for the hotel itself. I paid a premium to stay here this weekend and feel as though Ive been robbed. The hotel is looking very tired, the bathroom is terrible, small, cramped, grubby and old. Im not sure when it last had a make over. Im not even sure when it last had a proper clean. Its just grimey and old. The room itself was quite poor too, lots of brown mdf, slow internet, an uncomfortable bed and an awful tv selection where the volume doesnt even work half of the time. I had to ask for an iron and ironing board and there is a serious lack of power sockets in the room. I wouldnt come back here..

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not 4*
desc: I don't see how this hotel could be described as 4*. It's ok but nothing special. The thing which bugged us most was the sky lounge. Residents have to go to the ground floor concierge to get 'approval' to go there - they ensure you're not wearing shorts or sneakers. when we got up there, there were four men all wearing shorts! When we got there we were told a number of tables were reserved - in fact it turned out to be only one. The menus were so old they were falling apart. We ordered white wine and were brought red And the wine is incredibly expensive. After we'd had a main course the bill was brought without us even being asked if we wanted a dessert or coffee. On the positive side the food was ok.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location, Crazy Bathroom
desc: We stayed in this hotel as part of a package for the Singapore Grand Prix. Wonderfully located for the Grand Prix and MRT. Unfortunately, the hotel itself is in dire need of an upgrade. We upgraded from a Superior Room to a Club Room on the 20th floor. Our view was amazing as it overlooked the F1 track and the Marina Bay Sands Hotel etc and was a short walk for us to the track. The room itself was nothing special (I wonder what the deluxe and superior rooms looked like) but the bathroom! You can't sit on the loo without your legs being in the shower - who designed that! The bed was rock hard - the hardest bed in a hotel I've ever slept on - 4 nights was enough. Being on the 20th floor gave us access to the Sky Lounge which we really enjoyed, especially having breakfast there.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: An very old hotel but with modern facilities. Right in the City Centre.
desc: This is a very old hotel but I guess they renovated it so it looks kind of modern. Stayed here for one night as a Staycation. Swimming Pool is interesting as you are able to see people swimming as it is a look through pool. There are two swimming pools in this hotel. Check in was fast. Room was average. I requested for a high floor so was given 19th floor. Only thing is bathroom and all is small. Overall size of room is 26 square meters. Windows need to be cleaned. Bed is a bit hard but still am able to sleep in it. Facilities like Gym and Sauna are available. Not much equipment is the gym. The way to Sauna is at basement so I guess no one goes there. Found it very empty when I visited. Overall would recommend this hotel for its location.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not a 4 star...disappointing.
desc: This hotel is in need of a major shakecup and refurbishment. We spent a couple of nights at the Pan Pacific and moved to this hotel to compare...glad it was only an overnight stay. We were upgraded at checkin to a club room...I would hate to see what the premier room would have been like. The room on the 22nd floor had amaxing views of the Marina but not comparable to the Pan Pacific. The room was tired looking with a smallish bathroom .The bathroom was tiny with a shower door that opened inwards.Poor water pressure and hot water temperature was too low. The toilet did not flush properly and had to be flushed a few times to clear it. The tv in our room did not work...flat batteries and the aircon was not working properly.We had to wait ages for our luggage to be sent up.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Singapore Stopover Package
desc: Staff are very helpful and pleasant. Room was immaculate and the bed was really comfortable. Aircon set to 15 which is great for sleeping. Great bar for having a drink and relaxing after a very long flight.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 3 stars is being very very generous.
desc: I booked this via hotel cheap website, 5star? 4star? Err no! I would say 2.5/3 is very very very generous. It is very busy when u walk in the hotel luggages everywhere by the door way. It is busy because they have a lot of group tours. Course! No one offers to take our luggages. No one acknowledged us. I had to read the sign to take the lift to the Lobby and check in. We took our luggages up to the lobby and waiting over 20mins to check in. Receptionist is fully staff, working very slow. The duty manager serviced me, Not very approachable. I paid for my room already via cheap website from London. So what I paid for is what I get really. Small, dark room, dirty, poor service. What I paid for is over rated for the serviced I got!!!!! 1/ Poor service, told her

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Dissapointing
desc: No iron in room. AC was too cold, I set it for 30 degrees but feels like 14 degrees. TV systems interrupted twice in 3 days. Hot water was not available on my last day of stay. Definitely overpriced! Won't stay there again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Location perfect, service excellent, good hotel to use
desc: Was here on Business and found it was an excellent location for either work or visiting. The staff were excellent and very professional. The room was of a good standard and the view I had was unbelievable. The hotel is looking a little tired and maybe should think of gradually bringing areas up to date but by no means would this put me off going again. I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Happy traveller
desc: Excellent reception to the hotel. Any issues or assistance was attended to immediately. As we were flying out later the following day we were able to evacuate our room later than normal. Close to tourist areas and hop on hop off bus stops.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel
desc: We stayed during the Grand Prix. We arrived 5 hours before our check in time after a 15 hour flight from the UK. The staff found us a room immediately which was greatly appreciated. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms clean. We enjoyed the smaller pool when we were not out on trips or at the track. Room service was excellent. Ideal location, would stay there again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Just want to try some drinks at lobby lounge
desc: I just visit hotel peninsula to try some cocktail at lobby lounge I order couple of cocktails from menu the whisky sour was Nic but Singapore sling did not met my expectation it was too sweet nd the Colour was so red . Over all I really appreciate Judy for her great service.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Lovely location
desc: My wife and I spent 4 nights at this hotel. It is very centrally situated and within walking distance to the MRT and bus routes. Special thanks to Noordin Bin Abdul Azis the restaurant manager who took special care of our needs during Breakfast. He was also very helpful in providing info on key sights and locations.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Time for refurbishment
desc: Great location. Walking distance to raffles, and suntec city shopping malls. 5 min walk to clarke keys, loads of eating and drinking places. 10 min walk to China town. Location is very good, however it is definately in need of updating. The toilet/bathroom access very tight. Shower over the bath. Lots of little fruit type insects kept appearing in the bathroom. Sqimming pool looks great, but the underneath was open view to the lounge area, so i didnt feel comfortable utilising it. Staff were very helpful.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: a good stay
desc: A great place to stay well located to shops and MRT. Service was good and the staff friendly. The room was clean and maintained on a daily basis. Staff happy to undertake any request eg extra bottle water in the room.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Could do a lot better
desc: Recently stayed 3 nights and couldn't wait to leave. Despite "premier" room (1829) it was small and cramped with only 1 bedside table and an extremely hard queen size bed. Room poorly equipped with a useless mirror. Bathroom tiny and again poorly stocked with no hair conditioner and it was dirty when we arrived. Lights wouldn't turn off and when reported wanted to argue with us, hmmm! Eventually this problem was addressed. Had to ask housekeeping to replenish basics, i.e. toilet paper, body wash, tea bags and milk. This hotel is tired and old and in serious need of a refurbishment. Saving grace it is centrally located but we will not be staying there next time we visit Singapore. Wi-fi is NOT secure.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Time for refurbishment and a staff shake-up.
desc: This hotel is elderly, tired and in great need of serious refurbishment. We stayed in Room 901 for 4 days on a Singapore Stopover deal. We leave tomorrow morning. This is our second stay here. We'll look round for somewhere better next time in Singapore. The level of cleanliness and maintenance is poor. The bathroom and toilet is small and in need of re-tiling, painting and grouting. Clearly no supervision. The General Manager (Mr Wong) needs to get out and manage by walking around, looking and observing. Bar Staff also very complacement in providing service. There are probably some excellent rooms, but with a Singapore Stopover deal you're in "cattle class"..!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Beautiful
desc: We had a lovely 4 day stay here. Room was very roomy and comfortable. Breakfast on level 5 is delicious, menu is quite varied. Bin the lobby is a beautiful clear sided pool and bar with deck chairs. On arrival we were helped with our bags and they were taken to our room. It is very convenient to shops and Orchard Road. You can get picked up from your hotel for various tours. Chinatown is a 10 minute walk away

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Convenient and Good Service
desc: My sister and I stayed here for one night on the way to and from New Zealand. The hotel is very conveniently situated. It is a very busy hotel but then Singapore is a very vibrant and busy city. Situated very close to the MRT (underground transport) and buses so it is very convenient. The room was comfortable with coffee and tea making facilities and complimentary bottled water. The staff are very friendly and most helpful. The breakfast was good too. I would stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A nice hotel in the centre of the city with beautiful interior and rooms with best amenities
desc: We stayed at the hotel for a day only in October 2016 on way to Bali , Indonesia. The room was nice and had all the things one would expect in a star hotel.The hotel is opposite a mall with food courts including Indian veg.one . (though closed due to Diwali festivals. ) and 7X11 store round the corner.More than worth the value.And the breakfast was also good.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very Pleasant & Convenient Hotel for Stopover
desc: Large room in the Excelsior tower. The hotel was very well situated for us being within short walking distance of the MTR (City Hall) with direct link to Changi Airport. Also close to the Marina area and the the main central sicty sights

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Comfortable enough in a great location.
desc: Hotel room rate in Singapore is high comparing to Bangkok. Peninsula Excelsior is no exception. But way better than a hotel of the same price range in Hong Kong. The hotel starts to show its wear and tear. Staff are polite enough. They need to do something with buffet breakfast to get better ranking. Guest room is clean. Location is excellent.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Close to everything
desc: First got in when my flight was cancelled - hotel handeled complicate situation with ease. Since I stayed couple of times. Except a bit slow reception - check-in and out, I was happy. Close to everything means to China town, shopping centre, conference locations, evening restaurants in Clarke Quay, park, etc. Clean, usual comfort, reasonable price. Just try

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Last leg stopover
desc: Great central location for a short stay. Good energetic walking distance to Gardens by the Bay and Marina Bay Sands. Also walking distance to Suntec City shopping mall. On/off bus tours leave from this centre. A clean , modern hotel with a decent restaurant for brekkie.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Location
desc: Valued for your money good location walking distance to City Hall MRT.can reach the hotel from Airport by subway.Walking distance to Clarke Quay and Chinatown.A lot of Restaurant and shopping mall .Walking distance to Raffles Hotel and near to Hop on Hop off bus stop

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Still a Great Hotel
desc: While this Hotel is still my favourite, I'm just letting you know that for the next 2 years there will be work going on just next door. The Funan Center is being renovated and it is quite noisy. We were there at the end of October and the work has just started.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Styacaytion
desc: My first time staying there on Oct 2016. Everything was good from checking in till i checked out. Big room for us and there's a little surprised when we entered the room. Bed was comfy. had a great sleep at night. Wish we can stayed longer. Staff was friendly. We will come next time. Excellent!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, friendly staff
desc: We stayed here for 7 nights in October and thought the location was fantastic. We found the staff to be friendly especially one lady in particular in the restaurant who we chatted to briefly every day at breakfast. We found the buffet breakfast very adequate, especially being able to have the eggs cooked to our liking. We had to catch a flight in the evening and were able to use the shower room to freshen up and change before leaving for the airport. The only thing we found to be unsatisfactory was the bed was rock hard. We were told by the lovely lady in the restaurant that we should have let reception know after the first night and they probably would have moved us. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are wanting to be close to everything.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very convenient hotel
desc: The location is good as it only need 5 minutes walking distance from city hall mrt. The room is considered big in sg. But the bedsheet has made me and my sis has rashes and we are sensitive to its chemical detergent, its too strong. The tooth brush is too low quality for the hotel. The receptionists are unfriendly especially ladies. The act indifferent way to us. The breakfast buffet is simple and nothing special. The waitress are not well trained in their restaurant.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointed
desc: Myself and my friend had been travelling around for a while and decided to treat ourselves and stay in a 4star hotel. The hotel itself was nice, in a good location but overall we were disappointed. The staff were not very helpful, it took us 3 separate attempts to go upto the sky bar. Also we had a transfer booked to the airport but the concierge called the wrong company which caused us to be delayed. Overall nice hotel to stay in, but the most expensive accommodation with the least helpful staff.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location
desc: If you are looking for a moderately priced hotel you can't go wrong with the Peninsular Excelsior, Location is excellent being in just one block from Raffles Hotel and within walking distance to shopping malls as well as the Bugis and Chinatown districts. The nearby MRT station makes getting around extra easy. Excellent staff.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not a Nice Hotel to stay in Singapore
desc: Peninsula Excelsior is not a good option to stay in Singapore, even though it has a very good location overall quality is not good. Our room was not well maintained, bathroom & furniture are old and in bad conditions. General areas (with the exception) of the lobby seem to be poorly taken care of. We asked for a quiet room and they gave us a room just close to a construction site which they never explained.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Unhappy and very disappointed
desc: Rooms on 7th to 9th floors had a TOTALLY obstructed view. We we requested a room change, we were asked to pay an additional $117.00 more per night, regardless of what we had already paid.They even admitted they did not know how much we had paid for the room! Totally unacceptable and very disappointing. I would call this BAIT AND SWITCH!We asked if they would provide us with body lotion as most other hotels do and we were told that it was only for the rooms above 9th floor! Talk about petty...

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Premium club.
desc: Well worth the extra price. Good location, handy to Hop On Bus and within walking distance to Raffles and to Clarke Quay. Room on 21st floor...was changed from 22nd as first room had shower over bath which as seniors we could not manage. Staff very helpful. Great view. Larger room, access to Sky Lounge, free cocktails, two pieces washing .

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very well located in the middle of city
desc: + A great place to stay, well located in the middle of city, very near to shops and MRT. + Service was good and the staff friendly. + The room was clean and maintained on a daily basis. - Overall facility was quite old.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location,near to Raffles City,passing through en route to Australia
desc: 2 nights stay, room big and clean, fantastic view from room. The location was perfect, all within walking distance to amenities like Raffles Bar, the Singapore Flyer, short taxi ride to Chinatown and other activities. Sentosa area was worthwhile for the cable car, Merlion and zipwire.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location, terrible checkin
desc: Checked in 3rd Oct for 3 nights, only to be told our booking had been cancelled. Ended up in a twin room instead of deluxe room, not happy! Checkin staff next morning much better, said they they couldn't see that booking had been cancelled.....supposedly upgraded our room - had a smaller bathroom, step up into bath for a shower, and an airconditioner that leaked and dipped on the carpet! Over it, so couldn't be bothered complaining and having to move again. Beds were like massage tables, too hard! Breakfast was average, same things on buffet every day. Best thing about this hotel is the location and and the lovely lady who checked us out apologising profusely and offered us an upgrade for our next visit. Such a shame as everything else in Singapore was brlliant!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A happy visit
desc: The location of this hotel is amazing, it's just a 3 mins walk from MRT with a lot of shopping malls near by. Harry/henry the receptionist was very nice and friendly, he made our stay very enjoyable. however this hotel is a bit old, but the rooms are still very clean and modern! amenities are great but it would be better if they could provide more towels. the walls are not really soundproof. we also got a upgrade facing the view of marina bay sands hotel at the peninsular tower. it was a happy visit and stay, recommended!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Peninsula hotel
desc: A well located hotel in the heart of Singapore. 2 outdoor pools. The rooms need some refurbishment & we weren't offered welcome drinks. However, for sightseeing it doesn't matter as you're out all day. Easy walking distance to Little India in one direction & Chinatown in another. Great shopping nearby.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location , not too expensive
desc: Room are big and clean , once I arrived in Singapore I stay almost a month in this hotel since my apartment was not ready yet . Price for average room is less then 140 euro in the heart of Singapore . Good compromise . I recommend it ! Enjoy !

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very Average. Long wait to check in.
desc: This is a very average hotel for the price point. There are better options in Singapore. There was a very long queue at check in at 4.00pm in the afternoon, I was only staying one night so did not really appreciate having to wait. Room was very tired and in need of a refresh. Terrible mini bar options.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Centrally Located
desc: Stayed here on our way to Europe and on the way back. We have been here before so we knew what to expect. The rooms were clean but in need of decorating, however we were prepared for that as the location makes up for it. When the hotel across the road is finished being refurbished I think they will have some pretty stiff completion.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Hotel With Kind Sttaf
desc: It's a good hotel in good location and it's only 5 min to city hall MRT(metro) Station.i was there with my family for 6 nights.first in our check in they got us a room next to the elevator in 8 floor. it was a small room but when i ask them to change my room they kindly do it. It was on the corner of 11 floor with two side great view (room No. 1134) & it was Larger.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Just passing through
desc: We stayed in this hotel as past of a Singapore Airlines package. We chose this one with its proximity to Canon Park and Clarke Quay. It is also close to a local eatery hall providing decent food for a fraction of the cost of hotels! We did have breakfast and have to admit it was very ordinary. Worst was pouring what I assume was soy milk over my cereal! UGH! Nevertheless it's location was perfect for us and the one night we were there.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good central Singapore hotel
desc: Two tower blocks with a common 5th floor lobby. Rooms ample sized, good facilities including huge safe. Two pools, one small but one very good; location ideal for downtown Singapore, near City Hall MRT. Like a lot of hotels, too few staff on reception, so queues at times, but otherwise a good choice for a mid range leisure stay or business.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Enjoyed the service
desc: I would like to commend our waitress, Rachel, in Coleman's restaurant last night for her excellent and very friendly service. Enjoyable meal after arriving at this hotel from the airport after a long flight.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Centrally located
desc: With a budget of around SGD200/night. It is undeniably not the best on offer. However, the location is good. City Hall, Raffles City, Boat Quay, Clarke Quay, Fort Canning Park , The Registry of Marriages etc is all minutes away. Check in is fast. I could notice the staff handled their job up to mark and are generally courteous. The room was spacious and well kept. The beds were comfy.I could say the housekeeper really keep the effort to make the room spotless. The onus is that the bathroom could be bigger. My summary- This hotel ain't new, it's not bad either, it's just showing signs of age.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Wrong Answer??? Or underestimate??
desc: Tonite (Oct 21) at 10.12 pm, I want to have some drinks in The Sky Lounge. I came down to the reception and ask them to grant the access to Sky Lounge. I was in proper outfit and they said Ok, but you need to go to level 1 to activate the elevator. Then I went down, and ask them to help me to activate the elevator to sky lounge.... But they look at me from the below to the top of my hair and said "sorry you cant go because you use sleeper".... Then He called reception, and she told me that I cant go up with below reasons: 1. Cant wear a sleeper, I answer that actually I was not wear a sleeper. Then she changed the reason with; 2. Sorry sir the Sky Lounge last order at 10.30 pm, but I answer now 10.18 pm. Then she changed the reason with; 3. Sorry sir, we have a private event

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent for stopover
desc: We stayed at this hotel during our stopover in Singapore. The room was great and spacious, the staff were very accommodating and the location was fantastic - very easy to get around. If we ever got back to Singapore, we'll definitely stayed there again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not nice, unhappy customer.
desc: True this hotel is centrally located, but we felt that the rooms are not well kept. The furniture was old and dirty, not at all what we were expecting. When we booked in we asked that we get a queen bed and was assured that is what we had. When we got to the room, we had twin beds. When asked for this to be rectified, they apologised and said no more rooms were available, instead they pushed the two beds together. Which left us with one bedside table only. The walls seemed to be made of paper as we could hear what was going on in the rooms next to us and in the corridors.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Decent low cost hotel
desc: I have just spent 6days here with my 12yo son. He loved the pools and they were very clean and warm. The rooms although very small were very clean and tidy. The bathroom does have a strange 'wet' odour to it and the shower pressure is like a water blaster to the face! The hot water was a bit touch n go at times. The house keepers were lovely and very efficient and check in/out was very smooth, although the $250 hold on my CC was rather excessive and am still waiting for the reversal. The concierge were very friendly and helpful and a huge asset to this hotel. The sky lounge was empty when we went up just to look at the lights and I think this is because of their strict dress codes and it is not very well advertised. You have to go to the concierge and get their approval on how

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Hotel
desc: Stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel for 5 nights in October with my husband. Very clean, tidy, quiet hotel. Check in and out was timely. Location was fantastic less then 5 minute walk to City Hall Metro and approx. 10 minute walk down to Marina Bay area. 7 eleven convenience store across road with ATM facilities near by. Still a pricey hotel for 3 star but all of Singapore is expensive. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and clean. Rooms were small but clean and tidy. (only bad point would be the small step into the bathroom which we tripped over several times at night so ended up having to leave a bathroom light on! LOL). Gym was equipped with basic needs. Both pools were nice. Front of the hotel was hard to find, a lot of congestion with traffic and road works at that time so

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good hotel to stay at
desc: I stayed at Peninsula Excelsior Singapore hotel for 3 nights which was booked through Expedia. I got a free upgrade on the room at arrival, in the Tower section. It was from superior to delux or the other way? Anyway, I got the higher grade of room. This hotel is comfortable and has an excellent central location. If you are keen on walking, there are a lot of things within walking distance. Even if your comfortable walking range is more limited, there are planty of shoping, eating and entertainment places nearby. If your room is on one of the higher floors, you get a nice view. The room was comfortable with a somewhat sparse decor - nothing on the walls. Unfortunately, the Funan Plaza was next door was under construction, all draped up like a Christo artwork, but there were no

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good value for the Singapore dollar, with a couple of twist to confuse you
desc: Adequate hotel by Singapore standards, although it is actually two hotels sharing a common reception. We were warned that the rooms in the Peninsular were pretty tired, although we never got to confirm this, we were quite happy with our room in the Excelsior side. service was great and the location is AWSOME! Best points were the sky garden, prices to eat there are almost identical to the regular dinning area but the view is to die fore and it is a premier location for the Lazer show viewing or just taking in the tourist view! Hotel is literally 5 minute walk to Clark quay and 10 minutes to China town, MRT access is less than 60 meters from the Peninsular front door. WARNING - the door that the taxi drops you off at is for the Concierge only! The reception is on the 5th floor

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good value hotel in an excellent location
desc: I asked for a higher floor room with a view of Marina Bay Sands and was given exactly that. I could see the laser light show from my room. This is an older style hotel but has great facilities and is excellent value. Walking distance to Clarke Quay and Raffles and also close to the MRT. This is the perfect base to explore this incredible city.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Location
desc: We stayed at this hotel early November 2016. The room we had was OK however it was a room at the back of the Excelsior Tower and was on a corner. We overlooked a building site which had previously been a shopping mall and also the air conditioning units which were noisy. Housekeeping was a bit slow on sorting our room and we were not tidied until 5pm one day. Breakfast was included but was average. The location was good as it is near the Raffles shopping mall which has lots of eateries and shops. It is also close to North Bridge Street where you can get the sightseeing bus. It is also possible to walk to the river from this hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Buffet breakfast wins "worst ever" award.
desc: We stayed at this hotel recently. The location is good. The rooms are ok. The beds are rock hard. But as far as hotels go it's ok. The most disappointing thing is waking up in the morning and going to breakfast. The buffet breakfast looks ok. The choice of food is limited but stardard fare. The one thing you notice very quickly is that all the food is cold or luke warm at best. Bacon. Cold. Sausages. Cold. Hash browns. Cold. Baked beans. Cold. Noodles. Cold. Then I got to the poached eggs. They were in water under a lamp. Bugger me. They were cold too. I couldn't eat them so I went back to the egg station and tried the scrambled eggs. You guessed it..... COLD!!!! I now know why everybody else was lining up for fried eggs or omelette. They are cooked fresh so they are hot. That's

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: luxuzry
desc: Rooms are clean and spacious. Staff are friendly esp the Filipinos. What makes this hotel stand out is the Aquarium type of pool. However, swimming in it makes you feel awkward with the guests checking in.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location, good service. Average breakfast
desc: The hotel located at good location - walk distance to center of Singapore. Room services, facilities are good; high hygiene standard (Singapore's famous :)). Breakfast is average - sufficient for energy recharging, nothing special for breakfast.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location rooms are small views are limited
