desc: Great location, bathrooms and rooms need upgrading but are acceptable. Good pool area and breakfast is good and well priced. Very close to subway and tour buses and city buses walking distance to shopping malls and attractions

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: Hotel location good, good menu choices, friendly helpful staff. One of best restaurant managers we have ever met. Mr Aziz was very friendly and helpful. He will look after your needs well. Only drawback at moment is building behind hotel being demolished and lots of noise from heavy machinery. We were at back of hotel on 17th floor and it goes on 8.30am to 8.30pm, some nights 10.30pm even. Ask for a room on front of hotel to avoid this. We still really enjoyed our 7 nights there. Stayed there before and look forward to staying there again. Easy walk to Boat & Clarke Quays for restaurants, a few minutes to MRT and short walk to Raffles Hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Bit disappointed
desc: As the pricing for a four stars hotel, I don't think it's worth for that. Facilities are bit old ( it's can seen the room facilities like water tape) no shuttles service from hotel to airport ( as a four stars hotel?!) The gym room you will curious that no people there as a guard, even a person there it absolutely not a trained person can handle emergency . (if any guest feeling wrong how you get to know and handle which nobody there?) this is critical which reflect how serious you take care of your guests and as expertise of hospitality

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Definitely worth a stay!
desc: This hotel is definitely worth a stay! It is closeby to most important tourist places and is well connected with public transport. The rooms are larger than most rooms in SG hotels. Add to that, the lovely pool and restaurant which serves awesome food! I was lucky to have not booked any other hotel in Singapore!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: New service: Free international phone calls with Handy phones
desc: To even improve the already excellent service in this hotel, now you have as a free service your handy phone in the room and can connect to a bunch of countries for free. The location is near the Gardens at the bay and near the subway station City Hall and Raffles City Mall.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location in Singapore
desc: The hotel is located in City Hall district which is a 10 minute walk to a lot of major tourist attractions, Clarke Quay, Marina Bay, Raffles, Fort Canning to mention a few. There is also a MRT station around the corner, which is a cheap and easy way to get around all of Singapore. The hotel is not new but the facilities and service are first class. The rooms and bathrooms are on the smallish side but everything is spotless and functional. We would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Location
desc: Good Hotel very Central to shops and transport. Asked for Double Bed and they pushed to singles together. Very good Pool and Gym. Close to Raffles shopping and Chinese area-easy to walk to Riverside eating area .

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Centrally Located
desc: We stayed in SG for just 19hrs. We booked at Peninsula Excelsior Hotel. The staff were accommodating even we were able to checked-in past 12mn. The location is perfect, it's near the Bugis, Little India, Arab Village,.. Marina Bay Sands is also a walking distance...It is near the City Hall MTR.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Stay!!! Exceed Expectation! :)
desc: - Great location (near Cityhall Mrt, malls, 7-11) - Great rooms (No stinking smell on requested smoking room, Huge Bed like super king size and very comfortable, strong aircon, standing shower just right next to bathtub) Special thanks to Staff Melvin who has made our check-in fuzz free. He patiently and attentively meet our requests within his means. He explained clearly with high level of professionalism on the direction to our rooms (2 towers in hotel), breakfast location and time, wifi login details, etc. He is definitely an asset to the firm and we are very greatful and appreciative of his care and service rendered. Thank you Team Excelsior.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: My experience was much better than I expected from the reviews
desc: We visited on our stopover on our return from New Zealand. The hotel was part of our stopover package and was reasonably priced. We paid slightly less for a much inferior hotel that was less central on the way out. I dont know if we struck lucky, but our rooms were well presented, reasonably spacious with good condition furniture and bathroom. The air-con was far better than elsewhere I have visited. It was quieter, less damp and less chilly feeling. We were in the Peninsula tower, I think this might have better rooms. Views were great, courtesy of the demolition of the building next door! Staff were efficient and friendly. I found the bed too hard (as I often do) and housekeeping fitted my a matress topper which was perfect. Central location, relaxing lobby, pleasant

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Decent Enough Hotel
desc: We spent a night here prior to a cruise. The central location is ideal for getting about on foot, and for access to public transport. We arrived mid morning and received a very friendly welcome from the staff. We were delighted when we were allowed into our room at that time, after a long journey. The room wasn't the biggest, but served our needs. There was a fridge in the room, which was handy. The bathroom had a bath and a large walk in shower. There was a good choice for breakfast and we were fortunate that we didn't have to wait.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Mixed experience
desc: Room size ok but bathroom VERY small - watch you elbows when you sit on the toilet! Went to Colemans Restaurant - left without ordering. Very overpriced with very little choice. Waitress struggled to speak English. Would not recommend.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good value hotel near Clark Quay
desc: There's nothing to really fault with this hotel, but there's nothing particularly notable about it either. Certainly for the price, it's great value for expensive Singapore. The room was very comfortable, and the WiFi was good. The bathroom has a strange walk-through shower arrangement, but at least it wasn't over the bath tub. I would stay again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good hotel for location..bad for bulding noise
desc: The location could not be bettered...between Raffles and Boat Quay...we upgraded to include breakfast but our room overlooked the construction site,noisy even from the 16th floor. 1 of 3 elevators was out of action.....chaos breakfast/checkout time.And strange...Reception on the 5th floor.Room appointments were good and room was sizeable.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: We have recently stayed in the Peninsular Excelsior Hotel where we have stayed several times previously. This was the first time that we had breakfast included as part of our package and it was very tasty and a great way to start the day's exploration. The Danishes were a bit heavy, but there was plenty of variety from Wester to Asian to satisfy most customers. since most businesses do not open until 10:30 until 11 am, having breakfast at the hotel makes sense. We choose to say here because of the location - a few minutes away from City Hall MRT station and the Singapore National Galley. The room is comfortable though the air conditioning was a bit cooler, necessitating a trip to Bugis markets some 15 minutes away to buy a jumper to keep warm. Reception was great and the lovely

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Location
desc: Stayed at on the 13 floor and views were ok. Room was clean and tidy but starting to look a little tired. The room had all facilities and great air conditioning. Breakfast in the hotel was average so if you have time there are plenty of alternatives. All the staff we very good and helpful.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good value for money
desc: It's a very good hotel for the price and the location. If you are lucky, you can get a corner room with a view on the Marina Bay and the Boat Quay. The rooms are modern, but the bathrooms aren't, with old fittings and a few quirks. The location is very good, at walking distance from Boat and Clarke Quay, and not far from the Marina Bay either. Also, very close to City Hall MRT, so convenient. The hotel street itself is not the best one, but always safe to walk nonetheless.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A very comfortable and convenient base
desc: Our accommodation was organised with a travel group as we were travelling as a youth soccer team and their families. The hotel was very accommodating and helpful. A few early issues with bedding configurations were sorted out quickly. Rooms had different layouts, some with a large bathroom, others with an ensuite size bathroom. On-site self-service laundry available to do the team's uniform washing was greatly appreciated (ask for details at reception). Pools were lovely and very well used upon our return from the tournament each day. Our kids had a wonderful time and were made very welcome. We enjoyed the location as we could walk to Raffles Plaza Shopping Centre and the MRT Station in 5 mins. Off street covered driveway very handy for the team bus to collect and drop us off.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 3 night stay
desc: Great location, lovely, helpful staff, but the room left a lot to be desired, really bad lighting, bathroom very compact, not as clean as it could be found little bugs in draws, and there was a demolition happening next door and the room shook, literally the tub chair vibrated and moved a few inches while someone was sitting in it.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Value hotel in a good location
desc: Just an overnighter but as per the title good value and a good location. Room was a little compact (especially the bathroom) but it all worked, was clean and the staff helpful. I would stay there again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very good location.
desc: We stayed at the Excelsior for two nights on a Singapore Airlines stopover package and were pleasantly surprised with what we found.The hotel is situated in a great position a few minutes walk from City Hall MRT station and just across the road from the beautiful St Andrews Cathedral with plenty of shopping close at hand. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable with 2 lovely swimming pools(although one was closed for maintenance whilst we were there.Our room was a good size with a good size bathroom unfortunately only a shower and no bath.The only other downside was the view from the window which was a building site. We would happily stay here again next time we are in Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average
desc: Hotel easy to find near MTR station,Enjoyed the stay,room clean but views of a building site.rooms need some upgrading.Tea and coffee making facilities in rooms.Good Breakfast.2 outdoor pools.Expensive to drink here and bar closes at 11pm Hotel staff not very helpful we arrived at 1pm reception staff would not let us into the room till 3pm although room was ready, we had been travelling for 18 hours.poor service.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Perfect stayover
desc: My 80 year old mum and i recently had a two day stay over at your very nice hotel. We had an early flight from Perth, so we were so pleased to get a 7am checkin. Our rooms were adjoining and very spacious and comfortable. Customer service was prompt and attentive. The hotel was in a good location, with a shopping mall opposite, nothing fancy but met our needs. Mum and i agree we'd definintely come to this hotel again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Staycation Expericence!
desc: Our party had an amazing stay at the Peninsula Excelsior and the entire staff displayed the utmost professionalism and hospitality from beginning to the end. The facilities were world class and the service was top of the line. Thank you to Rochelle who gave us an extra ordinary experience. The Breakfast was impeccable with the view of Marina Bay. We will certainly come back for more great experience in the future. Kudos to the rest of the Team of Peninsula Excelsior!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel in the middle of Singapore.
desc: This hotel is locate in good location. Just short walk to Clarke Quay and Esplanade. Easy to take mrt red line to orchard and green line to airport. Room was spacious, nice and clean but show some sign of ages . Sleep quality was good. Hotel staff was nice and quite helpful.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Holidays
desc: Very nice hotel,well located. Room is really spacious and nice. Housekeeping services are just great, very well cleaned everyday with all amenities. Spent a very good time there. The person who is in charge of morning breakfast is welcoming and nice.He Looked after everyone desires.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Awesome views
desc: I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip. My room had beautiful view of the marina bay sands and the business district Skyline. Higher floors have a great view. The breakfast was great with continental and Indian options.checkin and checkout was smooth. Best thing is it's central location just next to St. Andrews Church. Last day I discovered a basement food plaza bang opposite the hotel entry which has a good options for Indian, Malaysian and Burmese cuisines..one more thing I found unique was the provision of use of a handy mobile phone for use by guests during the stay. The phone was preloaded and can be used to make free calls to India, US, UK, Australia and also for internet.i have not seen this facility for guests in any hotel I have travelled. The handy phone also

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: It was just ok
desc: Ok for a couple of nights stay for our Singapore stop over. Near everything as it is located in the middle of the city. For the price it was ok but we stayed in they're older rooms, maybe should have booked the newer ones.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Dated drab room
desc: Stayed here for one night on a stopover to London and glad it wasn't any longer. Room was very dark, dreary and the shower was filthy. We did however for a walk and it seemed to be positioned well and the pool looked nice but overall wasn't happy with the room so wouldn't stay there again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Best Location for Singapore Marathon
desc: We chose the hotel as it was conveniently closed to the Padang where the finish line for the Marathon. What a great choice it was. Just cross the main street and we were at the finishing point of the race able to catch the runners come in and the respective clock times. The hotel is adequate with the usual amenities, clean and reasonably quiet (given a busy Marathon weekend). The lobby is situated off the ground/street level and accessible by lift. It does not look like much at the street level but the lobby is a lot better. Good value for buffet breakfast.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 3 night stay
desc: Nice hotel centrally situated for walking to all amenities and main attractions. Rooms are good but unfortunately ours was next to the lift and was very noisy indeed. Would recommend that you ask for a romantic away from the lift. Nice cafe attached on the ground floor for breakfast.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location!
desc: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights. The room itself is clean and tidy when I we arrived. It's very nice and comfortable hotel. The hotel services is good and they have a smart phone for the customer to use with free unlimited internet access and call time to call to you country! Because it located on the center of Singapore, the MRT (city hall station) is only in 5 mins walking far from here. So you can get to anywhere you would like to go with the MRT and public bus services (I suggest you to buy EZ-link card at the MRT station). Speaking of the room, The day I arrived I faced the bath tub problem. I can't adjust the temperature of water therefore I called plumbers to fix it. Their services is fast and great. The breakfast is not great as much as I thought but it's

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very comfortable
desc: This hotel consists of two large buildings which were independent hotels at one point but now form the Peninsula Excelsior. There is a swimming pool, gym and a sky lounge bar with a strick dress code with sweeping views over Singapore. Our room was large and spacious, the bed and pillows were very comfortable. On the down side on being offered a upgrade to a larger room with an improved view at a price the only view we had was of a building site which even on a Sunday morning had an industrial jack hammer which was in full swing. The noise was horrendous, to be fair to the hotel they had no control over it but we had not been told of what was clearly a major development lasting many months. The staff were great and food interesting but be aware alcohol is stupidly expensive. In

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent Location
desc: Have stayed at this hotel 6 or 8 times in the past and it is always good. Service is great although concierge staff are often busy at check in, but your cases will always get tagged and get to your room OK, never lost anything. If you can afford it, book a room on the 3 top floors in their executive area. It's a bit more expensive but this way you get a better room, plus a better breakfast room and view around the city landscape. Plus between 5pm and 8pm each day, cocktail time with free wine and drinks or beverages, sandwich platters etc. and a variety of nibbles, so need to worry about spending big on an evening meal if you want to save on the budget. It's a two minute walk to the MRT station and a three minute walk to the huge Raffles Place shopping centre where you will

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very good location
desc: I stayed in Peninsula Excelsior twice on a business trip. Excellent hotel. Very smiley and extremely friendly staff. Always ready to help. I had a problem with my i phone and they were so helpful. The hotel location is just prefect. I love the orchids decorations everywhere in the hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location, Helpful Staff
desc: The hotel is really affordable considering its prime location in the civic district, within 5 min walk to a MRT station. There was an issue with my reservation and their reservations manager was very helpful in making amendments in my booking. Room wasn't very big but was comfortable and clean. Breakfast had a large variety of options. Definite a good choice for those on a budget but yet want comfort and convenience.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Lovely accommodation, reasonably priced!
desc: We have just come back from our holiday in Singapore, highly recommend this hotel!!! We stayed at the Excelsior Tower and got the corner room so got a tiny view of the bay! Lovely staff, clean premises. Enjoyed every bit (worthwhile getting breakfast at the hotel as it is a buffet with lots of choice).

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: stay over
desc: I stayed one night in this beautiful hotel and i wish it could have been more. great location in town. Beautiful buffet breakfast. whats not to love about a buffet breakfast. The staff were lovely and the whole operation ran very smoothly. great tidy rooms too.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Bad experience!
desc: The stay at the hotel with awful. Starting in the beginning where we were checking in, they didn't organise enough king size beds for bookings made in advanced. They provided us an upgrade, however they gave me a queen size bed. Now keep in mind that my height and my partners height is 182cm and 200cm. Sleeping was an issue. Furthermore the lady checking us in, failed to wear shoes which was just disgusting. The bathrooms had mould on the floor and our bed sheets had blood stains. The only benefit was how polite and fantastic the concierge staff were and the location. I would re-consider staying here.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Pleasant hotel with convenient location
desc: the hotel's location i great! it is just a few steps to the CITY HALL Station, Raffles Place, and 2 stations away to Marina Bay. the surroundings is perfect for me, not too quiet, and not too noisy. The Hotel Staff specifically the FIlipinos, and 1 Duty Manager (regret that I wasn't able to get the name) are exceptional in service, really went out of their way to assist us and made sure our requests are met. Our room was excellent, we could see the Marina Bay and the beautiful sunset / sunrise of Singapore. Areas that need improvement, the restaurant is a little bit crowded with limited tables, and cleanliness is not that perfect. Other receptionists are not that attentive to the guests' requests. WE have to go back to the reception desk several times to get the answer

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very good
desc: I can offer the hotel. Perfect location, 1 min.from the subway. Fantactic view, good rooms and nice staff. The breakfast was ok. Because the breakfast room in the 5.floor was too crowded, we could go on the last floor. The view was amazing. Only one bad experience: the air condition is running always... to have socks and some warmer clothes for the breakfast could be useful. The prices are ok.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Centrally Located Nice Business Class Hotel
desc: Very good centrally located business cum family hotel in Singapore. Clean and Big rooms, Nice Bathroom, Friendly staff and very good buffet breakfast. Hotel it self have shopping center + nearby many shopping malls and train stations. View from my room is very good. Pleasant stay...

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Comfortable hotel with amazing views of the City
desc: Easy check in after arriving at 2am due to delayed flight with Singapore Airlines. Our room was a Superior room clean, tidy, good size and furnished well with comfortable bed. Bathroom adequate size with trendy washbasin but loose tap. Step up into the bathroom which could be dangerous. A couple of bottles of free drinking water left on top of the fridge. Room overlooked beautiful St Andrew's chruch. Hotel has two pools which we did not use. Good location within easy walk for Raffles and other sights. Would definitely recommend the Sky Lounge on the 22nd floor, which has views to die for, including the Marina Bay Hotel. There is a laser show on each evening at approx 8pm. Breakfast very busy, with wide variety of choice including chef cooking eggs, omelettes, pancakes etc.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Escape the humidity
desc: This hotel has a great central location near St.Andrews Cathedral, the huge Raffles Shopping Mall,........where it is easy to get lost as it is vast. Lots of little local shops, and close access to the metro system. The reception staff in the main lobby are delightful ,and very helpful. We were really.pleased that we could get into our room in the early morning as we were very tired after the 13 hour flight from the UK..The incredible humidity with lots of thunderstorms was a shock after the freezing temperatures of the UK. We were on the 11th floor of the tower where our room was modern and the beds very comfortable..There was tea/coffee making facilities in a medium-sized clean room. Breakfast on the 5th floor had a good selection.....The freshly made omelettes were

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Second visit here.
desc: We stayed here for 2 nights, we stayed last year as well.This time the room although big enough ,had a very tiny bathroom.I also found the neighbour next door had quite a big voice coming through the adjoining door, which was annoying as we needed to sleep.We did ask if we could change or upgrade the next day , but the 2 rooms available were not that different,and still at the same side, and certainly not worth the extra money.The hotel was very full as there was an exhibition there. The lady was very kind and spent a while looking for other rooms though. We were in the Peninsula Tower,on the 14th floor, which we were told is the older of the two towers.As the beds were hard we were given a topper which helped. Our room overlooked a large building site, which meant it was a nice

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: WELL POSITIONED HOTEL WITHIN CITY CENTRE
desc: Our stay at the Peninsula Tower hotel Club room on 21nd floor was amazing with magnificent views of Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Eye and River. All the main shopping malls Suntec, Raffles, Robinsons with a 10 minute walk. Staff courteous enough to make our stay memorable.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average rooms with nice view and pool.
desc: The rooms were average but had a nice view of the city. Tools quite a while to check in but that was due to the trainee at the counter. The outside pools were cool and were a nice addition for the kids .

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Vacation travel
desc: Very good location and very well visited hotel among US travelers. The concierge is very helpful and knowledgeable, ideal when trying to make the best of a short time visit. Walking distance from Chinatown.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not such a great stay
desc: This is my first negative report on any of my reviews..Having stayed a couple of times here before found it to be a good reasonable hotel particularly on executive floor..We arrived fairly early and were given a room immediately on Executive floor whilst we found the staff to be friendly and helpful Im afraid thats where it ends..We stayed 3 nights and on both days after being out till 3pm when we got back our rooms had not been made uo despite putting the sign on to please make up room yet on our last morning from about 9ish our hotel room bell never stopped ringing obviously wanting to do our room despite hotel check out policy being 11am why cudnt they have done our room the previous 2 days at 930am our sign was up please make up room We had a drip leak above our bed the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Poor Housekeeping. Always forget things.
desc: We stayed 4 nights here at this hotel. It is located in one of the good locations in Singapore. Lobby is on the 5th floor. As we stay a more expensive room type in the club floor (like executive floor in other hotels) we are arranged to have breakfast at the sky lounge. Very limited choices. No Chinese or Asian foods there. But it's a good place to enjoy the view if you have time in the morning. Our friends decided to join the 2nd floor breakfast and they said they were making a right decision. Now the problems occurred from the TV, towels, facial tissues, shampoo, soap, tea bags, plates. The first day they did a ok job but forgot to fill in the run out shampoo and soap. Also at the complimentary mini bar, strangely there is no coffee in the room (normal hotels at or higher

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central location spacious rooms
desc: Welll located most sights within reasonable walk Rooms spacious and smart Reception and public areas a bit tired Restaurant and breakfast a little costly Staff friendly and helpful Shopping malls in immediate proximity dated (1980s?) Easy Walk to harbour front china town Clarke key raffles battle box 20 mins Walk to Marina by the bay gardens by the bay little India 40 mins Close to red and yellow tourist bus routes

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Terrible Housekeeping- would not stay with them again.
desc: - Room initially looks pleasant and clean. However after a couple of days stay, Ants started to appear around the room. I had to put food in the bathroom so ants could not get to it. - Asked for 2 additional towels from housekeeping lady, she said she could not spare anymore towels as she didn't have enough, and only could give me ONE. I accommodated once but on the second time, it was the same reply. A big hotel with no spare towels is not acceptable. When i said I need 2 towels as the 1st time it didnt work, i had to share a wet towel with my daughter, she unwillingly gave the 2 towels looking very unhappy. - On the day i was checking out, I looked under the bed to check if my daughter dropped any toys under, and i found a used Men's underwear from previous guest. Obviously

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Awesome hotel management team
desc: Checked in on 14th Jan 2017 and stayed for a night in room 1515 Chose this hotel to celebrate a special occasion & I'm very pleased with the way things turned out. The guest relations Manager, Miss Rochelle and Li Ying, the front Desk Officer were very helpful and responsive to my queries and my request on room decorations and also accommodating to my request of having a room on a high floor with the Marina Bay view. Thank you Rochelle, Liying and the Hotel's Management team for making my stay a pleasant one. Hope to be back in the near future!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: a pleasent stay
desc: we booked this hotel via Singapore Stop Over Holiday ..who we had not used before and found the service very very good...On clearing Customs and Immigration ot was easy to find their desk and we were soon transported off to the Peninsula Excelsior where we had not stayed on previous visits to Singapore and were most surprised at the overall service and our room. Check In at the hotel went smoothly ..strange thing was that Reception was located on the first floor and not the ground. Our room was wonderful and the bathroom area ..well this could have been another room .. it was so big ..had a bath and separate shower that would at least hold two Front Desk staff were very helpful and the hotel has TWO pools Breakfast was not included in the price paid to Singapore Stop Over ..BUT

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent hotel great location
desc: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and to be honest I can't find much to fault it on. The hotel was in a great location within easy walking distance of all the sights. There's a stop for the city Explorer bus 100 yards away which proved very useful. Our room was on the 20th floor (room 2033) and gave us a spectacular view over Clark Quay and Boat Quay and directly up the road towards China Town. The new year celebration was in full swing so the road was decorated with all sorts of lanterns and figures. Wonderful to look at especially at night. The room itself was clean and spacious with an enormous king size bed. The bed was a little on the firm side but not uncomfortably so. The bathroom again was clean and spacious with a nice big walk in shower. The breakfast

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location to access for foods
desc: Stayed here for easier access to a friend's Marriages registration, It is very very near ( about 5 to 10 mins) walking distance to ROM. The hotel exterior looks a bit run down but in fact, the interior was a WOW. Did not expect to have such a spacious room for the price that we paid. Pool access at level L which is the lobby level feels a little weird. Services from all the staff are friendly and helpful - except the guy who did check in for us. Front desk staff should at least give a friendly greetings i suppose. Generally a good stay, right opposite Penisula Plaza which could be a little crowded on a weekend. There is bath tub in the room too! Kids are so happy!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ask for the Excelsior tower which has renovated rooms
desc: I stayed 2 nights in a deluxe double room, booked through booking.com and paid $275 Singapore dollars per night room only. I chose this hotel for the location close to City Hall MRT and moderate price. My husband had stayed there before and knew to ask for a room in the Excelsior tower which has renovated rooms. Our room was very large and comfortable with a super size king size bed and in very good condition.It was quiet and we slept well. I was quite happy with this choice.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A Satisfying Revisit.
desc: My wife and I decided to revisit the Singapore Peninsula Excelsior hotel after our first stay in July 2016. The hotel management respected our choice and arranged a high floor with a luxurious view room. Although the hotel is slightly old, recent renovation and up-keep have maintained it's glory days. Over these years, the hotel has acquired proficient staff who deliver and meet guests' expectation. Location is convenient to food, restaurants, and public transports. Good value for a stay in Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hard to beat for location and value!
desc: This hotel definitely delivers! The staff are super friendly and can't do enough to help - you are always greeted with a friendly smile! The location is spot on - central to everything and only a short walk to Clarke Quay. There are multiple good food options within the hotel - we tried room service, Coleman's Cafe and Spinelli Coffee and all were great. The Sky Lounge is definitely worth a visit offering an impressive range of delicious cocktails and spectacular views! Plus the hotel has 2 great pools so you can escape the Singapore heat! Our room was comfortable, clean and modern. If I come back to Singapore, this hotel will definitely be on my list!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Stop over
desc: Great hotel, great facilities, but most of all wonderful staff. Especially the female concierge who organised our dolphin adventure. All the staff were great. Very clean rooms, accommodated our sleeping needs, nothing to complain about. A very central spot to stay.... taxis were very cheap. Raffles city shopping centre close by. Highly recommended 😊👍🏾

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Decent enough for a short term stopover
desc: Nice enough for one or two nights stopover. If you are planning on staying longer then I would choose a better hotel. Basic rooms that are clean and well fitted out. Staff are friendly and helpful. Pool area is small and not very private.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: Good location. Close to shops & public transport. Arrived at 7am but were helped at around 10am with a room (check in time only being 2pm). Was not happy with the 1st room allocated, but staff were quick to assist and remedy for us. Rooms are of decent size, comfortable and kept clean and tidy. Wifi in rooms were excellent. Breakfast selection was excellent. Will def recommend this to friends & family.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A nice new year in peninsula
desc: Stay here for 2 day in new year,very close to city hall mrt,go to exit b n go left,in the traffic light go right.There are 2 tower,peninsula n excelcior ,the staff in reception gave us a wonderful room in the excelcior tower with a view to marina bay sand which is exquisite in new year night (which i forgot his name,indian),thank u for u. The hotel gave us a handy cell phone to be use,can be use for local n international call and internet too for free and u can bring it outside,very usefull,love it. We got access to the sky lounge that we can't use because apparently people already booked for new year's eve and full,so they gave us the lounge in the 5 floor with calendar n chocolate.The breakfast room is small and we have to wait to be seated, not much of a choice of food,but

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Comfortable and Handy
desc: Good comfortable stay. Huge room everything we needed to relax after walking in the heat of February. Restaurant tidy and friendly staff with well priced food.We were well rested the following morning and breakfast was certainly most welcome. A novel touch is the glass sided swimming pool. Quite a spectacle. Also on the "Hop on hop off" route. Overall a nice hotel, and really handy to a lot of shopping and restaurants.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very pleasant hotel
desc: This hotel is huge and I found layout rather confusing. My room was smaller, but very clean & smart, very modern bathroom, room safe. The fridge was faulty, but quickly replaced when I reported it. Free Wifi. Good views from my room and even better from the top floor lounge. Breakfast was included and a good range of European and Asian foods. The location is good. Only a few minutes walk to Clarke Quay and the river and many other buildings. Helpful staff. I would stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central, but needs an update.
desc: We stayed on the hotel on our way to New Zealand and also on the way back again. Second time we had noisy neighbors (children)so although we were very tired we asked the reception for another room. The service was very good.The hotel is central, but a little bit "worn out". The breakfast is quite expensive, so we chose to walk for breakfast another place.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location with amazing hospitality
desc: The hotel is located right at Marina Bay. The room offered tonus had a beautiful view. We could see Singapore Flyer, Merlion, and the river. Room service was perfect. Room had everything that one can think of. Would definitely visit gain if travelling to Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Family of 14 experience
desc: We had 14 of us booked into this hotel requiring 5 rooms. Up to the 13 floor the lift doors opened and we were overwhelmed with paint fumes. Not one of the 5 rooms was acceptable. Chair had a large wet stain (smelt of urine), carpet in 2 room clearly not vacuumed. Dust clearly visible on most surfaces. The worst was the extensive moulded mould spores in the bath room and even noted on lamp shade. Bathrooms poorly cleaned finding hair in hand basin. We said this was unacceptable and shown other rooms but they too were dirty and mouldy. We were then given rooms on the 21st floor. Appeared to be there best rooms. Whist these were acceptable they were far from clean. I felt the need to wipe over most used surfaces. The airconditioners were very loud and you felt terrible in

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: city must visit
desc: This hotel is centrally located and rates are moderate. It is near subway or metro system, within walking distance to many local sites. The rooftop has beautiful view of the city. The service could not be better. Beautiful city, clean and very tourist friendly! Need at least 5 days to make a dent of the sites and activities the city has to offer. Price for shopping great but you have to know your prices and merchandise to negotiate. There is a variety of quality from cheap to extremely fine, depends on what you are willing to spend. Can't wait to go again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Our third visit here.
desc: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last 15 or so years. We like its proximity to Raffles Centre, City Hall MRT, Marina Bay and the Singapore River. The rooms are comfortable, and the breakfast is just what you need to set things up for the day. It is a run of the mill middle level hotel and you do feel a bit like a chicken on a conveyor belt, but if you can see past that, everything you could want is within easy reach. The proximity to the City Hall MRT means that you can get the transit to and from the airport. The elevators at the stations mean that it is easy to get there with luggage, and the MRT leaves from the basement of Changi Airport. There is a pool at the hotel, and everything else you would expect including good wifi.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: wheelchair accessible accommodation Singapore
desc: We stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior for 10 nights and stayed in a wheelchair accessible room with accessible bathroom and king size bed. The room was very clean, serviced daily, and bottled water & toiletries replaced daily. We were given complimentary chocolates on arrival which was a nice touch. The bathroom had a fold down grab rail on the left of the toilet but none on the right as the vanity was on that side. There was a large fold down seat in the wheel-in shower with a detachable hand held shower rose on the wall. There was room in wheel under the vanity sink and the wall mirror was at the right height for a seated person. There was sufficient room to manoeuvre a wheelchair around the bed and to the large window which had a lovely view of the park and city. The

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: At least the room Staff were nice
desc: Clean and simple, if you are not planning a long stay its fine although they are currently building next door so its OK if you are out all day exploring. Don't book a room with breakfast, the Coleman's breakfast bar is poor and even ay 7.09 filled with too many people, Range of food poor and could hear the "chewing' from reception. There are better cafes and even 7/11 close which is handy as there is a fridge in the room. Exec Suite a waste of money and you can get to the Skyroom to buy a drink anyway they just wont let you eat 5 corn chips and a manky piece of cheese. Very poor offering for an Executive Buffet and if paying for exec room better to save of on a lower cost room and go to a decent bar. Very handy local to MRT and shops.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Room Nice size and perfectly supplied
desc: We just returned from Singapore and stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel and enjoyed our stay. The highlight of our stay was a visit at night to the 22nd floor outdoor decks. Now unsure if these are open to all guests or not as I tried 3 times to go to this floor both tapping my keycard and then pressing 22 and also just pressing 22 by itself also and nothing worked. We only got lucky as someone from the 22nd floor just happened to call the elevator while we were in it trying to reach the floor HA HA but worked out and they let us go out and enjoy the night time view of the city see the photos attached! As I said though being I had issues getting there unsure if this is an all guest access floor or if this is a members only floor. The room we had was quite large had 3 beds

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location and service
desc: We used this hotel as a post cruise place to chill before an evening flight home to the uk and found the location to be superb check in was great too and we got our room at 10am which made for a relaxing final day of our holiday wouldn't hesitate to stay again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Comfy bed but chaotic atmosphere
desc: Stayed here as most people on a stopover for a couple of nights. We have stayed in several hotels in Singapore ad whilst his one is in an excellent location for many attractions it lacks atmosphere . Our room was not very clean - carpet needed vacuuming and here were long dark hairs in the bathroom - definitely not ours ! The bed was very comfortable and the air con was good .

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location!
desc: Excellent hotel with friendly staff and the hotel is located in a very good area. There is an Mrt about 3 minutes from the hotel and many major shopping malls are just at walking distance.... Breakfast was great with many varieties

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location and service
desc: We were given an amazing view of the city and Marina Bay from our bedroom. Was also given access to the rooftop which enhanced the whole experience. Fantastic photo opportunity from the rooftop. Checking in was a bit disjointed, having to take the lift to the lobby but the staff smoothed it all out. Excellent location, very close to the Raffles City MRT which just about takes you to the different places of interest. Rooms are clean, staff attentive, the breakfast was well worth the extra money, made it all so easy when having to go to the airport on the same day.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: First Class Stay
desc: I arrived in Singapore by sea. It was very easy to get to the hotel. The hotel was central and near to tourist attractions. Easy access to the metro and on/off bus. Reception/check in was efficient. I was offered a king size room for no additional costs.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Location great room need a proper renovation
desc: Stayed in this hotel a couple of time by now and I always adore the location. Its in the centre of everything (City hall MRT station is around the corner, Clarke quay and bugis is 10 minutes away by walking, Marina bay sands 30 mins away by walking and other tourism area. The room is quite old, you can tell they did a renovation already but it just not good enough. The price is great compare to its competitor. However, The bed is very hard i had a back pain after 3 night staying at this hotel. If you are looking for easy access to everything (tourism area) with a reasonable price, this hotel is perfect.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel
desc: The first impression when I saw the building was an old building. But the inside was quite modern. I think they already did the renovation. Because in the bathroom all the ceramic and closet were new. The bedroom covered with carpet. Since I'm allergic to dust at first i was afraid that I might had my allergy. Surprisingly I'm not. Either it was new or their housekeeping did a great job cleaning. The hotel is next to peninsula plaza, capitol piazza and also near city hall MRT. I really enjoyed my time in this hotel. Although I would asked the hotel to change the middle curtain or add a vitrage or whatever since it was so bright when morning.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Pretty disgusting. Go somewhere else.
desc: There was cockroaches at Breakfast three days in a row. Rooms smelt like paint. Carpet was never vacuumed. Mould in rooms. Location was good but that's about it. Took 14 of us there and we should have definitely gone somewhere else.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Rude Staff, Cockroach at the fridge counter
desc: It's my second time staying here and my first time was Great. Now there's something bad happened that forced me to write this. When I saw the cockroach this morning, I thought I should complain but when I saw the man who gave me new towels since he was really nice then I said to myself "this is just minor, as long as they have good service", then everything is fine. However, just now, there's a lady (one of the staff) I believe, happened to encounter me, was at the ground floor waiting for the lift she was looking at me from head to toe and didn't even smile when I try to smile at her. I let her go in to the lift but when she got in, she rudely asked me "do you have a card? , which floor are you going to? where's your card?)... I said, wow! It's first time for me to

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel, good location
desc: used for the Singapore Airlines stop over. About half an hour from the airport, good 'harbour area' location. Basic hotel, but clean and tidy. Good location. Wifi. Free 'Handy' tour phone offering guides and attraction discounts. Several outdoor pools, and a great (smart dress invite only) roof top bar/snack restaurant offering spectacular views over the harbour. Weirdly no actual 'real' bar to socialise in, but maybe that because its built over a shopping centre ? TIP: this hotel comprises of TWO towers of differing standards; Hotel check in is on the First (not ground floor)

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Tired
desc: Average hotel, tired rooms in need of rennovation, Worn out gym with limited choice, poor breakfast, ok staff- you can find a lot better for a similar price in singapore. Location is however quite good.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central position
desc: Arrived very early in the morning and were advised to leave our bags at the baggage drop and come back later. Took the opportunity to have a look around the shops and get something to eat. Came back around midday, but room still not ready. Another half hour and we managed to get checked in. Good sized room and comfy bed. Tea/ coffee making available. Fridge, safe, to and free WiFi. Lots of complimentary bits ( toothbrush and paste, comb, sewing kit, slippers, shampoo etc. Always nice to have these in case you forget to pack them. The hotel has two outdoor pools, a gym, sauna and does a few treatments. Didn't have time to use these as we only stayed one night. There's a bar and restaurant and we found all the staff, very helpful. The hotel is well situated to go down to the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not a 4 star hotel - Maybe 3
desc: outdated hotel, not well maintained, needs lots of refreshing to be able to charge prices they charge. It has great lobby but also needs some refreshing, pool and gym nice but not big enough for big hotel

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Staff freindly and good location
desc: This hotel near important landmarks can walk around fort canning park can walk here not far and merlion park and the arts house singapore very comfortable good location and staff freindly inroom big bed and bathroom

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location and all you need in a hotel
desc: We have just spent 5 nights at this hotel, we notified the hotel reservations team that it was for my partners birthday and they generously upgraded us to the 20th floor with a view to Clark Quay. We booked through Agoda, good rate for what I would rate a 3 1/2 star hotel. The room was not overly large, but we had two singles joined together which gave us a HuGe bed, (they fixed this for us on our arrival as we had twin beds). We had a wardrobe and fridge, to and desk. There was a slight musty smell when you first opened the room but not enough to warrant complaining. My only issue was that the shower was over the bath but didn't have an attachment so you could stand under it. You had to hold it with one hand which wasn't really convenient. I was a bit surprised and

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent location
desc: The hotel is located near Mrt and Boat Quay. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The staff friendly and helpful. The only drawback was our room overlooked a building site where work went on throughout the night The double glazing masked some noise but not all . Hopefully the work will be finished before I next return!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A decently located and good value for money place to stay
desc: My wife and I have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Peninsula Excelsior. This is the third time we have stayed there in recent years although I first stayed there way back in 1993 when what is now Marina Bay and Gardens by the Bay was full of ships and the East Coast Parkway (that crosses Marina Bay) was being built. If we return to Singapore again (and we hope that we do) we would happily stay there again. If that’s enough of a recommendation for you then read no more. If you want more detail then read on. It’s a decent hotel and, provided you shop around, can be had for a good price. This time we booked it through ebookers and paid just over £100 a night for a deluxe room on a room only basis. Given the hotel has two swimming pools, a gym and lots of other visitor

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The hotel smells
desc: The good things about this hotel is its central and convenient location, and if you have a high level floor facing Marina Bay, you would have a very nice view. The most terrible "feature" of this hotel is its musty and stale smell with slight left over smell of cigarette smoke everywhere. In the first night, inhaling the smell during deep sleep woke me up 3am in the morning, I couldn't go back to sleep anymore. In the following, by the advice of in one of TripAdvisor review, I found out that turning off air conditioning made the situation better, then I was able to sleep. If you search the word "smell" in TripAdvisor for this hotel, you will find that there are many complaints about smell. If you are someone sensitive to smell, stay away from this hotel. The hotel also charges

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Wasn't the best
desc: When you first walk into the hotel, you expect to see reception. Not here, all you see is a sitting area and the concierge. No signage really to tell you you need to go to lifts and go up to another level then find reception. Not the best start when you are tired and weiry. Room was dirty, found a load of sawdust on carpet next to one of the beds, obviously not cleaned and room absolutely stank of cigarette smoke. Beds were hard as rocks and was put in a room that was directly outside 2 massive generators from next building, that constantly hummed loudly so sleep was poor. Buffet breakfast was very nice, lots of variety and seemed to be the only good thing about the hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice, clean and friendly.
desc: Stayed for only one night before a cruise, and this hotel is nice, clean and friendly, and well suited for a short or medium stay in Singapore. Breakfast was a bit crowded, but there was something for everyone. Location is good for experiencing this beautiful city.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent Hotel and Staff
desc: Stayed for 4 nights and had a very enjoyable time. Nice size rooms, food good and staff very helpful. On last morning we got upgraded to the VIP lounge for breakfast which was really nice, Good location.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average but not too bad
desc: We stayed 4 nights at Excelcior Wing, room is spacious, neat and clean. City Hall MRT station is 7 minutes walking from the hotel, not too bad. If you enjoy swimming, the hotel has 2 swimming pools, and the staffs are friendly

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good enough
desc: Nice location. Very near MRT and bus stops. Some shopping areas within walking distance. Rooms are just right. Personnel are helpful. Buffet breakfast is good enough. There's a food court across and convenience stores and coffee shops nearby.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Overall good experience
desc: While not an imposing place,it has a feeling of high standards,staff are very helpful,and the food is good.Choice of 2 pools is nice,and all the poolside amenities are fine.The only thing which is a slight let down is the ladies changing room facilities by the smaller pool,very tired looking and not very much room.mobile phone provided was a great idea.Spinelli downstairs was a reasonable coffee and tea option.All in all ,esp the soft piano background in the lounge,a restful place to be.Taxis right outside.Cathedral just opposite has a new attractive coffee shop too!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great central position
desc: A basic holel..I had good service from reception..allowed to check in early..received the type of bathroom I requested.The room is basic ,no pictures on the walls...decent bathroom with lots of shower gell etc.Room was always cleaned..beds changed every day.There is building going on next door..I was on the 11th floor of the Excelsior tower and had no problems with noise,maybe lower isn't a good idea.Two very nice little pools..noise from the building work at the waterfall pool but the other pool was much quieter,they're open till 9 pm. so very nice for an evening swim with all the surrounding lights from the skyscrapers.I,d stay again,mainly for its easy access to the transport system and walking distance to lots of the local sites.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very Good
desc: Everything will be alright if you can't speak english correctly. The reservation staff will kindly to help you. The best facility that I like was free a smartphone. It can be taken anywhere, we can make calls for local and international for free. It includes for free internet access. The Hotel is near with City Hall MRT and only 4 minutes to walk to City Hall MRT, near with bus station such as Armenian Ch, Grank Park City Hall, Opp Peninsula Plaza, St. Andrew's Cath, Opp The Adelphi. We can get Marina Bay Sands's view from room.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Such a late response
desc: I was staying 4March for 1 night and made a reservation 2 rooms. I had put deposit for 2 rooms around SGD 330+ but i havnet received my deposit. I already sent mail about my deposit. HOWEVER still i didnt get back deposit. It already overdue 1 month. Such a late response. I understand refund's process quite takes long time. But need to take 1 month ? Seriously ?

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Poor check in experience otherwise fine
desc: Disappointed with check in. Arrived early after cruise at 9.30am Understood check in not till 2pm however was advised that our club room would be ready in an hour. Sat and waited until close to 11am and went to check in. Advised room not ready till 1pm. Ok...decided at this point we had lost some valuable time in our short stay and we would go out to explore a bit of Singapore. Came back just after 1pm to be told come back at 2pm. As you can imagine. .not happy. If the expectation had been set originally that is fine..we would have headed off for 4 hours but instead we spent time back and forward thinking we could check in Otherwise room was fine. Quite a musty smell but no real issue. Odd shaped bathroom and had to sit at an odd angle on the toilet or open the shower

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Service
desc: Great Service must be recognised. We stayed in room 1927, 6 & 7 Mar 17. I could not access the Wi Fi. The Duty Manager Harry a very cheerful and friendly young man, spend 20 minutes sorting out my problems. They were my tablet's not the Hotel's. He was great at explaining everything. I was concerned about the amount of time he was spending. "You are a guest too". Other guests were not kept waiting. Our room was good and came with little extras you rarely see any more, a large room safe, shoe cleaner and free bottle water to mention a just a few. Great Service will encourage us to return to the Peninsula when next in Singapore. Harry thanks so much for your OUTSTANDING SERVICE. John C.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Efficient and pleasant stay at Peninsula
desc: The moment you enter the property, it is efficiency you experience through out. Prompt and courteous staff, good and clean rooms. Commuting is easy to all places in town. Breakfast is reasonable, could be better. If there on a weekend, don't miss the buffet lunch or dinner. I would highly recommend it if you are looking for a well-located, well-appointed not-too-expensive hotel in Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Stayed for a total of six nights in March 2017
desc: our room was quite large compared to our room in Japan. The air conditioning was magnificent. We arrived at the hotel at about 8-30 am, Cruise ship docked early had a 2 hour wait for our room . No worries the café on the ground floor had all that we required. The hotel staff were magnificent, helpful in all ways, I was surprised on how good the breakfast was, after reading some of the reviews for this hotel. The meals were hot with plenty of variety, both European and Asian. My only complaint was that the Tea and Coffee were not hot enough. The hotel is close to just about everything we wanted to do in Singapore, Having been there 7 times before. The TV needs the sound to be increased. WILL DEINATELY STAY HERE AGAIN.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, good value
desc: The Peninsula Excelsior is well located, just across the road from City Hall MRT station, a short walk from most heritage sites and museums, and close enough to walk to the waterfront and the Merlion. The hotel is in an old building, and decor in the rooms are similarly old fashioned, although some renovation has been done. Room size is adequate, and the provision of a free handy phone is a plus. Breakfast is similarly adequate. All in, it's good value for money at a terrific location, but don't expect quick or slick service.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Big rooms
desc: Quite central for many attractions walk to the new gardens by the bay a lovely place to visit but the large hotel maybe not new but in good condition with a massive lobby and late check out is good if you have a late flight to catch and can stay in the hotel you can only reach your room via the lift by your keycard (security) the rooms are large for a one bed ours had two large windows for a view of the city with a window seat .the double bed is large the bathroom not so big but with a bath shower It is a quite comfortable room with soft seats and quiet except when the air con. Is on it is a little bit noisy the safe is tall and roomy the room was vey clean with a linen change every day there is two pools a decent restaurant and a cocktail bar on the 22floor the sky lounge with

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Just a quick stopover
desc: I booked a room through Singapore Airlines Stopover option. I arrived at 9pm and had to leave the hotel at 6.30am the next day, so it was only a brief trip. However the room was a good size, clean and well equipped. Luggage was delivered quickly, room service was prompt. If you need a place to crash for the night, this hotel is a good option.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nasty
desc: What to say. Grotty little room,v unpleasant tiny bathroom. Inefficient room staff,had to be asked to make the bed. The room wasn't cleaned. BUT ,the breakfast was good. Would I stay there again.....definitely not.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: overnight stopover
desc: Rooms were comfortable and staff were friendly, but aircon struggled and we had no reception on TV. We were tired so had an early night. We had a 6am pick up in the morning, but could not get any hot water in the shower. Reported on checkout. Hotel is opposite Peninsula Plaza where they sell many items for the locals and bargains. Also food hall is cheap and tasty.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Crawling with insects!
desc: Tired, dated, rude staff, and crawling bugs in the room! Not best pleased, and when we reported the crawling bugs, a member of staff arrived with fly spray to deal with them! No apology and when asked for a room move, declined! With so many hotels to choose from, this is one to avoid!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Peninsula Excelsior Hotel
desc: Stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel for 2 nights 1-2/3/17 pre-cruise. Hotel is located in an ideal location to all amenities. This is an older building but very well maintained throughout. Nice rooms and excellent facilities. Good breakfast spread as well as evening dining in the restaurant as well as the bar facilities. Staff were attentive and polite. Difficult to fault. I've stayed here before quite awhile ago and will not hesitate to stay the again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: This hotel has memories as the Peninsula was where we spent our honeymoon 24 yrs ago. The staff are very welcoming and pleasant.The room was nice,clean and large enough for our needs. We have only stayed 2 nights but they have been very pleasant.The location is great and walking distance to a lot of the attractions along the river Enjoy

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Holidays
desc: The staff are great they will go the extra mile to he lp the customer at the peninsula motel The room is spacious and the view outstanding the food is first class Aspecial thank you to Ben who assisted us with our Not fo forget what agreat service to have use of the free infocus phone congratulations hopefully this idea will go around the world

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Location
desc: This hotel has a good location but that is about the only good thing about it! Service was OK, but without empathy or even a smile. There was extensive mould on the 8th floor in the hallways and at least 5 bathrooms. When we arrived on level 8 there was a very unpleasant odour which appeared to come from an electrical device. One lounge chair had a large stain which was most probably caused by urine It took management more than 3 hours to relocate a family of 14. To say the least we were NOT at all happy

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good
desc: I stayed for 3 days here, very comfortable room, nice service and fast check in processes The breakfast was delicious with a varied menu. Unfortunately, first and third day was same :( The hotel have 2 swimming pools😉

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not so great in Room 1318
desc: The best thing about this hotel is the location, walking distance to Boat and Clarke Quay, Chinatown, The Raffles and my new Singapore favourite, Chijmes. Check-in was straight-forward but unfortunately the only positive to report about Room 1318 was the view across to Marina Bay Sands. A damaged window seal meant that all external noise, including the rumble and bang symphony from the TWO construction sites adjacent to the hotel permeated our room at all hours of the day and well into the night. The much promoted Handy phone was missing from our room, and it was not until after two calls and a visit to the concierge that I was informed it was being repaired and offered a replacement. Air-conditioning was not able to be adjusted in any way, but the noise did help drown out

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Close to all amenties
desc: After arriving from a 14 day cruise check in went very smoothly our room was on the 22nd floor even though there was a view if you looked down you could see building construction site. Room was very spacious, clean and the bathroom had a separate shower, then a bath with a hand held hose. Towels were lovely and fluffy . The only down side to the hotel was on entering you had to walk past people who were smoking we did mention it to the staff but as they said its not part of the hotels land and unfortunately there wasn't anything they could do. Overall besides from that a great stay of 7 days and close to everything would we stay there again most certainly.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Time to work on some rennovation
desc: The hotel is very nicely located with some sort of underground shopping center that has a lot of music shops, The Lobby is located on the 4th floor for some reason and it is huge, the hotel has 2 towers, the one i stayed at well needs some renovation, though it is nice, clean and tidy and the staff are extremely cooperative. The breakfast was just OK, exactly what you need. The stay was ok, but i think I will check another hotel for my next visit.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Graham Tangye
desc: Very central position to most attractions.Chinatown and a number of train stations. Our room on 16th floor was quite large but the bathroom was small due to the large high bathtub. A lot of sharp edges in bathroom and could be dangerous for elderly guests Staff were excellent and breakfast was also good. I would return again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Terrible
desc: Whilst Brian on reception has been extremely helpful, this hotel is tatty, uncomfortable and disorganised. The first room I was shown to the wallpaper was peeling off the wall. The shower was dirty and rusted. The bathroom set up for the shower, in other parts of the world would not pass health and safety standards. The smell of damp was overpowering. I was then shown a second room whilst the bathroom is much better, the toilet cistern cover was off. The toilet roll on the holder had been wet and left and the spare roll was wrapped in plastic on top of the open cistern. The safe in the room was broken and beeping. When I rang for laundry service I was told they only pick up once a day. When I went into the club house and had my club house letter it took them almost 10

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Decent & Clean
desc: Was happy with our stay there for the one night. Close to Raffles City. Clean and staff efficient and friendly. Impressed with decor. Breakfast was impressive too with plenty to choose from the buffet.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Back again - Good Location
desc: This is the third time I have stopped at this hotel. The main reason is it's location. It is in walking distance of Clarke Quay, Orchard Road and the City Hall MRT Station (Subway). The room facilities are what you would expect. Comfortable bed, Good Shower. Air-conditioning works well and temperature can be adjusted in the room. I love the big lobby on Level 5. You can get drinks and light snacks while waiting for friends. It costs about $25.00 from the Airport to this hotel. by taxi. I used the shuttle from the airport to this hotel. if traveling by Singapore Airlines it is free. The only downside this visit was that there is a building being constructed next to this hotel and they work late at night in Singapore. It didn't trouble us too much, you cannot here much noise

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Perfect hotel with a great view
desc: It was a great stay as the hotel as all the facilities which a person would require. - Close to Marina Bay - World class hospitality - Singapore flyer View from room - River walk is walking which is a great place for evening hangout - MRT station is 100mte away. - Room is pretty clean with a good smell all the time. - Morning buffet breakfast has all the American menu option which u can think about Trust me this is the best hotel in its class.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: quite Ok, but outdated
desc: Due to a mistake related to our early check-in option, we got (after a lot of waiting and negotiating) a superior room. The room was quite noisy (even on the 21st floor traffic was very loud). The airco was switched on automatically when leaving the room, which makes your bed feel like an ice cave when you come back. Well located though.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: The Peninsula Excelsior is accessible, just a five minute walk to the City Hall MRT station. There are several attractions well within a 10-15 minute stroll: Merlion Park, Suntec, Raffles, several museums, Orchard road, etc. The staff were helpful and attentive but the hotel really shows its age, a renovation is over due.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: Excellent location for site seeing, very clean nice rooms, but all about location. Didnt have breakfast so can't comment but loads of choice locally. Easy walking distance to Clarke Quay etc and many more attractions.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good value, good location and only a few minor disappointments.
desc: I'd would have given this hotel a 4 star review if the service was a little friendlier, it was okay, business like but not many friendly smiles. Room was very good, spacious, clean with all the usual amenities. Great bathroom with tub and large separate shower and a large range of toiletries. Comfortable beds for a good nights sleep. Range of breakfast for westerners wasn't great, but the chef did cook a great omelette. Can highly recommend the location close to everything, including Raffels City. In summary the hotel ticks most of the boxes and good value. great coffee shop on ground floor main restaurant is good but expensive especially alcohol. Note however reception is on 6th floor.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Over priced but well located
desc: The hotel is very well located at the heart of the city. But for the price it is not good value. The room is a reasonable size but the building and quality of everything is dated. The reception were particularly un helpful with anything outside of the standard check in or check out.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 4 nights in march
desc: Location is excellent if you need to be close to the CBD. Hotel is very dated with lobby area, breakfast cafe, checking and concierge all on separate levels and in separate connected buildings. Food average at best (fortunately, Spinelli's is next door and good options are in easy walking distance) at above average price. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms small and dated - drab dark brown timber furnishings with dark carpet and curtains. Bathroom was adequate size with separate bath/shower.. Only real asset is location.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Serves Its Purpose
desc: Hotel room is small. It's clean and is located centrally near city hall station and raffles city. breakfast was bland. better be looking for other options nearby. singapore is very hot and was very irritated when been given only 2 bottles of complimentary water per day of our visit. As a summary, if you're on a budget, there are worse options, so I guess I would recommend staying here.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central and excellent standards
desc: One night only but very good position .. 10 min walk to riverside restaurants and 5-10 min walk to Bugis Markets and the various malls. Good pools and gym was ok but not great. I can recommend this place no problems.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: I have enjoyed my stays at the Peninsula Excelsior very much
desc: I loved the hotel the staff are very friendly and pleasant. But last time the room wasn't very satisfactory, as it was one room away from the lift which was working all night. Hence not much sleep. Hope next visit will be better.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hotel
desc: Well worst hotel stayed in noisey building works all day Rooms need updating never go back way overpriced Good view if you can put up with noise of building works till 6pm at night ended up moving to other hotel

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Pleasant experience at Peninsula
desc: I have stayed at Peninsula Excelsior for 2 times now. First time was in 2011 and second was a month back. Both the times i stayed with my family. Below are the good things i liked about this property. The property is located in the Marina Bay area and has a close proximity to Sentosa and Universal Studios. Plus there is a 7 11 shop right next to the hotel which makes it easy to buy certain items if required. Lastly there are couple of Indian restaurants at a 2-3 min walking distance from the hotel, so that was a big advantage for me and my family. In each of the rooms a smartphone was given by the hotel for our use. It came with a 4g speed and we could make unlimited calling and data surfing using it. This is a really nice initiative taken as its helpful for tourists like us

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Outstanding city views
desc: Great Hotel in good location close to Singapore CBD. Very well appointed and the view from our room over Singapore harbour was the best view I've ever had. 5 minute walk to fantastic restaurants and bars. Staff very helpful.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Singapore stopover
desc: We stayed here from 4th-7th of April. There were issues with rooms, we were traveling as a family of seven. The triple room had to be changed, very strong smell of what I can only describe as damp. The other two rooms had 2x single beads even though we had booked doubles, this they resolved the next day. The hotel is very well situated, but in need of a bit of an update. The room was clean but a bit "tired". We had breakfast included, which was varied and good food. The hotel has two pools, Sauna etc, but we didn't use it. All in all, it's not a bad hotel if your only using it as a base, if I was staying any longer, I would spend a bit more on one of the other near by higher rated hotels.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great value and perfect location
desc: We ended our Far East adventure with an eight-night stay at the Peninsula Excelsior. We'd booked another hotel near Chinatown but construction next door forced us to change. We arrived dog-tired at the Peninsula at 3:00 am and our first impression was very good. The room was modern and spacious, much better than expected for the price.
