We'll certainly book this hotel on our next Singapore trip and recommend it to others.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: big room in Singapore
desc: The hotel is old but well kept. Room is big comparing to the other hotel in the same level in Singapore. Location is good; near City Hall MRT station and able to walk to Clarke Quay if you don't mind little exercise. There are shops and restaurants nearby. Check-in/out is fast. Restaurant during breakfast is crowded.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Fantastic service
desc: Travel regularly to Singapore for business and have stayed here lots of times. After an average experience once we decided to try other hotels for comparison so this visit was the first for quite some time. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay except perhaps for the noise from the construction and roadworks just outside. This of course is no fault of the hotel. The breakfast in the Sky Lounge was also very basic but the service from the staff in the Sky Lounge was exceptional. Always felt very welcome and at home and they even made a fuss of my birthday which was totally unexpected. Will definitely be back next visit.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Underwhelming
desc: On arrival for our 4 night stay we were told we had been upgraded from a superior to a deluxe room. Yay. I wonder what a superior room was like if we were in a deluxe. There was no wardrobe nowhere to put our clothes, one spot to put one suitcase. The room was very small, the bathroom was also very small, the vanity basin had no storage space to put our toiletries, the shower was over a bath that you had to step into with a shower curtain that looked old and tired. Lighting in the room was inadequate, always seemed dim which did not enhance the ambience at all. If that was disappointing, the bed was shocking. We spent the first night sleeping on what seemed like a table top, it was so hard, hardest bed I've ever tried to sleep on. Not a great start to our Singapore trip.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location and easy walk to China Town
desc: We stayed for a couple of night on a stop-over. The Hotel was close to china town and the Maxwell Food Centre. We found we could walk just about anywhere. The room was small, but clean. We used the pool a fair bit to beat the Singapore heat. There are plenty of good food courts and Hawker centres nearby to get food.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Pleasant room
desc: we stayed 2 nights here. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Room was comfortable and clean with a view being on the 7th floor. Hotel was busy and full with guests. 2 swimming pools and a gym. Breakfast had a wide range of foods to cater for most people tastes and diets. Handy to raffles shopping centre and walking distant to the marina.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Soulless
desc: Nothing special here at all. Just a very soulless place. Serves its purpose for a one night stopover, but not a place to love. Only plus for me was the very hard bed, but some travellers may not prize even that.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Too crowded due to next to the shopping center
desc: Supposed to be 3.5 star hotel. Location is good, near Clark Quay and across Peninsula Plaza. Staffs weren't too friendly, too noisy in the ground floor, has similar access with Peninsula shopping center. Foods are really average. Handy phone in each room is a plus point, plus the room is well cleaned.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: AWESOME hotel
desc: This hotel I would so highly recommend. It has the friendliest staff top of my list Rochelle you do a truly wonderful job of making your guest's feel welcome and enjoy their stay. The hotel is spotless we upgraded to s club suite on arrival and so happy that Rochelle offered the option to us. Our room had the most magnificent view over the bay. The location would have to be the best to access all means of transport for getting you around the sites of this beautiful city. So I recommend you look no further do yourself a favor and book this hotel you will be happy with the choice. Pics are views from our room 2200

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Well located!
desc: The hotel was located in city hall and as well not far from Clark Quay ,5minutes away from all the bars and restaurants. Many malls as well around, the location was really great! The room was small even with the upgrade we didn't have enough space, very basic and a little bit old. They need to do a refurbishment especially the bathroom.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great for short stay
desc: Spend a night here before leaving for legoland at JB. Location was great (as other reviewers pointed out too). 5 minutes to City hall Mrt. However, i went there on Sunday and there were a lot of people (i think its a day off for maids/workers like in Lucky plaza) opposite the hotel and in side roads in front of the hotel. Wasn't a good view. They were there at nights too. A couple people were drunks and loud. People also sitting blocking the way to the hotel. I had a stroller and it wasn't easy to reach the hotel walking from the Mrt. The rooms though were okay. There were space. I liked the King- bed size. Bathrooms were also a good size and there was a small bathtub. I felt the floor was uneven though it was carpeted. Didn't have breakfast here.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 3 nights in singapore after a cruise from Auckland to Singapore
desc: After spending 3 nights at the Peninsual Excelsior couldn't praise them enough. Rooms excellent, very clean and staff just brilliant. We had to get a Doctor at 3 in the morning and had Manager and Staff just couldn't do enough for us. Came and checked on us af ter Dr had been a few times. Meals at the restaurant on the 5th floor great and staff there also so good. Always so pleasant and helpful didn't matter which part of the hotel you were at. Would go back there anytime.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Re visit after 31 years 2017
desc: In 1986 my present wife and I stayed here and got engaged to be married, we stayed in room 1313, we went back this year to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary, I requested OUR room again if they still had it and they did not disappoint. The service in the hotel is still good however the tower we were in is due for a much needed refurb and there is a lot of nearby construction, non of of this spoilt our stay, Thanks for the memories.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice and convenient for a short stay in the city center.
desc: Good value for money. Very good quality and comfortable rooms, nice swimming pool, 20min walking to the Marina Bay and less than 5min to subway station. Great view from the rooftop. It's good for a short stopover in Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Quite OK
desc: But not really a four star place. Best thing anout this hotel is the great location, practically everything can be reached on foot amd if you prefer transportation than the next MRT station is 5 min walking. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful too!!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Location, Location, Location
desc: The Peninsula was fine, nothing special. The rooms were adequate and the breakfast somewhat disappointing. But the staff was helpful and you can't beat the central location.The hotel is close to everything.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: DONT STAY HERE-415 SINGAPORE DOLLARS FOR A POOR EXPERIENCE
desc: 1- over priced 2- poor service 3- NOISEY- construction 4-dated interior 5- unhealthy food options 6- $415 for a poor substandard experience 7- Very expensive (14$ for a beer $20 for rice) 8-45 minutes to check in (after a long flight)

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 2 days stay
desc: The hotel is in a great location but it is average, nothing special and a bit pricy. It is OK for a short stay in the City center. Our room overlooked a construction site and for that reason it was very noisy. In addition, early in the morning we were awaken by the houskeeping who were talking loudly in the corridor outside our room, which was a bit annoying.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but that's it...
desc: This hotel is perfectly placed in Singapore and I believe it has potential but the staff let it down completely. We had 3 rooms in our party; one family and 2 doubles. None of us got what we had reserved! The family room was damp and right on top of the building site (we appreciate building sites cannot be helped but putting a 2 year old in a damp room is a health risk!) the 2 doubles were twin rooms and we were told they 'had no double rooms left'. Don't take the booking if you have no rooms!!! It was sorted after hours of coming up and down the lifts but it was dealt with terribly. Breakfast was fine, nothing to write home about. Thank god we saw no cockroaches because I would have moved and stayed at Raffles instead! Pay the extra money!!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 4 days stay between flights
desc: Arranged through Travel Agents Reception large on first floor, with open bar area joining two tower blocks. Reception did not inform you of the facilities at the hotel. Although there is a large poster stating drinks have 20% off, they do not if Happy Hour( which runs through out the day) Some Language issues: we requested fresh Milk to be brought up to the room , as there were tea making facilities, and we were provided with sachets. The room provided with a phone where one can make local calls, and I think use the phone as a Sat Nav. It regularly needs charging Our room was next door to the lift, which is not recommended for light sleepers. Good outdoor pool, but not enough sun loungers, about 8 for 22 floors of rooms! Great Bar on Floor 22 with fabulous views, but your

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, comfortable but not classy
desc: We stayed at the hotel for two nights plus a late checkout to match our next flight. The concierge is just inside the entrance and you take the lift to the lobby for checkin. That all went smoothly and shortly after checkin our bags were delivered to the room. The room was a good size and the bathroom quite adequate. The bed was comfortable however people talking in loud voices in the corridor outside our room was a bit annoying. Fortunately they were quiet after a while. The hotel staff were pleasant and the concierge service was good. The downstairs area can get a little crowded at times, but no real issues there. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the Raffles City shopping mall where there are many cafes and restaurants to choose from. We did not eat at the hotel. It is

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Over priced hotel but great location
desc: the hotel is in a great location really close to the waterfront but it comes with a price at this price point. the bed is hard as a rock, the bathroom is small and dirty, the whole hotel smells like mold. The room is outdated and reminds me of a typical japan business hotel. Its hard to find a cheap hotel in Singapore and one that is in the heart of the city. If i could do it again, I would pay the extra $40-$60 and get a better hotel room and get the free breakfast also.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good stay
desc: The room is very clean, toilets clean, clean towels, good view, good breakfast, not noisy, shops nearby as well as train station. Room cleaned everyday, good menu for room delivery. A bit expensive but good value for money.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Convenient location, nice bed, nice pool:)
desc: The very good thing about this hotel is its location. It is very near MBS. It is also just walking distance to St. Andrew's Cathedral and Mint Toy museum. Getting taxi is also not a problem, always available outside the hotel. They have 2 swimming pools which are also nice. The bed and pillows are also comfortable. This hotel though maybe a bit old but they are improving bit a bit in order to sustain its condition. We have not tried dining here as the food is as expected pricey and you can just anyhow walk around to check other resto. Over-all, we are satisfied with our 3 nights stay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel
desc: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. They carried our bags in from the taxi and held on to them until we could check in as we were very early. They were later delivered to our room. The hotel and room was nice and clean. The bed was big but mattress was hard. The was 2 pools, one an infinity type pool with a little waterfall and the other still. There was also a gym and sauna. Free WiFi was available in all areas of the hotel. The hotel itself was really well located, easy to get to the mrt stations and could walk to many places too. Would definitely recommend.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Still disappointing
desc: We have stayed in this hotel 8 times now since 2003 and in 2015 the rooms weren't of a high standard and we stayed again as part of our Singapore Stopover in May 2017 and the rooms still haven't improved. We had booked and paid for a superior double room in January for our holiday to the UK. Our room on the outbound journey was tired and needed updating but on our return from the UK the room we were upgraded to was dreadful. We weren't given a double bed as per or request, two singles instead, the room had a terrible smell. The bathroom was mouldy and the tiles were cracked and poorly repaired in other places. The hair dryer didn't work. To make it worse we were put in a room, 1612, on the side of the building where building works were happening until at least 7pm with

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Value for money
desc: This hotel is very conveniently located and is very affordable. The only issue was Wi-Fi, with an android phone not being able to connect or disconnecting randomly, while an iPhone connects quickly. The front desk didn't help to resolve the issue.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average Hotel
desc: The hotel itself is what I would describe as average. The rooms are in a need of redecorating and the pool area could use a bit of attention too. This was my first time in Singapore, so I cannot express what I feel an "average" hotel would be, but I do think there are others with better interiors. However. I was really impressed with the location and staff. It is a 5 minute walk to the nearest underground system, very close to Raffles, lots of department stores, Fort Canning, Clarke Quay. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall, if you want a hotel that is very well decorated then I would not book this one. but if you do not mind the slightly dated interior, then I would say this hotel is well worth looking into.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average
desc: +Excellent location +friendly enough staff +comfortable bed - matchbox of a bathroom - oudated decor -average breakfast There was nothing notably great or notably bad about our stay. We used it as a stopover hotel for one night, I would book again for staff on business (who are shorter than 5'3) but would try somewhere a bit more special for couples.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent Hotel
desc: Located in the city of Singapore,very accessible to all transportation.Very nice lobby,pool area and dining area.Very safe as only the cardholder can go up to the rooms.We have the view of Marina Bay Sands and it was spectacular at night!I would definitely recommend this hotel!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great price/location ratio, but best to avoid weekend check-ins
desc: After two stays I can firmly say that this is my go-to place in Singapore. The Peninsula Excelsior's location is nothing short of strategic, being a stone throw's away from several malls and museums - the National Gallery is two blocks away, the Perenakan Museum just around the corner, while a 15-minute stroll will bring you up Fort Canning and the National Museum that sits on one of its bluffs. Shoppers are even more spoiled, as the always-packed Raffles City and Suntec City shopping centres (plus every other mall in between) is accessible by foot. Plus there is the important MRT junction of City Hall that gives you direct rail connections to Orchard Road, Marina Bay, and the hipster enclave of Tiong Bahru. Accommodation-wise the cavernous and darkly-lit halls give way to

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good place to stay during stopover
desc: This hotel was booked by our travel broker and a stopover on our way to Europe. On our arrival reception staff were courteous and helpful. Opened the door to our room and it reeked of smoke! I immediately phoned reception and they apologised and booked us into another room. Found out later there are a couple of floors available for smokers! Our new room was spacious and clean. After a long flight we were looking forward to freshening up with a swim and had the choice of 2 pools, both very nice. The hotel,is situated near Raffles City Mall and about 10-15 mins walk to Clarke Quay. Also only a few minutes walk to City Hall MRT. Was a great location for our 3 day stopover

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ideal area
desc: Hotel is in a good area for getting around and seeing the sights. Breakfast was good and enough variety. Room was clean and found no problems other than going up the wrong lift !!! . Service was always with a smile which you need .

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Budget hotel, not worth the budget price
desc: Whereas I realize the location is good that is where it ends for this hotel. It seems as if they couldn't decide whether to upgrade it or just leave it as a kind of Days Inn budget motel style, so they kind of upgraded. I stayed in one of the more basic rooms, which was basic. So basic that I had to actually step into the shower before I could turn it on because there was not enough room... Breakfast was complete and total chaos...would avoid if possible unless you like large groups of people clamouring for food in a disorganized fashion. Staff routinely stepped off the elevators in front of you. I would suggest if you have to stay within a certain budget looking around the area to the boutique hotels, airbnb, or quite frankly a hostel and you'd be better off. I would

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A wonderful and surprising experience!
desc: I checked in on Monday evening on a hastily arranged 2 nights stay to recharge myself. I wanted a no frills and conveniently located hotel near MRT with food and shopping amenities. From a misunderstanding upon checking in with the staff, I was extremely surprised that the hotel took my email feedback seriously. The next day, Mr Peter Yap (director of revenue), Ms Jumie Hussin (front office manager) and Ms Rochelle Sarte (guest relations manager) met me to hear my concerns, explain their circumstances and graciously offered me a free upgrade. I am impressed with their professionalism, customer first philosophy and more importantly, their quick response. The suite room, while not overly luxurious, was comfortable and sufficiently spacious. The sky lounge was a delight with great

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice amenities, centrally located.
desc: Very nice room, with a fantastic view. Breakfast buffet was good. Staff were approachable and helpful. Conveniently located within Singapore to access businesses and the airport. Recommended for business travel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellence stay at Peninsula Excelsior
desc: The hotel is located nearby to many facilities. Easy access to taxi. Located near train station. 7 eleven is just across the road. Halal food restaurant in Peninsula Plaza. Walking distance to the Padang / Singapore Cricket Club where main annual event (JSSL 7s football tournament) was conducted. Walking distance / near to main attraction like Arab Street, Gardens by the bay etc. Room is comfortable at affordable rates. Easy to book online. Swimming pool is ok but no pool for children. My room was without breakfast so cannot comment on the food. Best part is about availability of Handy, mobile phone for guest usage. No need to worry about roaming, just bring handy with you when you go out, can access unlimited internet, particularly helpful for using google maps, looking for

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Faded
desc: This was our third time staying as we love its location and the rooms are nice. It's a bit tired now. Do not have the breakfast here, eggs are cold and when you come back from the buffet they have seated someone else at your table. This happened three times one morning. Not worth the money. Great location but will look for somewhere different next stay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The little things let it down
desc: First things first the location is first class and the club rooms on the 21st floor are excellent. BUT The little things missing? I know they had a vacuum because I saw it, but didn't make it into our room. There were also lolly wrappers under the bed. Staff in the club area tried hard but language was an issue. Still promoting the laser show, which hasn't run for a few months. Run out of shampoo? Tuff, not replaced till days later. All up, the location saves it

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent Location; Cell Phone To Use
desc: I was really impressed: the hotel gave me cell phone to use for free local calls and surfing. I didn't have to go buy a SIM card and my Singapore friends contact me. Peninsula's central location is also excellent. It is a 2-minute walk to the trains, and just by the attractions at Marina Bay and the waterfront where there are plentiful of things to do from shopping to watching concerts, visiting museums and many more. Though not spacious, my room was very clean and had everything I was looking for, namely quiet with no traffic noise for a good night's sleep, and strong wifi connectivity. Breakfast was alright and there are enough choices for most palates. Though Peninsula has been around for decades, the renovations were very well done and one doesn't get the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: very rude reception staff spoiling an otherwise pleasant hotel
desc: Had the worst arrival. Staff don't smile or make you feel welcome. When I requested a power adaptor I was told they couldn't help. However all hotel info confirms they do. I insisted they assist but it took then 2 hours to locate an Australian adaptor. House keeping were very nice as were the concierge staff. The hotel is looking quite tired and the first day they did not supply the water/tea or coffee. I also advised them that the phone did not work. They said it would be repaired but never was. Good location but they need to improve the customer service. I spoke to other guests who had the same experience with reception. Also time to purchase new pillows!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly on arrival and during my stay. It was a quick stopover visit but the location was good right across the street from the Peninsula Plaza and easy walk to Raffles hotel and Marina Bay Area. A quick trip to airport. Make sure you go up to the 22nd floor on the balcony for a spectacular view of Marina bay sands in the evening. The pool area is nice and more relaxing at the still pool.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Never since the Hotel V have I had to buy ice
desc: but having said that, at least I didn't have to hire the glasses this time. Anyway, back to the beginning. We arrived very late in the day of which they were aware having given them the flight details from Sydney ages ago On our booking which we had made about July last year, we had requested a non smoking superior room. Reception told us that the only non smoking room had 2 singles and that they would make it up into a King. So far, so good. When we got up to the room, the toilet was dirty and there were toothpaste residues in the hand basins. I rang reception and let them know. Eventually an employee turned up and pushed the beds together and remade it. Overlapping single sheets wasn't entirely what we had in mind! He went into the bathroom and came out saying that he had

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not quite Right
desc: We booked for a three night stay. Check in very efficient. Staff friendly and professional. The problems started with the room. The cleanliness was somewhat less than satisfactory. Pubic hairs in the shower tray. Limescale around the taps. Dirty windows.Breakfast was plentiful, a good choice of both Western and Asian foods. We did enjoy the cocktails on the 22nd Floor with the panoramic views of Singapore. Many thanks to Rochelle for sorting our room issues so quickly. The hotel has a great central location.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Position.
desc: I must agree with all the good points mentioned before. I notified the hotel we would be arriving after midnight and reception gave us the 21st floor on arrival. All staff were very pleasant and most helpful. We preferred the excelsior pool as it had better seating and sunbeds. Great gym and sauna although not used by many. Easy walking to everywhere. There was building work next door but we were informed before booking and we did not hear any noise from the bedroom. The cleaner did a fantastic job looking after us and the hotel should be proud of her!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Over & Above Expectations
desc: Great Hotel. We were upgraded to a superior room on the 20th floor - excellent view of the cathedral etc. room was spotless & very modern. Although there was some construction work next door, there was absolutely no noise. Close to shopping & cafe's etc - only problem being the shops didn't open until almost lunch time! Excellent staff & service. Would definitely stay at this hotel again if we were in Singapore. This hotel was booked by our agent as part of a cruise, stay & fly package from Sydney to Singapore, and the hotel stay was the best part. Internet was free too!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great central hotel
desc: We were there for 5 nights. Had a problem with the bathroom so they upgraded us to a king room. Great staff - very helpful and obliging. Had great views over a wonderful city. Hotel is very central with close access to train station, shopping centre and food outlets.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Quick feedback on hotel staff while not staying there
desc: I was staying just across the road but went to the hotel to catch the shuttle bus too the zoo. Lobby staff was extremely friendly. Offered seats for me and the baby and actually arranged for the bus to stop and wait for us despite not being an actual guest. Thank to jason for the hospitality. I stood at the hotel 10 years ago and will return during my next trips as location is ideal for a singapore visit. Back then the rooms and facilities were very nice but obviously for this time i couldnt judge it. Thanks again for the friendly hospitality

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Well located
desc: Stayed for 3 nights in May 2017. Well located for the Quay Road restaurants and bars. Two swimming pools and a great roof terrace at Skylounge on level 22, where there are 2 viewing balconies and a bar. Only drawback there is you have to get a concierge to operate the lift for that level. All in, a good place to stay

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointing
desc: We were originally put in a room on a smoking floor. After complaining about the smell were were moved to room on a no smoking floor but we had to accept twin beds rather than the king bed as booked. This was all rather disappointing given that we had booked and paid some four months in advance. Not sure how our requirement for a non-smoking room was overlooked, but it serves as a cautionary tale for those of us that take our right to a no smoking environment for granted. Both rooms had a somewhat worn and dated feel. Tile grout was stained black and minor repairs such as gap sealing, cracks and basin plugs not closing were either neglected or apparently done by unskilled workers. Other minor irritations were the safe and a light not working. A negative for us was that

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A stay
desc: Tried Peninsular excelsior for a change this time for the group visits wth friends and family! As in every Asian destination , hotel turned out to be a place only to zonk out dead like a log during the late evenings after each days hectic " holiday schedules" Peninsular offers comfortable spacious rooms which guarantees comfortable nights, good breakfast and a great transparent pool for children if you find time for it! Hotel has " Nalan" the ideal South Indian vegetarian restaurant, McDonald's etc in close vicinity and China town and little india in short drives! Place has tiny washrooms as in majority of hotels with no faucet for strict Indian tourists😅! If you're travelling in a very close group , if you're lucky you would get rooms located in same floor but as it is

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: In need of an update
desc: The location of this hotel is great for people who want to be downtown. It is a block away from the City Hall MRT (and therefore the North-South and East-West Lines, including the line to Changi Airport) and Raffes City shopping complex, and an easy walk to the harbour and Merlion statue, past the National Gallery of Singapore. The hotel itself is in dire need of a refresh or upgrade. Someone has clearly had an attempt as it in the last 10 years, with neutral furnishings throughout, but it appears to have been done in a "check a box" manner, without thought. For instance the need to have a shower, rather than simply a hand held spray in the bath, has been addressed by retro fitting glass panels along the middle of the bathroom and attaching a showerhead on the wall adjacent

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central to everything
desc: I have stayed here 4 times now It is a great place - central to MRT, Raffles Shopping centre, Hop on hop off bus, Clarke Quay and more. It has 2 nice pools and a central lobby that is large and comfortable. Rooms are a good size - clean and comfortable too. Breakfast bar has a good selection.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ok if you do not have much expectation
desc: Went there for a staycation with family and kid. Overall was really just basic at best so don't expect alot. Pro: Good location, 2 mins to city hall mrt and room is reasonable sized. Cons: Long time for check-in despite i was standing there carrying an infant. Staff seems to be new and everyone else is awfully busy. I would advise to smile still when interacting with customers. Room would probably require some renovation as i noted that the door handle hits against the wall and doesn't auto close. Bathroom hanger look loose and looks like slight rusty. Only 30 channels on tv. No kiddy pool as min height is 1m. Overall, probably will not return.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: This hotel is in a great location for tourists to explore many of Singapore's most popular areas and attractions. Fantastic feature was the smartphone supplied by the hotel which enabled us to find our way around the city so much more easily with free internet and calls. Room was perfectly equipped and very comfortable, however it was directly overlooking a building site which sometimes operated as late as midnight. While I understand this won't go on forever, it definitely caused some disturbance during our stay. Didn't eat in the hotel at all so can't comment on that but we did visit the sky lounge on the top floor which had some amazing views and very reasonably priced drinks. There is, however, a dress code which we were informed of rather condescendingly and access can

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location and reasonably priced
desc: How's this for service : check-in time is 2pm and I arrived at reception at 7.30am. Since it was summer holiday season, my room was not yet available. Noticing my disappointment, staff scoured the check-in system and offered to upgrade me to a Club room at no extra charge as it was the only room readily available. And I was told I could stay there for all 7 nights! A 3 minute walk from City Hall MRT and surrounded by shopping malls, this is a great location at a reasonable price - and the staff are great!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: BEST HOTEL
desc: Excellent hotel with best hospitality and also good location. We had stayed from 30-Apr-17 to 7-May-17. They gave us early check in and late checkout without extra cost. Also surprised me by chocolates and greeting on my birthday celebration. Food is delicious. Overall satisfactory experience. Good option for Singapore trip.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Alright
desc: Modern foyer and lobby . Out dated decor in the rooms. Though neat and tidy. Centrally located. Staff on ground floor lovely. Some reception staff where not so friendly and seems as though they were annoyed and cold in verbalisation. Stayed there twice on stop overs. Room views were stunning pools where beautifully kept. Large variety of food for breakfast and there lunches you couldnt ask for more.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Friendly staff and fast check in
desc: Friendly staff at the reception this morning. Booked directly through hotel website. I was check in by lady manager Jumie and there was a long queue of people. Could be the early morning rush. Check in was done swiftly. She managed to find me a room and after a long flight it was very tiring.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Singapore Trip
desc: Very nice hotel, great location near to City Hall MRT and shopping malls. Also next to the Grand Prix circuit could be the last one here this year, we hear. Could do with a little updating like painting in the rooms and maybe a few pictures and more TV channels. Lots to choose from for breakfast.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel but rude front desk
desc: The hotel is nice and clean. Rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. The lobby is beautiful and you can look at the pool which is covered by glass facing the hotel lobby. The view from hotel to Singapore skyline and city is breathtaking . However , they are few issues that needs improvement and i have highlighted them below ; I had a problem of communication with front-desk. The lady who pick up my phone was unprofessional and very rude. She replied to my call with ''What do you want''? I never experienced such rude response from someone who supposed to take care of the customer service. Another issue is the short shower head. You need to be 150 cm to take a comfortable shower. Shower head was so low and I had to get down on my knees to rinse my hair. Also ,I had the worst

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: OK Hotel, ok location
desc: We arrived in the hotel, it was located in a relatively good part of the City (in terms of shopping/food, but there are better). The lobby is nice and clean, but the service is slow. It took over 30 mins to check in, the staff are slow and not as polite as we have experienced elsewhere. The room we received was a nice room on a high floor, a corner room, and we had a view of the Marina Bay Sands, a nice view. However, it did feel a bit run down, it needed a clean and renovation. The room had lots of dust and generally felt unclean. As the room was not as clean as expected we spent a lot of our time outside the hotel, and on check out again had to spend 20 minutes waiting to check out (due to queues). On the whole I was a bit disappointed with the hotel, and would probably

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location - Suited for leisure and budget corporate travellers
desc: Property is in a good location, easy to walk to parks, shopping and the Marina bay area. It has 2 towers joined by the foyer/lobby which connects both. The rooms are smallish, generally clean although if you move a chair or bed side table you will find dust and areas that have not had a vacuum for a while. The breakfast buffet is enough to get you started and a good mixture of food. While the stay is fine, I would not stay again as there are other better options suited to my preferences

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Holiday of a lifetime
desc: The hotel was excellent the staff attentive, breakfast was good and the Conciege system for booking transport and excursions very efficient. Everything was clean and well run. We would have liked to stay longer

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: The location of this hotel is very nice ! I go there very often when I'm in business trip. The only point of improvement I can see is the room design ; most of the room are a bit old fashioned. This place is good but could be crazy good ! there are 2 swimming pools and 1 gym. On of the towers gives on the Marina bay Sands. Staff is usually friendly. Brekfast is not bad but still a bit pricy for the quality

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Closed to City Hall Station
desc: I arrived on 2 June 2017 at early morning around 5 0'clock after long haul journey, while check in time on 2 p.m..My wife and I are old couple(more than 70 years old) at that time we felt so tired and jetlag. I ask to reception staff whether hotel has still room to be hired. Unfortunately they don't have one.Really Fully booked at that morning,although I have booked this hotel starting from that date (but have to wait for check in time at 2 pm). Finally reception staff offer me to take a rest at hotel's patio on 5th floor. Anyway thanks to reception staff on duty at that morning.I appreciate it.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Still reliable value for money
desc: This is our 3rd visit to this hotel in 6 years and I have the impression it has maintained its standard and even improving. There are many more expensive hotels in Singapore but we have been very satisfied with this place where the service is excellent and the staff helpful and friendly. Excellent breakfast catering to all needs, firm beds, clean rooms...what more can you expect.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Centrally located and easy
desc: Positioned near City Hall and walking distance to most things, including the MRT. The room was comfortable and the staff were very helpful. The addition of the local phone to help you get around town was a great idea and was beneficial with local attractions

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nearby city hall MRT ( 10 min walk ) , reasonable price , Room not so bad , construction make it noisy on the daytime
desc: I was staying only 3 days 2 nights my room was 1411 . I will share some reviews about : Location : smart choice to choose this hotel because this hotel only 10 min walking to city hall MRT Check in : normal check in , deposit 100 sgd for 3 days 2 nights . Staffs are nice and friendly Room : was OK , not so bad and not so good . Very small bathroom but overall is comfortable. Bed a little bit hard but it was ok In-room dining : Recommended to order : spring rolls + tomyam seafood soup . You will love it ! Check out : was good as check Overall this hotel is 3.5/5 . Its OK and they always keep warm and friendly to customer ( i think this is the great thing from them )

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Lost item never been found
desc: I have been staying at this hotel over 10 years. I like the hotel for its location. The room is fine, not big and not tiny. My recent stay I was there for 6 nights. The last day I checked out and left my bag at the concierge downstair in the morning and returned to the hotel late afternoon for a shower before heading to the airport. The hotel kindly provided me the shower facility next to the sauna. In the changing room I forgot my 3 weeks old Agnes B vest. By the time I realised that I forgot my vest I was already on SG flight to Sydney. I called the hotel as soon as I got off the flight. Unfortunately, nothing was found in the locked up changing room. I tried to follow up again in case of late handling but unluckily the vest was not found. The hotel told me there was no lost

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel with reasonable cost
desc: Stay in this hotel with Traveloka package (bundling with flight) so this is an economic price. The hotel location is great. We use MRT from Changi airport and we do transit as usual in Tanah Merah and continue the "EW" route (green line) to City Hall. Use the exit D and walk by Capitol for nearest way to hotel and you will discover yourself in Peninsula Plaza sideways. Just walk straight and in one crossing you'll arrive at the hotel. It is also near bus stop and taxi stand. There's 24h Seven Eleven store nearby so it's comfortable to buy snacks, water, cup noodle, and other things. Across the hotel are the famous St. Andrew's Church, National art museum, just a walk away from Esplanades, Raffles City Mall, etc. The lobby was huge, the swimming pool is standard yet still

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hotel
desc: Very good hotel to stay. Close to hop on hop off bus no 5. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend this hotel. Thank you for our stay. Easy to cross road and find cheap local food. Taxi service outside. Concierge service very good. All speak excellent English.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hotel Stay.
desc: Stayed at this hotel with my wife for 2 nights and the hotel was nice place to stay would go go back again it was close to alot of restaurants and close to Chinatown also but beware of the spruikers in Chinatown they are ruthless.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Avoid!
desc: No such good experience you may expected when you are in the bad day. Bad day can be defined as choosing a wrong hotel. This was the one. Lobby was smelt bad. Rooms was smell mold. Attitude is zero. If you have a change to get other hotel, better avoid it.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Bit of a battle
desc: When we arrived and navigated our way to the checkin counter on an upper floor we booked in and I asked if I paid for an upgrade could I access a room early. (It was 12 noon) We were given a room however when we to it, it was small, dingy and desperately in need of renovation. There were stains on the ceiling, the wall between the bedroom and bathroom was clear glass (with a very dirty blind you could pull down) and the bathroom itself needs a good clean and repaint. I returned to the front desk and explained that I was not happy with the room due to its old and grubby state especially as I had paid for an upgrade. I asked to be moved. The woman I dealt with initially seemed confused about the situation. Once she spoke to her supervisor and he clarified my concerns I waited

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: poor
desc: we check in around 8 pm, the lady at the front desk was curt, and rude. we got a very small room in the corner. 2 very small twin beds for 2 adults and 1 child. we stayed 1 night and thankfully cancelled the rest of my booking and moved to swissotel stamford. the only good thing is the location. never again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Mr
desc: Great hotel. A little dated but we found it very nice. Great friendly staff great beds. Walking distance to good street food and beer. Going back next year for a while will definitely be looking staying again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Don't stay here!
desc: Don't stay at this hotel, the staff are rude and concierge are useless!! I arrived early than the checkin time ( wasn't expecting hotel to check me in early) however they took my money 5 hours before check in and didn't offer me and refreshements or solutions as to what I could do whilst waiting!! The hotel system and layout was confusing and not accessible. So when I arrived I had to take a lift to the lobby area as ground floor was concierge. So I was checked in already before 2pm but not given my room- I had been waiting for 5 hours and wanted to freshen up or sleep. So I had a room- very tiny could barely walk around it. View was of the building sight, had a shower and the bathroom was grimy and unclean. They didn't have the toiletries like shampoo and soap there which I

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location
desc: The hotel is in a great location very near to a metro station and have access to lots of places around. Near to downtown only one station, church beside the hotel, rooms are ok, breakfast is poor lots of dishes but not up to the international standards.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location average hotel for Singapore
desc: Hotel is close to Clarke Quay and a short walk to Orchard road, have been to Singapore many times and probably wont stay in this hotel again.Reception staff were very slow dealing with customers and had to ask 3 times for a safe deposit box after checkout

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, Very Clean.
desc: Hotel very clean, polite staff & 2 pools. Rooms quiet big & nice views. Breakfast was also very nice with lots of variety. Had a very nice stay. Near the hop on hop off bus stop which is the best way to get around.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Welcoming and friendly staff, tired facilities
desc: We arrived very early after a bad, long haul flight and the staff were very accommodating in offering us a very early check in as soon as our room was ready. We were offered a complimentary coffee in the restaurant and could use the pool changing rooms were pretty tired. The restaurant was chaotic and very busy, and breakfast was expensive. Our room was supposed to be non-smoking, but reeked of tobacco. The staff sprayed air freshener to deal with this. Our room directly overlooked a building site, and there was a lot of noise all day and well into the night.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Superb property
desc: Excellent pool 5 star property excellent breakfast nice quiet rooms but small rooms but beautiful reception . I stayed in suite room in 2017 in excelsior tower it has been long time back but it was lovely experience.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: It's rated 4-Star but deserves 3!
desc: As mentioned briefly in the description by the management, the location of this hotel is very good, for youngsters especially since Clarke quay is just 6 minutes walk from the hotel. But on the downside the rooms are smaller than most other hotels in the same price bracket, buffet breakfast is also nothing too great. Service is good, rooms used to get cleaned on time, ice delivered quickly & good staff. It's a average hotel would recommend highly for business travellers.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Holiday
desc: I have stayed at the Peninsula before as I like the location. Close to the museums, and other sights. Easy walking distance to the Big Wheel, China Town, Raffles for that special drink, gardens and so much more. My room this time was facing the direction of the wheel, and also could see other major attractions. The only problem with the room was in the bathroom, the shower door open into the shower cube but you would have to squash up against the wall to close the door. Small issue in the scale of things. Best of all is the staff. As usually I did a sweep of the room before leaving. Had a few hours after checkout before being collected to go to airport and went to Art Museum. On arrival back to collect my luggage I was informed that I had left items in the safe.... all items

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Third stay
desc: Usually great but this time found the room smelt of damp like a wet dog?? Shower and bathroom good. Beds are comfortable and air con is great in the local climate. Staff were helpful and polite as usual. Will still return. Restaurant good.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Short stay but nice hotel
desc: We stay for 3 days and 2 nights. We are 4 persons. The hotel is located in the city. The room is nice. I asked for the connecting room and they tried to find. The receptionist are very welcoming and helpful person. In front of the lobby there is small swimming pool made by glasses. The lobby is comfortable. The room is clean but little bit noisy from outside the room. We can still hear the noisy neighbour when they are talking. It's disturb us especially when the time is for everyone sleep.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location and value for money
desc: Located around the corner from Raffles shopping plaza this hotel is ideally suited for business on a budget. Lobby is on the 5th level with a "big top" feel and viewing of the glass sided swimming pool. The rooms are clean, well equipped and functional if not large. Breakfast is a buffet a little up from the holiday inn side of things. Great for couples, business or travellers not on a budget. Not really for families. Would I stay again, yes, on business.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: I mean......ya y not...
desc: The peninsula excelsior was a casual and nice hotel I would have liked less expensive room service. I ordered a soup for over 10 US dollars and it tasted like nothing almost like lumpy water. Other than that I also asked for "some ice cubes" from the front desk and they gave me the biggest bucket of ice I have ever seen(picture reference below) do I guess that's cool. The actual room in its self was fine but I did find a bunch at ants in the bathroom which was weird.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Warmly welcome hotel ( From Staff)
desc: Thank you for your special hospitality team. We have a very wonderful stay at your hotel. From the beginning welcome by concierge team and front desk she the one up selling us for club room #2017 if I am not confused . Wow we love that room. Thank you for all the best memorable. We will recommend this hotel to everyone who need in center of city.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disinterested staff, dated accommodation, although clean and convenient.
desc: Location, room and amenities are fine, although some maintenance required to live up to the images and descriptions provided on their website. Interactions with staff (re pool/gym access and organising the babysitting service) left a lot to be desired.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice and clean
desc: We stayed here, when we went to Singapore. The hotel is located within walking distance to The Helix bridge, Gardens by the bay etc. The room was modern and clean with all the essentials. The breakfast was a buffet with a lot to choose from and not all noodles and rice, but also English breakfast, fruit, pancakes etc. The staff was friendly and accommodating, always helpful if we needed help or a taxi for the airport.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very nice stay!
desc: Stayed here for 2 nights. Had a good size room, plenty of room for the 2 of us to spread out. Comfy beds and big pillows. Out the door, go left and make a left at first corner and there is a small food "court" with very cheap but extremely local tasty food. We ate here twice and the food was great both times. A short walk to the river for a nice stroll. Very nice desk staff.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location & comfortable accommodiation
desc: We have stayed at hotel a number of times.Our last visit was just recently & we arrived on an early flight.We were greeted at the hotel by Shankrish the senior duty manager who was extremely helpful in checking us in and assisting with our requirements.At any time we saw Shankrish nothing was too much trouble for her to assist us in our enquiries. We find the location very good being near City Hall MRT station which connected directly with the airport. The hotel has a good pool and the rooms are comfortable and clean.The staff are all polite and helpful. We had a room with a harbour view which is great.We did not eat at the hotel as we went out early.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great return visit
desc: This is our forth time that we have been to this hotel, and are not disappointed. The service continues to be very good, easy to book in, with maybe the one area that needs to be looked into and sorted out, is the lifts, which is overworked - my access card for some reason or other decided to work for a day only, and then stopped working for the lifts (but allowed access to our room?). The hotel was quick to replace the card, but for anybody to lacks patience, this could become a problem. We were given one of our more favoured rooms this time, which is one that overlooks the park area and the cathedral. House keeping continues to be very efficient and ensures that there is adequate tea and coffee in the room - a good idea is to ask the hotel to empty the rooms bar fridge, and

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Exquisit Hotel within walking distance to Chinatown
desc: We had a 3 night stopover in Singapore and were luck enough to stay in the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel, close to shopping centres, Restaurants, bars and convenient to one of the hop on hop off tourist bus stops, next to St Andrews church. This was our first time in Singapore City and it will not be our last, we really enjoyed the cleanliness, vibrancy and accessibility of this wonderful city. We book 2 days on the tourist bus with your 48 hours starting from the time you pay your money on the bus but after the first day we realised how accessible the city was by foot and enjoyed walking around on our 3rd day but with frequent browses through air conditioned shopping malls as heat can get intense on occasion but enjoyable all the same.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice Hotel near City Hall MRT
desc: This hotel is located very close to City Hall MRT so it's very convenient for tourists and you can walk from hotel to Clark Quay and parliament. The view there at night is very beautiful and it's pretty quiet. it's really romantic if you take a long walk with your loved one near the river. For hotel facilities. it's not the best but not that bad. They should improve cleanliness in hotel rooms. For my room they didn't clean bathroom properly and they forgot to flush hair that they took from drain... Besides, they forgot to refill shower gel and shampoo for us and when we tried to call front desk the phone didn't work (not sure why). Although we requested non-smoking room, in the morning we still smell smoke of cigarette. We assumed that it came from air vent as it connected

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: We stayed 3 nights in a triple room. 3 separate single beds not a rollaway bed so that was good. Bathroom good size. Probably needs an upgrade soon but perfectly usable. We didn't have breakfast but there is a coffee shop right next door and if you walk one block raffles city shopping centre has dozens of places to eat lower ground 10am to 10 pm. Asian and European style foods. Very reasonable prices. Raffles hotel is also just behind the shopping centre the underground train MRT is also very near, easy to use takes you everywhere you want to go. Would stay again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Mixed Reviews
desc: We stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights in August 2017. The hotel was in a great location with the hop on hop off bus stop right outside. We also had a MRT station across the road. The room itself was quite large however after the second day the fridge, tv and lights stopped working. We reported this to reception on numerous occasions who promised to fix but never did. We ended up giving up reporting the issue as it was falling on deaf ears. There is also a large construction site next to the hotel where drilling would start at 5am and go on until 11pm at night. The room would also sometimes shake from the building site. Breakfast was ok but not a lot of variety.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel in good location
desc: Stayed here two nights in August. Unfortunately we arrived very early and the our standard room was not available even by paying extra. We had to pay a rather hefty supplement of more than half the price to go to an upgraded room on the 20th floor. This came with exclusive use of the Sky Bar and a free cocktail. The room was very nice with a superb view as was the Sky Bar, but make sure you ask for the list of free "cocktails" as they are really just shorts with mixers or glasses of wine. If you want a Singapore Sling you will pay the full price. Our room was a large suite with great views. The bathroom was also large with bath and powerful shower. At the time of staying there was some building work on the site next to us which I found a trifle noisy. This will not be permanent.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A very tired hotel it needs money spending on it.
desc: I think the worst hotel we have stayed in Singapore, regarding needing a lot of money spending on redecorating the rooms and the swimming pools need urgent attention regarding the tiles around the pool. Cracked, loose, uneven etc. An accident if not already is waiting to happen. Yes the hotel is near to most tourist places, but I would rather have a better quality hotel and walk abit further. We stayed there 3 nights end of August 2017.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Fantastic Location
desc: Stayed here because of the hotel's location and it was great. a 10 minute walk to Clark Quay and there a taxi queue and money exchange right below. Nice views, good service and good housekeeping. Rooms are decently sized and clean. Definitely worth it.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Never again
desc: Worst hotel experience of my 3 week trip. To start off, we were on our honeymoon, when we arrived we were offered, a twin room or a king smoking room... Great... After we continued to refuse these rooms, they 'upgraded' us. The room was outdated and mould in bathroom, old carpets etc. Breakfast was so terrible, we cancelled it for our second morning. Grey eggs, cold, and unhygienic food in the buffet, large queue if you want fresh omelette. Initially they told us they could not cancel or refund the money, but finally gave in after much persistence. Would not recommend or stay again. Ever. Cheers.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Maybe ok in a few years.
desc: I have to say the hotel in general is ok but the fact that there is a major building project on the rear side of the entire property is a real concern. I know this is outside of the hotels control but there was no mention of it on the website or at the time of booking. Even the hotel staff said the noise will stop at 6pm. It didn't it continued into the night and early morning. Seriously loud and a major lack of sleep (hence grumpy reviewer !) The pools were also unusable due to the drilling noise. Also to access the sky lounge we had to transfer towers, go down to the ground floor then ask a bellboy for permission to get to the 22nd floor. Give it a few years before staying here Anyone who is staying there though, we found an excellent food mall on the fort canning side of

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Worst hotel with the worst breakfast
desc: We had a whole spectrum of problems with this but let me start with this. They tried to put my wife and I into single beds ON OUR HONEYMOON. After our first argument with them regarding this they said they only had a double bedroom in a smokers room, this was also unacceptable and immediately magically found a room with a king size bed when we fought again. The room was very dated and had a heavy smell of mould but we decided to stay as we were both tired. The next day we thought we would make our way down to breakfast as we had paid in advance for breakfasts for the length of our stay. This is where the next problem started. The food was incredibly bad, almost everything was cold, the pancakes the pork buns the hash brown all cold. My wife also had the boiled eggs which

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average property in a central location
desc: This is an old hotel with a few oddities like a cramped entrance and lobby on the 7th floor but it is centrally located within a few minutes of Raffles City and City Hall station and covers up for what was an average experience in the hotel for the price paid. Rooms are a bit compact, do request from ones with a marina view else it can be a bit depressing. The rooms are reasonably well equipped but offer poor quality of toiletries. Housekeeping was very particular with providing only 2 500ml bottles, a request for another one elicited a "you have to pay for extra"! What salvaged an ordinary stay was an evening at the Club floor (28th) had a good view and good service.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Terrible housekeeping service + blood stains on sheets!
desc: The housekeeping at this hotel is the worst I've encountered world-wide. Worse than a motel. We requested for our bed to be made. One hour later, a guy came in and threw the sheets on our bed and quickly left before we could say anything. We were so dumbfounded we didn't get to speak to him. We considered just doing the sheets ourselves since we were tired and didn't want to wait anymore. What threw us off was that the sheet he dropped off had BLOOD STAINS on it! GROSS. To make things worse, the phone in the room was not working. We had to go down to the lobby each time. Considering we are staying one more night, we figured there was no need to ask for maintenance service since we wanted to wind down and not be disrupted for the night. When we walked down to the lobby for the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location!
desc: Stayed from 22nd till 26th August 2017 and it's been lovely..! Small little cafe by the main entrance for sandwiches and salads! Old hotel with great location to Boat Quay, Clark Quay or Chijmes; just waking distance. Thank you Peninsula team Sophie

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but better hotels available in the area
desc: Myself, my wife and our (almost) 3 years old child arrived here early in the morning for 3 nights from 6th to 8th August 2017. The hotel is situated very centrally in Singapore, close to Raffles and Clarke Quays and City Hall MRT a short walk away. The hotel lobby is situated on a higher floor and can only be accessed via a lift. The lifts are very small and really busy at all times. This made getting into the lift to the lobby with several suitcases (even after check out) very difficult. As we arrived early, we were allowed to check in early but our room was not yet ready for another 1-1.5 hours. So we went to the hotel’s restaurant for breakfast (not included in the price). Our early indication of the hotel was that it was popular for tourists as it was really busy but

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: In Transir great location
desc: On the back end of our 4 week holiday, broke up the trip back to Australia by staying a night in Singapore. Great location 2 min from Train station. $2 Spd. From Airport $24-34 in a town car/ taxi. The sands and night gardens $8 in a.town car. Large shopping. Enters $5 away. Or directly across the road depending on needs We had a standard room with King bed and single for our 7 year old daughter. Comfy and clean. TV bar fridge ect Occasional musty smell(found in most of Singapore) Large room (801) cold air con pool was s welcome refresher. Cleaner could pay more attention and remove dust from shelves and replace shower curtain. Views of the night lights. Resturant and bar. Coffee shops outside down stairs (American style) Note: there was some construction going on

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Unimpressed. Breakfast awful.
desc: I was travelling solo on holiday, meeting other friends. Check in was efficient and the concierge was very helpful in finding my baggage which Emirates Airlones decided to leave in Dubai. The room was clean and spacious. In the lobby, the barman was a touch pushy but otherwise friendly. My big bone of contention though is the restaurant. On my first night, I dined in and selected two courses, a starter and a main. They brought both courses together! On another evening I visited the de luxe restaurant on the 22nd floor, but it was still the same menu. There was a sauce listed on one of the meals and they couldn't be Elle me what it was, nor could they be bothered to find out. Now if those experiences weren't bad enough, breakfast was even worse. Utter mayhem. People walking

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Stay over due to flights
desc: Found the hotel to be very busy, room was small and we felt it needed updating. We had dinner in the hotel which was average the hotel roof top bar was nice. The booking came with breakfast which again was average.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointing
desc: I was disappointed with the hotel, it's one positive is a good location. It has currently got building works under way next door which is not mentioned at check in and continues 24/7 and can be heard in the rooms. Our room was also not clean when we arrived we noted used toothpicks on the floor and told a member of staff. These toothpicks remained four days later when we checked out! The rooms do need updating although I would say with a good clean may be okay. When checking in we encountered the same issue as other people had mentioned when reviewing and were given a twin room instead of the double we had booked. Overall if you are out of the room during the day it's okay for sleeping in.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good stopover option
desc: We have stayed here several times and always enjoyed the hotel. Staff are good and has an amazing breakfast. It is walking distance to many of the cities attractions if you can stand the heat and humidity. On our last visit we found things pretty noisy as their is construction going on right beside the hotel but that is outside the hotels control. However would recommend asking for a room on the other side of the hotel as being Singapore they work all night

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Pretty disappointing
desc: The location is good but almost everything else is pretty crappy . Tne size of the rooms is ok but they are dated and worn out. The lobby stinks of cigarette smoke. The service was not good and the lifts are terrible - slow and crowded. It seems very popular with Chinese tour groups but I won't go again . Lots of better options.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice place!
desc: This is the first time I have stayed here and I am definitely impressed. It is definitely an advantage having a 24 hour front desk. There are two pools here which is really nice and the room is definitely spacious with all the basic amenities. My only critique is the bed is a little hard for me but that really is personal preference

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ok for stopover but bad customer service and rude staff
desc: Hotel is ok. Good for the price, room decent enough but bathroom was tired with mould. Big building site happening next door so be aware . When checking in we were asked if we'd like breakfast and we were told where the restaurant was and to give them our room number. ( to be charged ) When checking out at 6am they wanted to charge us for breakfast for that day.... even though clearly we were not going to be eating as we had a flight to catch and the fact it wasn't even open yet.I was told that I signed when checking in ( after a long flight ... tired.... and it wasn't explained to me clearly ) I was told tough because I signed and that I should have told them sooner. Well I didn't think it would be an issue and didn't think that they are cheeky enough to charge when they know

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: I liked it
desc: This hotel is about 25 mins taxi ride from the airport.staff were good,we got an upgrade so had a nice room,breakfast was nice with a good selection. There are 2 pools one has a see thru wall. It's short walk to the subway which is the best way to get around town, cheap clean great!its about 25 mins walk to the marina bay hotel and the gardens ,catch the subway. All in all a nice reasonably priced hotel in the centre of town would easily stay here again😊

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location and facilities.
desc: Stayed here for two nights. First room was very noisy because of the construction going on. Housekeeping lady warned us that it would go on into the night, so we requested a room change. The second room was much quieter. The hotel is handy to access many Singapore attractions. Wifi reliable.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Enjoyed a comfortable stay.
desc: Very good location with a comfortable room. Easy walking distance to Chinatown, cruising and Fort Canning. View over the city was beautiful. The room was attractive and the king size bed was comfortable. The bathroom was clean and well-maintained. Wifi connection was excellent. The breakfast offered a range of options but did not eat any other meals in-house.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A Hotel in the right location for tourists
desc: This is the first time we have stayed at this hotel. We were greeted with a room comprising two single beds for a married couple travelling with their 16 yr old son. But after a few minutes with reception the matter was sorted out. We ended up in room 810. The only downside to this room was it had a view of the construction next door – not their fault. It was large, more a square than a standard rectangle shape. The bathroom was long and narrow but possessed a bath with a shower head as well as a shower with the best water pressure and shower head I’ve ever found. We also had a good view over the pool. If you do not wish to swim in the glass walled pool with everyone on reception looking at you there is a second pool on the same level which received more sun. The wifi

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel and location!
desc: We had a 2 triple room where one of the rooms that were allocated to us had a view of the Marina Bay Sands. The rooms were spacious enough to accommodate 3 people and we 3 single beds. The breakfast at the hotel was good. The hotel also provides a complementary phone where you can use when you roam around Singapore using the internet and it includes free calls to anywhere in the world. However, it would be better if they can provide more orientation to guests on how to use the applications save in the phone. The battery also gets easily drained and there was a day where we had issues connecting to the internet using the phone. But overall, it was fine since we did not pay extra to use it. The hotel is located close to Chinatown, church and museums. There are shops around where

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great central location
desc: We stayed at the Peninsula for my wife's birthday. Our room was superb with fantastic views. It has a central location which makes it ideal for getting around this wonderful city. Great facilities, the club lounge is excellent and the staff were very kind and attentive. Rochelle, the guest relations manager, was absolutely brilliant, helping to make our special occasion very special, nothing was too much trouble. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good choice
desc: Stayed here when We came to Singapore to watch F1. Good location Easy access to F1 , MRT City hall , St Andrews Cathedral etc There are many shopping malls and food court in the vicinity.Room was comfortable with reasonably good break fast I will be back

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central and comfortable
desc: It is many years since I last stayed here but the hotel has survived and expanded. We were perfectly happy with the large and comfortable room, welcome after an international flight. The lobby lounge is large but its rather unusual glass panel sight of people swimming persuaded us to use the other more private swimming pool. The breakfast is fine but nothing special. I'd be happy to stay there again. Although the area is not particularly good for restaurants it is within convenient walking distance to much else in central Singapore, and trains and taxis are nearby.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location, Spacious , Value for Money
desc: I stayed at Peninsula Excelsior for a night in Sept'17 while on a business trip to SG. The hotel is centrally located with everything at walking distance. There is a MRT right across so is convenient for public transport access as well. The found the staff very courteous and the place is very spacious. My room had a great view of city and was very spacious. Only downside maybe it feels a bit old in decor, but its still great value for money. Overall a good hotel and I would stay again at the place.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Quiet relaxing stay
desc: This hotel is centrally located near the heart of City Hall. It's convenient location is within about 7 min walk from three train stations. We stayed in the Peninsula Tower and managed to get a room that had a view of Fort Canning Park. The room and toilet were very spacious, comfortable and clean. The atmosphere around the hotel and inside the property was very peaceful. The surrounding area at night is actually very lovely! We were booked with access to Club Lounge but we didn't have the appropriate attire to enter, so we had to forgo it. However, the view of City Hall at night up at the lounge is gorgeous! Breakfast was good too, with many food options. Do try everything in moderation so that you can go back for seconds! It really was a lovely stay and we are looking

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent Views
desc: We booked an Executive Club room which gave us a room on a higher level, level 21, the view was outstanding. This also gave us access to the Executive Club, which the views from there were breath taking, so were the cocktails. The staff were very nice, the only issue we had was that some staff didn't understand English very well, but we managed with no issues.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not all what I expected
desc: I do not normally write a long review (and I have been a member of Trip Advisor for many years). I was stationed at Changi Airbase in 1964 up until 1967 so this visit to Singapore was mainly Nostalgia inspired. It was a long journey overall for my wife and I so we were tired when we arrived at the Peninsula Excelsior. We booked in notwithstanding a Three Hundred Dollar deposit (against breakages). For 75 year olds that was inappropriate I thought however . . . The Room: Spacious? Yes. Tidy? Yes. Quality Furniture (No) - something out of the 1960`s so I suppose I should have been at home. Wall Sockets - most of the time I couldnt get them to work properly. Storage - not much (I have had more storage space on a number of cruises I have been on). One wardrobe for the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great stay
desc: We stayed here at the beginning of our 7 week holiday and it was a great start. The room was clean. Very comfortable bed. The pool was great you had a choice of two. A good bar so you could have a drink by the pool. Very handy to restaurants and shops. Also great position to catch local transport. We had a great stay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Superb Location for The Quays and Malls
desc: The hotel is modern and offers all the regular facilities of a 4/5* hotel catering to the business traveller and tourist. Rooms are small even by Singapore standards and the bar pretty lonely even by high rise hotel standards but any shortcomings overcome by the location which presents a 10-15 minute walk to both Boat and Clarke Quays, 5 mins to the metro and 10 mins to major shopping malls

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Peninsula Tower badly in need of renovation
desc: We were disappointed with management. We had booked a double room many months ahead, arrived late in the day ,to be told that a twin room was all that was available.
