The offer to convert the room the next day was accepted but did not happen! The room was in very poor condition, stained walls and floors, bathroom fittings very worn.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location, friendly staff, the place needs updating
desc: I stayed for 7 days during a business trip and prior to the Grand Prix it was not easy to find accommodation in the centre of Singapur at short notice. What I liked: the location is great, you can walk anywhere to the centre of Singapore, the staff are very friendly, the place is clean, I had room 1331 with a double aspect window, WIFI was okay, the bed was comfortable. I never used any of the facilities in the hotel, I was leaving for work at 06:00 am and I arrived back around 19:00, my desire for a swim or a session in the gym was limited. As a stopover needing a bed it was okay. Would I come back ? I have been to Singapore many times and this was my least favourite place. It looks a bit tired and it needs an update - there is a lot of competition in Singapore as far as

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, in need of some renovating..
desc: Pro's: location- so easy to walk to most places in Singapore from this hotel Great view from the Sky bar of the Marina Bay Area Breakfast selection was okay, good to refuel for a busy day sightseeing Cons: Hotel in need of an update- for what you pay I would expect better quality of rooms/amenities etc Bathrooms were tired looking and in need of some TLC Building work next door is noisy and intrusive even from the top floors- appreciate this is beyond the hotel's control but windows offered little to no sound insulation Overall- it's a reasonable price to pay for a midrange hotel but probably wouldn't stay here again given the number of hotels in Singapore offering better quality for a similar price

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Reasonable value for money.
desc: Checked in by Iza who was helpful and kind, very professional in dealing with my concerns regarding a health issue for my daughter. Our room was spacious and modern with a great view. The beds are a little hard and the fishbowl pool at reception is a bit odd! Overall a reasonable choice for Singapore and for the price.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: A well kept hotel central for walking to both ends of Singapore. *Arrival- staff offered 2 x single beds on smoking floor....we paid for a room months in advance, which was queen bed on non smoking floor as did our friends we were staying with....I politely declined and they put us in connecting rooms on 16th floor, which was great as we ofen had drinks together. They were very busy and our check in staff had to tell another staff next to her that was offering a man the same room number as ours with " 1627 is mine" he was then offered another room...this was a little disappointing because it would suggest that the rooms weren't booked at all.... we paid the travel agent immediately as was the request of the hotel when we booked....does this mean ' a lucky dip' for rooms???? You

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Reasonable value - but noisy building works next door!
desc: Given the cost of staying in Singapore, this is a decent value place. A bit dated, bathrooms need some refurbishment.... but absolutely fine and I'd recommend it as a mid range place to stay. Excellent central location. The view from the top floor bar is fantastic, a great view of the Marina Bay light show at night. The only negative for us was the building site on the adjacent plot. Even though we were on the 17th floor, the noise from the building site was very intrusive - and it starts very early in the morning. Doesn't seem to be much sound insulation in the windows..... beware!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: One of the best hotel for F1 (perfect location)
desc: We chose this hotel at last minute (2 weeks before F1 event on 2017). The price quite high but compared to other hotels nearby somehow it feels like we got the best deal. If you come for F1 (especially for the entertainment located on Padang stage) this is the perfect hotel for you. Located right in front of Gate 3, you can even see the building from Padang stage so yes, it is conveniently close enough. The room kinda small, it won't even fit an extra bed. So for a family with 2 kids bettee choose executive room with 1 double bed instead of 2 singles (some of the executive rooms has sofa bed.. ask for it). Lots of restaurant in walking distance, and it is also walking distance to cityhall MRT station.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central Location ! Friendly Staff
desc: Great location 350M to MRT City Hall, easy access to Clarke Quay,China Town, Raffles City, Marina Square/Marina bay Sands, Bugist St, Suntec and 25-30 minutes to the Airport by taxi. Hotel is old but good size rooms , clean and staff welcome you well and take extra care of your stay. Rooms equip with handy mobile phone you can use free to call domestic numbers. Comfortable bed and 270 degrees view of the City from their Skylounge! Spenilli coffee cafe at ground floor. Coleman's restaurant offers healthy breakfast. Oxtail a must to try! Mr. Noordin will make you feel special as a guest. Highly recommended for Groups, First time travellers,Business & Family.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 2nd visit and more will follow
desc: My first visit (business related) was not overwhelming, so my expectations were not very high. But it was a nice surprise. My room was higher up, so the street noise was way less. Excellent breakfast in the sky lounge club. 2 points of attention: wifi connection was not ok Airco at 14°C, even when you are not in the room is not really eco-friendly. The classic message trying to convince you to limit the pile of laundry seems a bit ridicule at that point.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good sized rooms in a good location
desc: I first stayed in the Excelsior Hotel over 20 years ago and was interested to see if it had changed much. Many people have said the decor is dated - I have certainly stayed in worse. The rooms are a good size and have tea/coffee making facilities. The staff were nice and happy to help with our queries. We arrived early and our room wasn`t ready but they offered us the use of showers to freshen up and held our bags until we could check in. Our flight wasn`t until late in the evening so again they let us use the showers and pool after check out. There are two pools and the showers in the Peninsular pool area were far superior to the Excelsior Hotel. I prefer the pool in the Excelsior as you can`t be seen from the lobby. The hotel is in a great location very near City Hall

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Avoid this hotel at all costs
desc: After booking and paying in advance for three nights, we arrived on the second day due to our flight being cancelled. At check in we were told no rooms were available. After half an hour we were given a room. Not only was the room dated, it was covered with mould. On the second night there was no hot water and 12 hours later management still couldn't tell us when hot water would be available. This is a very substandard hotel and should be avoided at all costs.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great stop over
desc: We stayed 3 nights as a stopover on our way home ,we scored a early check in , to a large room with great views to the bay . The room was quite , despite construction works next door. The coffee shop at the entrance had good coffee and rewseatsoutside to watch the world buzz past. Also great cakes

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location and staff
desc: We read a few bad reports before going and were worried however we had a great ecperience. Staff were great, our room had an amazing view - see picture and the bed was very spacious. Location is amazing just around the corner from the CityHall train station. A little noisy with nearby construction but didnt impede sleep. Sleight negatives were small bathroom and probably time for a refresh.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent location
desc: Excellent location, at a walking distance from Marina Bay Sands and the most famous attractions of Singapore. Nearby, it is possible to find restaurants and shopping mall for a quick look at the local business. Go for it, excellent ratio price quality

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: worth spending
desc: we enjoy our 5 day stay in this hotel because it is near to everything, city hall mrt, bus stop, walking distance to Merlion Park and Chinatown, complete with toiletries, towels, bathrobes, big size bed, buffet breakfast, bath tub, swimming pool is great

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Hotel!
desc: Before our stay, we were worried because of the bad reviews but still we were hoping that everything will turn out great. Great location and staff. and most of all, the sea view from our room window was AMAZING! The room was spacious with very comfortable beds. Buffet breakfast was superb with lots of choices. Over all, our stay ( Aug.31 to Sept.03, 2017 ) was GREAT!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: OK Hotel in Good Location
desc: Just back from a 5 night stay at the Peninsular Excelsior. First impressions were good as the lobby was nice but the customer service leaves a lot to be desired. The reception staff member Mary was abrupt and disinterested and no welcome or room instruction was given. Check out was the same. Room was small but comfortable with a view over the park. Air con was great. Difficult to get in and out of the shower as it is over the bath and very narrow. Outdoor pool was nice but with construction happening on both sides of the building meant it wasn't very relaxing. Make sure to go to the Skybar on the 22nd floor as the view is spectacular - don't miss the lightshow at 8pm and 9pm. The location is perfect - very near the City Hall MRT and a short walk to Clarke Quay. Money

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Happy with this one
desc: We had a 2 night stay in a comfortable room that had a queen size and a single bed. Plenty of space and beds were comfortable. Large bathroom. We were on the 1st floor overlooking the swimming pool. Thank goodness it had air conditioning as I found the heat overwhelming and apart from leaving to go out to dinner and to Gardens By the Bay, I stayed put. Ground floor staff organized for us to catch a free bus to the Gardens By the Bay which picked us up right out front. They also held our luggage until our transfer picked us up at 8:30pm. We organized for a late check out until 6:00pm (check out is normally 12:00 midday) - like everything in Singapore you have to add on service fee and tax to all quoted prices.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Could be much better
desc: Room was very tired. On arrival we were informed that only twin room was available, double room was booked approx 6 months ago.Problem was"remedied" by pushing the 2 single beds together. Card switch had a problem which meant we had no light or air conditioning for approx 1 hour. Food was okay & staff were friendly, but room and fittings definitely need updates

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but thats all
desc: This hotel urgently need a BIG makeover. The breakfast seating was organized by two rude, impolite ladies. The alternative was close to elevator or close to a "Sunday church" service. The onion in the omelette was raw. Kitchen staff filled up food on the plates using their hands. When WiFi didn't work I was told by reception to go to my room and dial. Help to get a taxi, no way. The facilities needs to be upgraded and redecorated. Nearly all staff need to be trained how to treat guests. The management have a HUGE amount of work to do.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Mr
desc: Bed okay, firm as I like them to be. Room neat but tight. Window shutter, great! A clumsy architectural connection between the towers and the lobby. The hotel is bit above average. Shower curtain not good, dated. In room hot water kettle could spark fire - located within woodwork.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central location at affordable price
desc: Stayed 5 nights in late Oct, with partner, in deluxe room. The hotel is a little dated, however we still had a pleasant stay. The good: generous king size bed, block out curtains worked very well, ducted airconditioning worked well; room was spacious, TV had good reception and access to many channels; good wifi; room cleaned & replenished every day; plenty of power sockets available (just had to unplug a lamp or two). What need improvement: shower curtain was smelly, needs to be replaced/washed. Shower head was not fixed to the wall, and needed a bit of fidgeting to get in right position (may be problem for taller people). Note that our other friends who stayed in a different room to us, had glass doors in their shower, which I would have preferred. There is construction

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location - affordable
desc: We have stayed at this hotel many times and even though we have experienced problems, we always end up enjoying ourselves. We have found it pays to check out your allocated room before unpacking, then if you are not satisfied it is a lot easier to ask for another room. This time we were there 3 days and the first room we were given was facing a building being renovated. We managed to get another room, lower down but facing the fire station.We have had this view before and love it. I had to force the issue a bit but then the language barrier did not help. Luckily another receptionist stepped in and helped solve the problem. Breakfast was fine, only complaint was the bacon. I love crispy bacon but it was too well done. A note to the Concierge on the Excelsior side - I asked

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nicest Hotel i ever stayed in Singapore
desc: A nice hotel with a good style. The room was cosi and clean. We had a supirior room with a sofa on the window where you can look all over the city. The hotel breakfast is very good and has for every teast from around the word

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Absolutely terrible
desc: You'd be better off in the park across the road. Beds are hard as a brick, smells of cigarettes, breakfast was the worst thing ever! Put do not disturb on our rooms to come back in 30 min later to see someone had been in our room. Bathroom is dirty not a great experience for such a great city.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Handy for a short stay
desc: Perfect for a short time, great location. Perhaps not the most modern or fashionable but comfortable and clean. I was surprised to see such a spacious room for a very affordable price. Definitely value for money. Wonderful to rest and run.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Well located but perhaps due for a refurb
desc: We stayed for a few nights only but didn’t unpack our cases as there was very little storage to use in our room....perhaps other rooms had more? The bed was rather too firm for our liking too. Lots of options for breakfast but overall the food wasn’t the most appealing but at least there were lots of choices. We thought that this hotel was very well located around restaurants and shopping.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Lovely Room
desc: Stayed in a very nice room 1716. Staff friendly and attentive. The outdoor pool area and changing rooms looked dated and tired. Good location-within walking distance of all major sites. Didn't have breakfast so cannot comment

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Handy Location
desc: Our room was comfortable, but not large, with a view of the other wing and construction site next door. The hotel location allows for easy access to City Hall MRT, buses to Chinatown or walking to Clarke Quay and Fort Canning. Our room was quiet with no road noise and little noise from the corridor. Quick lifts. Small hawker centre around the corner and one underneath for cheap meals. The hot water took a long time to come through in the morning. Front desk staff could be friendlier. When checking out I mentioned that the shower "hose" needed attention and was told I could ring maintenance.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Dirty, noisy, drab - would not return
desc: Very disappointing. Knew it was 3 star and normally do 4 star, but thought hey as long as it is clean - you don't spend much time in your room. Location was great, with trains, buses and hop on hop off bus nearby. Room very dark, dingy and dirty. Needed a good vacuum and clean. Out our window was a massive construction site which is not going to be completed until about 2020! They started work at 7 am. Two sides of hotel have construction sites on it so your chance of avoiding a room near it is slim. We were on 7th floor. Very busy hotel with a lot of noisy children running around corridors. Breakfast very very ordinary, second day we went to Mcdonalds!. Am sure you can find better than this place. Also had to hand my card over while they processed a security hold of

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Hotel
desc: Stayed here for 4 days, an hour or 2 after we checked in ,the road works outside decided it was a good time to start breaking up the concrete at 9pm.I went straight to reception, complained,and we moved to excelsior tower on the 16th floor. Nice quiet room.Happiness. Hotel is central to everything,close to raffles mrt, has its own shopping centre complex and another across the road,nice little local eatery around from tower,great cheap local food,rooms clean and comfortable, breakfast was a good variety and great,real fruit juice!! After 3 weeks of travelling asia,2 swimmimg pools, one pool is by reception and 1 side is a glass wall so people checking in/out, sitting in reception can see you swimming,not sure what the purpose of that was but didnt stop us from cooling down in

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: could be better
desc: Paid for extra night as we arrived from London around 7am and wanted to sleep Was allocated the 14th floor overlooking the construction site, bad choice as it was too noisy. Hotel staff should have given us a less noisier room Room nice, bed was very comfortable, no spare sockets to help charge our phones Central position Wife lost her prescription glasses in toilet or café. Not very helpful in looking for it Wi fi very very slow Bellhops and Rochelle were very helpful Issues were minor but could have been sorted out very easy Not sure if we would stay there again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location and Hospitality
desc: The location of this hotel plays a part in attracting business travellers. It has cozy and spacious room with city view. The lobby and swimming pool is a speciality. The multicusine food offered along with world-class hospitality makes it a visit again destination.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Myanmar Food
desc: Most of the shops , restaurants and people are from Myanmar . If you want to try Myanmar foods , you should go there and eat . I prefer the Inle restaurant at the basement . One set meal is about S$10 . The taste is very good . You can try the Noodle too . You should also try at Ya Nant Thit or Zay Yar restaurants ...

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: DON’T STAY HERE.
desc: We booked a room for 2 adults and 2 children. Apparently this hotel doesn’t think kids need beds. They gave us a room withy 2 single beds. Despite my arguments to the contrary, and speaking to the manager, they held the line that kids don’t need beds. Not sure where they are supposed to sleep. DON’T STAY IN THIS HOTEL. We paid for a room (and presumably beds) for 4. We didn’t get it. It’s a scam. Feeling pretty ripped off. I expected better of Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nicely located
desc: Great location located in a shop and across the road from another mall it has plenty of places for cheap eats. A 7-11 is available for basic stuff and a food hall across the road can cater to most needs, eating early is a must as the vendors run out of foods.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointed
desc: Check in was disorganised, took 30 mins to get bags from lobby to room. Did not have a room we booked, so we got stuck in a room used by smokers that absolutely stunk of stale smoke. Woken up at 7am by the construction work next door. Apart from that it is handy to everything

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Comfortable with a good location
desc: We stayed for 2 nights on a stopover on the way home to Sydney. Our room was spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was included and included plenty of variety. On our last day after checkout we were given access to the hotel's facilities while waiting to go to the airport. Thank you to the hotel staff. A good location for access to the sights of Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointed
desc: I have to start by saying that this is the first negative review I have written. We arrived early in the morning after an overnight flight from Europe, we didn’t expect to get our room early. When we checked in we were told there was rooms available but were smoking rooms, who in this day and age still allow smoking in the hotel. We obviously declined the offer, as we were stuffed, I asked if there was an upgrade available, no was the answer. I then asked if there were any non smoking rooms available at all, as we had pre- paid for our room, I offered to make up the difference, this was the spur to find a room. Miraculously a room became available at an extra $50 plus taxes per night, we didn’t care, so we agreed. We were given room 15 on the 16th floor, what a dump. If we were

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Best place to stay for a short visit to singapore
desc: Our hotel of choice. Good central location, close to rail and bus. Short walk to the river side. Clark quay etc. Rooms spacious, service in all areas great Highly recommended and we will return again when next in singapore

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Just a place to sleep
desc: Convenient but the facilities need upgrading. Don't expect too much, it's just a room to sleep at night. The bedside lamp wasn't working, to my surprise cause it was unplugged! This already told me how well the hotel is being managed. Will I stay there again, probably not!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Convenient settings for a diner with 100 guests
desc: This hotel will get you what you expect: * food is ok * service is ok * price is ok * acoustic is ok The important is that you will have the opportunity to mingle in a room where you will not be disturbed Enjoy!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Hotel
desc: Location is definitely a PLUS point. View from higher floor is GREAT. When one is on free and easy holiday, this is the place where public transport is easily available and really close by. The staff at the lobby is simply fantastic .. always readily to assist you with your planning for the attractions and guiding you on the transport mode. So helpful and friendly. Guest Relations Manager Rochell and team is so meticulous to note of my birthday and surprised me with a box of chocolates.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, good hotel
desc: Stayed 3 nights and visit to Singapore was after a lapse of over three decades to see the changes to the city. The location was perfect within walking distance to Bugis Street, Chinatown, Clarke Quay, etc. And if walking was a bit much in the heat, City Hall rail stop was very close to the hotel. Didn't eat at the hotel other than a snack with cocktails in the lounge on the 22nd floor which had a spectacular view. Worth having a quiet break up there for that alone. The cocktail menu was interesting as it had drinks that I hadn't seen for years. And so I opted for a Snowball which was Advocaat and lemonade. Opposite the Fire Station around the corner from hotel is a street food centre which had plenty of locals eating and drinking. We thought that it must be good, and

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Overhaul Overdue
desc: Will not be staying here again for many reasons. Combined shower bath very old, very narrow, very high and just generally not suitable for anyone with height or joint sensitivity. Air con effective but very loud! Construction site next door of which we had no warning and no sound proofing. We were told building would cease at 6pm but it went 24 hours. Breakfast very poor- poor service, food cold, seating limited and of a poor quality. Location unsuitable for modern shopping. Pool was outside lobby and transparent. Unbelievable!!! Restaurant dinner was very expensive, not hot and low quality. Air con was freezing. We only ate there because we were due to leave for airport and there are no nice air conditioned restaurants within coohee of hotel. Two positives were free

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Location is very good
desc: The location is very good ，it is very close to the food market. China town And all the other see sightings area. The room is very clean and nice Air condition is very good and overall is good . It got all the supplies like bottles of water Coffee and shower liquid . Singapore is a nice and clean place Good for travel

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Weared Interior
desc: Interior and furniture is weared, smell of cigarette's smoke even in non-smoking rooms. So it's a bit pricey for the old conditions. Swimming pools are small and too much chemicals. On a plus side, central location with nice views, and healthy and delicious breakfast.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but lacks in areas
desc: I’ve just concluded a stay at the Peninsula Excelsior hotel, had I know there was a major development next door I would never have stayed here, especially given my room was facing this particularly noisy development. I was disappointed this hotel lacked any international power sockets as I have seen in many hotels now, in fact my room had no available power sockets whatsoever and I needed to unplug items to charge my devices. Two incidents with the housekeeping staff here were of concern to me. The first involved them leaving their access card in my room, I assume this could have accessed any room, no one attempted to locate or recover, at least I was not one to take advantage of this. The second incident, the following day, I returned to my hotel room in the middle of the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great locality....
desc: Our travel agent picked the spot.... Great locale... Fort Canning Park was spectacular. The hotel is exactly what I expected... Friendly staff... Excellent breakfast buffet.... Clean and good sized rooms for a couple.... However the best find was the Beauty and Wellness House across the road in Peninsula Plaza.... Had the best foot massage ever... Amy was gold.... It's a tiny shopfront just beside the information desk... But pure gold.... Treat your feet after a day out exploring...

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: This hotel was booked as a Singapore Airlines Stopover Holiday which included transfers to and from the airport. We paid for a room upgrade on arrival, partly to get our room earlier but also for the view. Our Clubroom gave us access to the Skylounge offering complimentary drinks and snacks from 18.00 to 20.00 and an amazing view over the Marina area.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very central
desc: Very central to trains and buses, money changer and small shop for essentials. Two buildings but all eat breakfast at biggest one. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms very big with views. Breakfast was a great variety each day.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location. Decor a little faded.
desc: We arrived on 1st Nov.from UK. We were very tired so chose to have breakfast in the hotel. The buffet was very disappointing both in variety and quality. The waiter wanted to charge me extra for green tea! The staff were generally helpful, though it was surprising to find that the concierge staff lacked a good grasp of english. This almost was disastrous for us as we nearly missed the shuttle to the airport as they either did not understand or check that we were on the passenger list.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location but not so great hotel
desc: It was a business trip that required a central location and this hotel was great at it. Room was good too - good size, key amenities and good choice of TV channels. However, such super important aspect as breakfast was totally disappointing. Room service is horrible at communication and require several days to reply to email inquiries. Overall, given hotel's physical condition, it was overpriced.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Had a terrible stay
desc: It is a very dated property with construction going on around three sides of the hotel, it was a nightmare staying there, we had to shift our room at 11 in the night, as the construction work was still going on leading to lots of noise disturbance. And got a nice room only after seeing 3 other rooms and the constant follow up with the duty manager. The other staff at the hotel dining area is also very rude and was very racial towards Indian's. Will Never ever reccoment it to anyone.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A great value place to explore SNG
desc: The room was fine, the check in was smooth. This is what you really need after a 12 hour flight from the UK en route to Australia. The pool is quite quirky with a see through side but it does the trick, it is what you need. For us the best thing about this hotel is its location. A 5 minute walk from the waterside, 2 minutes from the f1 track and 2 minutes from the MTS with direct trains to the airport and sentosa link. .

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excelent
desc: Stayed for 5 days the location is excelent you can walk everywher and there are plenty of places to eat within 500 mtrs Would definitely stay there again Walk to marina bay sands takes approx 20 mins but if you wish the mrt will get you any where in singapoe inexpensively although singapore is not a cheap place unless you are happy to eat and drink like the locals

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good - apart from the beds
desc: Visited here late last year as a party of three - (my parents and myself). The rooms are pretty average - they were clean and pretty spacious. The restaurant downstairs was amazing, the breakfast's were delicious and the dinner meals were gorgeous. The hotel is located in a perfect area -really close to the stamp museum (literally one minute) and it is also within walking distance of Clarke Quay, National Singapore Museum, Orchard Road and the Merlion Statue. The only issue my family had was that in our room there was a bed (for my parents) and I slept on a roll-away bed. My bed was very comfortable however, my parents complained that there bed was not comfortable at all. That is the only negative thing we had during our experience -hence the three stars.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ideal for a 2 night stop over...
desc: We stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel for 2 nights in November 2017 as part of our honeymoon. The staff were very friendly and attentive, the rooms were clean and spacious with an extremely comfortable bed and the location is idea for exploring Singapore. The free wifi and safe were also appreciated. My only criticisms of this hotel is that there is a slight damp smell throughout the entire hotel which isn't great and the view from our hotel room looked on to a building site. We were also slightly disappointed to be given a twin room when we requested a double and when we asked at reception if this could be changed, they said they only had twin rooms left. The hotel was ideal for our quick trip to Singapore but I'm not sure if I would return.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location
desc: We choose this hotel for its great central location and was not disappointed. Rooms are quite spacious but this was offset by the small shower cubicle. Good breakfast. Had a problem with a sagging corner of the bed. When notified, the staff place a foam rubber mat on the bed. Did not fix the problem. Turns out that when I moved the bed, I found that one of the corner casters underneath had fallen out. The good news is that this hotel in not overly expensive. Would stay again for that reason.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: What a wonderful place to stay
desc: My friend and my self stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel for 10 days whilst in Singapore, what a fabulous hotel the Peninsula there is nothing bad I can say about this hotel. Colemans Cafe Restaurant the breakfast was fabulous it caters for all nationalitys the food was always hot very tasty and the omelets made to order were excellent On Saturdays and Sundays there is a buffet Lunch absolutely FABULOUS everything was very tasty hot and served with a big smile and a welcome. The staff there were very attentive to all your needs but I would like to thank Mr Nordin Aziz who always spoke to myself and my friend every morning making sure we were happy with the food and service which we were he brightened up our morning with his friendly smile. He is a credit to the hotel and

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not bad, but as good as expected
desc: Some areas need looking into, general standard of rooms, the bathroom abit shabby, the bed quite hard. The room abit shoggy, smells a little bit, and so on. Otherwise all things in place, nothing terrible.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: You get what you pay for
desc: Hotels in Singapore tend to be expensive, and this one is a bit cheaper than some nearby. But you get what you pay for... High spots: - Breakfast is varied and plentiful - Neat to have decent sized coffee mugs - Staff friendly and competent - Bed firm Lows: - Gym closes early and opens late making it hard for someone on business to use it - Corner room had interesting quirk that you couldn't shut the shower room door whilst inside the shower because it opened inwards (something I solved by dismantling and re-hanging the door so it opened outwards) - Pray that there isn't a fire! Hotel fires are not to be dreamed of, but a necessity is fire escapes that are in good order. The one I walked down was dirty, littered with papers and cigarette ends, and decked out with cleaners'

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average hotel
desc: This is the first time that I have stayed in this hotel and I visit Singapore at least once a year. The entrance smells like mouldy aircons. The entrance needs to be spruced up. The lifts are the slowest on the planet. The reception is located on the 5th floor. The reception staff are efficient, but not really friendly or helpful. The rooms are a good size. You can hear the doors of the other hotels rooms banging shut all night. The wifi is beyond terrible. The beds are so hard that the floor is softer. Not sure if I would stay here again, only stayed here because it was close to where I needed to be. The staff at breakfast are not very good at making sure guests do not push in. When I stayed here there were a huge contingent of guests who had no idea how to wait

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Won't stay here again
desc: Not being to Singapore before didn't know what to expect in accommodation it was booked by our travel agent and we did check out the reviews that seemed Alright that was back in April when we booked. We arrived mid evening after a international flight and very weary. Got to our room and claustrophobic hit us room very small not like in the brochure. Went to have a shower no towels. Got house keeping to bring them up. Restaurant was still open ordered a chicken Curry not again full of chicken bones legs. Then we didn't get much sleep due to the matteress being as hard as a rock. That was our first night. Next morning we tried breakfast hot breakfast bacon I don't mind crispy bacon but this was past crispy it was salty and had a different taste that I haven't come across before.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central to everything, sites, train system and shopping.
desc: Spent 6 nights at this hotel. At check in told we had been upgraded to club floor but were 2 single beds. Housekeeping covered in one sheet and pushed beds together. Room had a fantastic view across to Marina Bay. The beds were hard which is common in Asian countries, not a problem for us. The rooms are a little tired, but clean. but the location is the biggest plus. You are a block from the Train system. We used the trains to go everywhere. Very central to many attractions and shopping. Coffee shop on ground floor if you are happy with coffee and muffins or pastries. We bought 2 large cappuccinos and a couple of pastries or muffins and it cost about $20 SGD, this suited us to have before we went off for the day. Did not use the pools. The sky bar has a nice view

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good cental hotel in Singapore
desc: Overall experience was good, room was spacious and clean (if a little dark inside), bathroom was fine, though not exceptionally large, and the breakfast was extensive and international in scope. Hotel is located near to several city attractions including the Singapore Art Museum and one of the main shopping malls. It has two 'wings' in terms of buildings which can be somewhat confusing on arrival after a long flight, also in terms of the entrance to the hotel itself. Would benefit from being updated in terms of decor and amenities, but if staying for a short trip it is quite adequate and not as expensive as many others in the area if budget is a concern.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Brilliant location - nice hotel - recommended
desc: I have stayed at Singapore on business a lot, usually Holiday Inn Atrium. I wanted to take my wife and show her SG and wanted an affordable hotel nearer to the main tourist spots. I did a lot of searching and found this wee gem! I ended up booking direct with hotel as the rate was as good as Expedia/Booking.com etc. Stayed for 4 nights (moved to the 5* Stamford) for our last night in SG as a treat! We were upgraded to the 18th floor, which is as high as you can go without being given executive club access. The view was directly to marina Bay Sands - I was a happy chappy with that! (It was a pity the windows were a bit dirty on the outside though). The room was good, the bathroom was amazing - separate shower and bath that allowed myself and my wife to bathe in parallel -

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel in a brilliant location
desc: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our honeymoon and it was a very enjoyable stay. The hotel is very conveniently located in the midst of the city and is very easy to get to. Our room was a decent size although the bathroom was a little smaller than ideal. The view was very impressive, overlooking the marina bay area and we were happy to sleep with the curtains undone as it was so spectacular. The staff were very courteous, helpful throughout our visit. Check in and checkout were very smooth. WiFi is of a really good quality in both the lobby and our room. When we were checking out, the hotel staff were very helpful. Our flight was not until 2am that night and we were able to store our luggage and then come back in the evening to get a shower before heading to the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not the best for customer service..
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights, and we were in a Deluxe Twin room but it was difficult to see what was deluxe about it. The room was fairly small, no storage space for a long stay. The beds were very hard and quite uncomfortable, the bathrooms needed re-grouting as it was going black and there was a gap in the tiles between the wall and the bath. All in all, it was clean and the bedding was changed everyday, which is what matters the most. The breakfast buffet is vast, with enough food to cater all tastes. The weekend buffet is just as impressive. When we checked out, we mentioned the problems we had with the room, but the receptionist didn't say a thing or react in any way which i though was just rude.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 3 nights before cruising.
desc: Arrived after a 7 hr flight and 2 hr delay on our baggage due to electrical storm. Allocated room next to construction site. Noise still going at 10pm. Called 3rd time to front desk. Duty manager changed our room to excelsior tower from peninsula tower. Up graded. Very happy with the room and stay. Hotel great location would recommend their buffet brekky. Close to on off bus stop. Another bonus.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very good and convenience hotel in the city center
desc: The hotel rooms are large and clean, staff are professional except the lobby lacks of light, Breakfast seems to follow up chinese tourists demand more than other nationalities but acceptable. Overall, It is a good selection for travelers to stay in Singapore

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great staff and location
desc: The staff were amazing with our little children and the room was large. Location was so easy to get around on the mrt and walking. The bed was like a rock and had to get extra cot and bed as they really only cater to adults and co sleeping in their set up. The breakfast was awesome with a large range of food and the coffees was good. A lot of construction around the building.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Expensive, old and tired
desc: We stayed for 1 night and thank goodness it was only one night in room on 9th floor. The staff at the lobby as we handed him a visa debit credit card and refused to take deposit from it saying it is not a credit card. The payments go through the visa system so what's the issue? Then he asked me for cash but we literally got picked up at airport and hadn't gone to a bank yet. He eventually write down our card number... For $260 aud this is way overpriced: tired decor, room so small that the door to the bathroom open just enough not to hit the toilet behind it. Main door open just wide enough to get in without hitting one side of the bed. 2 out of 3 lamps in the room do not work. Lack of power points to charge your own electronic devices. Construction next door's noise was

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: Stayed here for 8 nights with breakfast included in a standard / delux room Room was a good size and quiet on the 15th floor. Bathroom ok maybe a bit tired thought. Building work going on next door/ around didn't cause too much noise. Excelling location for fort canning no ten mins walk from Clark quay. Two pools - both reasonable size - afternoon sun only. Gym small but adequate (no views) Breakfast, standard for a large hotel, plenty of choice, busy at key times. Were lucky enough to enjoy breakfast in the sky lounge which had amazing views and a very good breakfast Good value, good location would stay here again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Noisy construction going on next door
desc: It is a nice hotel, but right now a new high rise is being built next door. It makes an awful noice, day and night. Otherwise it is very pleasant hotel and it is in a very central position, only five minutes walk from metro City Hall.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not the best
desc: I stayed in the Peninsula for 3 nights and I should admit that there are a lot of other hotels with the same price and better services especially there is construction going on, just next to the hotel and they work 24h, so you hear the noise all the night especially if your windows facing construction field. Staff is quite helpful.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but that’s about it
desc: Hotel is very centrally located but the rooms are old and small. The sink moves, the fridge has rust in it, beds aren’t very comfortable, internet is slow. They were late to check us in but did allow late check out. There is a lot of construction going on outside which is very loud and should have been made known on the website before booking as i literally picked this hotel over my one of choice as the other made it known they had construction going on. Overall an ok experience but I’ll go to another hotel close by next time which charges the same.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Beautiful hotel close to attractions
desc: This hotel is ideally situated near to the City Hall Metro, it is also close to the main attractions in Singapore. The rooms are generous, I was lucky to receive an upgrade which was a bonus & this hotel is ideal whether one night or several days in Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Location
desc: Read the reviews for this and other hotels in the area and booked our reservation. Upon arrival we immediately noticed a 'slight' odor entering the hotel, but we can't identify it clearly and didn't notice it in our room. For some reason, it took the reception staff nearly 20 minutes to help us checked in. Service at the front desk was poor -- no smiles or "thank you, see you again" Had booked a 'nicer' room and managed to get an upgrade in higher floor. Room was clean, comfortable and had the sea view. Shortly after our arrival, the service room guy holding a plastic bag removed all the items in our bar areas including in the fridge. Had to call the reception. Response was fast, and courteous. Due to the incident, manager offered us late check in for free. Wasn't able to

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Cosy room but noisy
desc: Booked a staycation at Peninsula Excelsior last weekend, 9 Dec. Was allocated a room at level 14, Excelsior Tower. All was well after check in. Room is very cosy. Love the cushion corner near the window. Great view. (You can refer to the pictures) Toiletries amenities provided. The only down side during my stay is that the room is not sound proof. My sleep was disturbed by banging doors, sound of vacuum cleaners, loud and noisy neighbours. It can be very irritating.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Old hotel with bad service and even worse room
desc: Where should I start, the air conditioning doesn't work, the hotel brings maintenance team, they promise to fix it, doesn't happen, noise from other rooms, cold water in the shower, the breakfast is good, stay away from this hotel

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Super View of Marina Bay!
desc: Great view of Marina Bay from our room! Enjoyed our stay here as it’s very central with shops across the road and it’s walking distance to many main attractions. Disappointed with room cleanliness as bathroom had hairs all over it. Room smelt like it needed a deep clean/ air freshener.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not happy Jan
desc: Have previously stayed here and loved it, so rebooked for this visit. Our "Superior" room was far from that. It is quite small, the view out the window reveals only roof tops, the refrigerator wasn't turned on, no face washer, only "milk" was powdered - I was advised to go and buy some, almost no cupboards to unpack clothes. Very disappointing!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ok hotel. Stinky room.
desc: Many plusses to this hotel- good location, malls and restaurants nearby. Camera stores and audio stores practically next door. Good service. Big bathroom. But, alas, my room smelled of piss. I would stay here again, but would be more wary of the room.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location but very big...
desc: I stayed here in December 2017. I had not stayed here before but my regular hotel is being renovated and as this one is across the street I went for it. Still love the location obviously, but the hotel not so much. It's very big, two towers, ca 600 rooms. Staff looked a bit flustered by it all, not really what I'm used to. My room was on the small side although it was apparently a 'deluxe' room. Nowhere to put my suitcase, and when I asked for a rack the reaction I got was that I was being a nuisance and took 2 days to arrange. The bathroom looked as if it had recently been renovated but if this was in my home I would be far from happy, very sloppy finishing. And dear management, we can tell! I was unlucky enough to get one of those rooms that has a door connecting it to the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good hotel but nothing special
desc: I stayed here for 2 nights. When I made the reservation, I specifically asked to be on the other side of the on-going construction but they still put me in a room facing the construction site. Having said that, when I complained, they tried to change rooms for me but apparently this was only possible for the second night. I didn't bother as to be honest there was hardly any noise so I was happy. Check in was quick. My room was small, the bathroom even smaller but all clean albeit a bit dated. The location is good - 10 min walk to the Marina Bay and Chinatown. Very well positioned next to the City Hall station for transport to/from the airport which is why I am giving it 4*. Otherwise, it would be a push for 4*. I wouldn't have been happy to stay longer and I would stay again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average stay
desc: We booked this hotel as part of the Singapore stover deal through Singapore airlines. I choose this hotel mainly because of its location - it is very central & we walked to Marina Bay from here. ‘We’ are a family of 4, kids 5 and 6. I made this obvious when booking through the travel agent that booked our flights. I’ve read multiple reviews saying that they don’t provide adequate bedding for children and we were also affected by this. 2 kids yet only 1 additional single bed provided. Our kids are little enough to top and tail for one night which is what we did but it would not be suitable for older children. Our room was quite spacious, we had a corner room so the bathroom was gigantic. There is a cafe on the ground floor which makes half decent coffee & I purchased take away

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Well located but needs a refurb
desc: We spent 3 nights on this well located hotel and easy to get to from the airport.However the bathrooms really need a refurb. Beds were comfortable. There a tiny step out of the bathroom into The bedroom which was really dangerpus I stabbed my toe unti I got used to it being there. The bath towels were all frayed and worn. Breakfast was not great apart from thd fresh fruit and the made to order omelettes. Pastries were awful like cardboard. Could not eat them. Probably will not stay there again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Adequate
desc: Convenient position near Clarke Quay, shopping centres, and if you would like some respite from the oppressive Singapore consumer lifestyle, it is a short walk up to Fort Canning Park. The hotel has all the usual amenities of a hotel of this rating and we had a nice view of the hill, however, the safe did not lock, and still could not lock it after the staff member had come to "fix" it, and unfortunately, the bed was like sleeping on a block of concrete. Just saying.....

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent
desc: Excellent room, comfortable stay, good location, best connectivity, near marina bay sands, Singapore flyer, safe as lift operates with hotel card only. Staff is helping. I am vegetarian so I have not tries the food.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Overnight stay
desc: We had a quick overnight stay here on route from Melbourne to London. The room was clean, the bathroom spacious, fantastic shower, close to Clarke Quay. We had 2 adults and 2 children in the room, but we were only given a room with 3 single beds (2 of which had been pushed together to make a rather uncomfortable queen bed). As our kids as only 9 and 11 we were able to make it work. It's a shame they didn't provide a roll away bed for the 4th person. I would however stay here again, great room, great shower, good breakfast.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Unscrupulous and misleading adverting
desc: I would like to draw peoples attention to what I believe is misleading advertising and unscrupulous behavior by the Peninsular/Excelsior Hotel, 3 Coleman Street, Singapore. I booked a room for 2 nights through booking.com for 2 nights 30/31 Dec to enjoy the Singapore NYE celebrations, specifically the fireworks display at MB. Please refer to hotel website/flyer promoting this event from the hotel & the pictures on booking.com When making my booking through booking.com (in early Nov) I specifically stated that I wanted a room with a view of the fireworks. I received a confirmation of my booking and heard nothing further back from the hotel concerning room availability. My payment of approx. SGD687 was processed on 19th Dec (prepayment). WHEN ARRIVING AT HOTELON 30TH DEC AT 5PM I

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Suitable for a quick stay
desc: We were worried about staying here after reading about the construction site next door and it certainly was there! We stayed on the 14th floor and had a wonderful view out over it which was quite fascinating, but it didn't disturb us. The hotel, although rather past it's best, is situated centrally, close to Raffles (if you are interested in Singapore's colonial past). We thought it was good value for money but don't stay here if you want luxury - there are plenty of other hotels in Singapore that cater for that!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hard beds
desc: I liked the location of the hotel, the service and the food. The rooms are nice and the pool is great. My issue is that the beds are super firm and neither my wife or I could sleep. I wont be back based on that. If hard beds are your thing then this hotel is great and ticked every box. If not.. look elsewhere.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Enjoyable stay
desc: My family and I booked two rooms at the hotel for Christmas and we were pleased with the connecting rooms given to us. We found lots of food variety for breakfast such as cereals, dumplings, noodles, pastries and salads. Taxi is easily available from the hotel location and is not far from main tourist attractions.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The Premium Suite was AMAZING!!!
desc: We were staying in the Premium Suite on the 17th floor, but did not expect the room to have such spectacular views of the city. Singapore is a futuristic city, the architecture absolutely blew my mind! The entire city looks like something out of a modern art display. Our room was a large spacious suite with a large bathroom with an actual bath, a cosy but comfortable lounge room seating area with the option of either a frontal view of the city (perfect for watching the 8 pm light display) or watching some in house movies. In addition, the very large and comfortable king size bed was like sleeping on a cloud - exactly what we needed. The hotel has two large swimming pools, a restaurant serving traditional dishes along with westernised food, many bars and tours available by

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Comfortable enough, yet didn't quite match the Excelsior monitor
desc: We stayed in Singapore for an extended stopover. The location is central enough and on our first night used the otherwise empty sky bar for a brilliant view over night time Singapore. The Singapore sling cocktail competed the evening. Our bedroom was large and comfortable enough. The bed matched the Superior designation of the room, which was clean and appointed well enough. However, the room showed signs of use and where work had been done to make minor alterations/repairs, the finishing let the whole thing down a bit. Breakfasts were generous in quantity but many of the cooked options were not to my taste. Apparently you can mess up scrambled egg; I didn't realise that. We found the staff helpful and friendly, making us feel quite comfortable for the duration of the stay. In

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Kindly staff
desc: I stayed this hotel with my family and guy at the reception, who made our room booking was really good. He guickly upgraded my room with marina bay sands view and spoke in my mother language "bye. Have i nice day". I really wondered and asked do no my mother language? He simply answered i googled it and searched. This excited my a lot. Nice staff and nice service. Liked my 2 room with connection as we had family trip.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very central
desc: We loved Singapore - the hotel is very central, close to bus routes and the MTR line, the hotel was clean, staff friendly and breakfast was lovely - a lot of choice. I'd recommend staying here. There were two pools and a gym too. We had a view of the Marina Bay hotel but there's a lot of building work going on around the hotel so lots of cranes around too.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Convenient location
desc: Our stay at the Peninsula Excelsior was quite comfortable and exceeded our expectations. We enjoyed the central location of the hotel, with easy access to the MRT, buses and taxis. We didn't have any issues with construction noise during our stay. The Sky Lounge was fantastic!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Convenient
desc: The hotel is very close to the metro station. It takes around 5 mins walk. The staff in this hotel are very nice. I had some issues with my phone and they were very helpful! The only problem is there was a construction site downstairs so in the morning at around 9 was a bit noisy.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good
desc: I went there with my boyfriend on 30 January 2018 for 1 night. Good point Receptionist, they are so kind Good location Cleaned Bad point (For me) A bit high price Cannot open the window in smoking room Carpet in the room (bad smell) Air-condition not cold

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A good base to explore Singapore
desc: We stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel during our 4 night stay in Singapore. We stayed at the hotel on a room only basis. On arrival we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a better room and breakfast. Slightly confusing as we were a honeymoon couple and therefore weren't sure if this was an upgrade due to that. I'm glad that we checked before saying yes as we were informed it would be at the added expensive of $200. We were allocated a room on the 13th floor of the Peninsula tower. The view was great looking out over Marina Bay Sands, however, there is currently a building site directly underneath the room which is extremely noisy. The room itself was tired and in need of a re-vamp. Due to the noise of the construction site below we asked to move rooms after our first

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: pictures look way better
desc: Just spent the weekend in Singapore and chose this place since I loved the pictures. I got an "upgrade" but have to admit that it was not very impressive. A small and average room with a tiny bathroom that really needs some renovations. Staff was nice, particularly the concierges. They maintained the WIFI while I was there, which was a bit unfortunate since I needed to get work done. Breakfast is way too expensive in my humble opinion for what they offer.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Do Not Stay Here!
desc: I was so disappointed with this hotel. I took my travel agent’s advice and stayed here, she had stayed twelve months earlier and obviously they knew she was a travel agent because she got much better service than I did! She booked me the same room that she had which apparently had a great view overlooking the landmarks of Singapore. When I arrived I was directed to “L” floor for the lobby where I would find reception. When I arrived in the lobby it was confusing because it appeared that the hotel is made of two buildings with the reception area physically separates them. Check-in was smooth and I went to my room which was on the 11th floor where I stayed maybe five minutes then returned to reception to let them know I couldn’t stay there because the room reeked of

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central Singapore
desc: We stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior for a few nights to break up our journey from Europe back to Australia. The hotel is well located in the centre of the city, very close to the metro, parks, bay and river. The hotel is a little dated and tired but the rates are pretty reasonable considering the size of the rooms and the hotel's location. The beds and line were of good quality and we generally slept well. The service was generally very good although check in took about 15 minutes which is very odd seeing we booked months in advance. The breakfast buffet was a generous gathering of low quality offerings. Not a great affair but you did not leave hungry. We would probably look at staying here again if the rates are appropriate down the track.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Check-in人員態度極差 **給錯房型**
desc: Just found out we booked PREMIER room but got DELUXE room! WE DO HOPE SOMEONE CAN GIVE FEEDBACK ON THIS UNBELIEVABLE MISTAKE! Really bad check-in service, super old&small bathroom, towels are dirty...awful experience...

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Stop over
desc: We stayed for 3 nights on the way to Australia. -Good central location -Spacious room -Firm mattress -Discounted breakfast with good selection. -Speedy lifts -Swimming pool -Close to City Hall MRT Negatives -room next to lift, noisy -building works adjacent to hotel so dirty and noisy -odd bathroom with big window looking into the bedroom. Strange. -room clean but bathroom was not. Grout and silicon need replacing and oddly cemented glass with a curtain too. Overall the location outweighed the negatives.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: GREAT LOCATION
desc: Located close to restaurants. the pools are great. service was good. clean rooms. would go back to stay again. walking distance to many eateries and shopping. break was great. for top dinning was fantastic.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Okay hotel in a good location
desc: I booked this hotel as part of a Singapore Airlines stopover, and as such it was very good value for money. However if I had booked it any other way, with free cancellation I would have changed hotel, due to the building work next door. When we arrived I requested a quiet room, and in fairness we couldn't hear the building work from our room, there were cranes were moving around even though it was late evening. Our room was fine, perfectly clean and serviceable, even if it is probably due for a refurb. Breakfast was adequate, and with the half price offer it was reasonable. We used the swimming pool which was nice. Later in the day I went to the other pool, but the building noise was too much to enjoy it. We were only staying for one night so the noise didn't really bother us,

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Well located but needs refurbishment
desc: The hotel is badly in need of refurbishment especially the bathrooms. It is in an excellent location though being an easy walk to many attractions and shopping areas. Most of the rooms have nice views but the hotel is currently surrounded by construction work which continues from 9am - 9pm without stop.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very Clean Room
desc: I love the old lady who always clean my room. I forgot to ask her name. She is the one in charge at the 10th floor. Breakfast is so good! There's a lot of choices. I can eat there everyday unlike other hotels that they have limited food.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A good value hotel in a perfect location
desc: We had a "superior" room on 16th floor which is their standard room. We overlooked the building works but it did not disturb us at all and was interesting to watch. Although a bit tired, the room was perfectly adequate for our uses which was sleeping! Very clean and pillows are comfy but I do prefer a softer bed. Good variety of toiletries, tea and coffee and a free bottles of water each day. There was a good variety at breakfast which included made to order eggs. Going down to the lobby to take the stairs one floor to the restaurant was no bother. And there is a fantastic view across Marina Bay from the Skybar and 2 small but nice swimming pools and a gym The hotel is a couple of minutes walk to the MRT at City Hall with connections everywhere including the airport and in

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location but views spoiled by neighboring construction works
desc: Stayed three nights at this popular hotel and certainly wasn't disappointed. We arrived at 10 am after a long flight from London and although the official check in time was 2pm the very helpful Manager allowed us an instant check in and also gave us a free Room Upgrade. Such good service is rarely found these days so well dont to the Lady who arranged this for us, sorry I dont know your name. The Hotel is well placed for all the major sights and very close to the central Bus and MTS station. Also, the Hotel will call you a Taxi which are plentiful and cheap in Sing. Hotel has two swimming pools and and exclusive Bar/ Club Lounge for your use. Only downside is that there are Major Construction Projects going on around the Hotel, not their fault but the do spoil what would

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Non-Indians may like the hotel. Indians?
desc: Peninsula.Excelsior Hotel are actually two different hotels with a connecting floor. I learnt this on my last day of stay. It may all be good. But they only have a common restaurant for the morning breakfast. Hence, those staying in the Excelsior jave to take the lift to the lobby level. And cross over to the Peninsula side and either take another lift or walk a floor down. Which is a pain early in the morning. About the breakfast, Vegetarians have less choice. And Vegetarian INDIANS, even lesser choice. Cause the restaurant served Vada which were not really great. A word of advise to the hotel is to serve it right or not at all. This was my second stay at this hotel. And during the first stay, we had lunch at their restaurant which had miniscule pieces of plastic/glass that

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central
desc: Our first room was very noisy as there was construction going on just outside the hotel. We asked to be moved and we were taken to the o5her tower which was great. Close to public bus and train . Staff were helpful and polite. Has two pools and a great sky bar that looks over the bay

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Over due for full refurbishment
desc: Wonderful in its ‘day’ which isn’t now. Location great, room size ok Staff are just average A greater deal of upside potential when this property gets its act together. Underwhelming to say the least. A 3 Star at best currently

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 3 nights in February 2018
desc: We got a rather small and bad room - much to used and not too clean. If you want to use the bath room your stormach must be small to pass by the door. We used the restaurant twice - the meal was really bad, but the breakfast was OK..

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: RichardB
desc: On the plus side it's central and convenient for lots of attractions, facilities etc. Also had nice big bed. On the down side it's a bit tired in terms of both the bathrooms and carpets. The breakfast in particular was poor. Plenty choice just none of it very good in terms of either quality of the food or the service. Also there is a construction site next door which our room looked directly onto. Really this is no more than a 3star hotel these days So all in all a hotel to avoid.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A hotel that needs updating in many ways
desc: We pre-booked and paid for a stay here twice - either side of a trip to NZ. The first room was ok, albeit it a bit tired looking but the second room was actually scruffy and slightly unclean. The bedding was clean but the bathroom wasn't and there were holes in some towels. A minimum of teabags in the bedroom and dreadful powered milk for the cuppas. The Coleman breakfast room was uninviting, as was the food. No choice on tea or coffee; there was one urn of instant coffee and one urn of stewed tea. We couldn't bare the thought of breakfast on a second morning - it was a complete waste of money. Building work going on around the hotel ( we realise they cannot be held responsible for this ) but from early in the morning to late at night where HUGE cranes are moving around

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Decent hotel in a central location, very busy
desc: We've been to this hotel before and we stayed again as we were attending a function nearby. Check in was pretty smooth, we declined an "amazing offer of SGD100++ per night to upgrade to a club room" as we had plans for every evening so wouldn't be able to take advantage of the benefits and it seems the SGD100++ was almost on parr with the regular rate, so not so amazing after all, just a ploy to shift the higher priced rooms. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a stunning view of a major building site next door, whilst the building work continued over our long weekend stay, we were protected from the worst of the noise as the hotel windows kept most of the noise out. The breakfast buffet was fine though extremely busy and noisy with guests from one nation pushing and

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Close to Clarke Quay
desc: Well located hotel which makes it very popular with all tourists. Currently has a new building being constructed next door which makes room views disappointing. The breakfast room is quite small for a large hotel and the breakfast experience is frantic. Good hotel for a few days stay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointed
desc: The only reason I might ever stay here again was the location. It’s on a great MRT line Cityhall and is a quick walk to the quays or Merlion Park. We stayed on level 20 every time we departed the lift we were blasted with a musty dank smell which lasted until we ran to our room. The bedding was clean but the floors unvacuumed and the whole room had a film of dust and other peoples hair. The bath was moldy. The shower was hand held with no where to attach it to the wall. I stayed in feb 2018 there was a lot of construction going on day and night which was noisy and made the area very dusty. I had booked a room with a view towards the marina, what I received was a room looking over a construction site on the other side of the building. I’m not sure what’s in the building next

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, good service, I recommend
desc: Check-in was quick, room was good size corner big windows a lot of lights very very clean. Shower very small size, clean, amenities were changed daily. I was very happy and comfortable with the room size, room service was a bit slow, room was always clean and neat after maid service. Check out was quick, registration counter clerk's all spoke English and were very professional. Concierge on the first floor provided maps and information in a very polite, professional way. This is my new home in Singapore I would definitely book this hotel again for my trouble needs.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not too bad
desc: We stayed here for 4 nights on our way home from Thailand and although it's not the best hotel it was certainly adequate for what we needed. We were in the excelsior tower on the 13th floor and had a pretty good sized room with good sized bed,good size safe and fridge mini bar but unfortunately the bathroom was very small and we could only just squeeze the two of us in.I do wish hotels would have more coat hangers in their wardrobes(we only had 6 so had to ring for more).View of the building site,but little noise. 2 nice pools as well All in all we had a good stay as this hotel is in a really good location with plenty of shopping,SMRT,Museums and St Andrews Cathedral just round the corner.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Hotel and Location
desc: We were a bit skeptical on our visit to this hotel as some recent reviews said that there is a construction next door which is quite noisy even at night times. Luckily enough, we were given a room in their other tower and therefore we did not hear any construction noises. The staff are very friendly and make you feel very welcomed in their hotel. The hotel decor is beautiful and so are the rooms. Views are also very nice if you are on the upper floors and the rooms are very spacious. The location is great, and within walking distance to most attractions. The only negative point that I have to point out is the breakfast. While the selection and choice of food is very vast, the taste leaves a lot to be desired. Even the sweets/pastries, feel that they are warmed up from day to do,

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Birthday Decorations
desc: I booked this as a stay cay for my GF's 21st b day and it was a lovely room with a beautiful view. Requested for birthday decorations and the decorations were better than expected. will recommend if y'all can't get decorations in time.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Avoid this hotel
desc: I have been staying at this hotel over the years and every time I have visited it has got worse. Now I have decided never to return. The front office staff are rude and unhelpful. They are very badly trained and inattentive. The rooms are old and carpets are dirty. My bathroom was musty. The Internet is unreliable. The keycards are unreliable and I had to update mine 3 times in one day. The hotel is surrounded by a lot of new construction making it noisy. Although I complained and was told I would be contacted by the Duty Manager, nothing happened. Never again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very good
desc: Very good 4 stats hotel for traveling. The hotel is in the center of the city near the city hall metro station. The main environment is near. Marina bay is near. Also there are lots shopping centers. The room is very clean.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointed
desc: Stayed in the tower, old & tired. There is a huge construction beside the hotel and that is what our window looked out on. The hotel needs to place this on their website due to the noise and privacy as you cannot open your curtains. I would not advise anyone to stay in the hotel!!!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Functional hotel ideal location
desc: This hotel was chosen for its location more than anything which, for us was ideal. Approximately 5/10 minutes walk from Raffles hotel and a 20 minute walk to the harbour, Boat Quay and the theatres. The rooms were clean and comfortable and when we had some downtime the pool was an ideal place to wind down ( which I know a lot of city hotels don't have).

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Overall a Good Hotel - Rooms are VERY dark
desc: Overall our stay at this hotel was good. We arrived early and staff went out of their way to give us a room so we could have early check-in. Our room was spacious and clean. BUT very very dark. We kept looking for more lights. A couple of lamps and a couple of downlights were not sufficient. Beds were harder than we prefer. Bathroom was spacious but had an annoying ledge at the entry that we had to be very careful not to trip on. Shower was excellent. We prefer to use a computer for internet & were told at check-in that we could go to the business centre at no charge to use a computer there. The staff there knew nothing about this & literally had to sneak us in. Breakfast was sufficient but not exciting. We were told it would be half price of $15 for us because we booked a

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location!
desc: We were worried about the Peninsula hotel having read the other reviews - but actually it was OK! The hotel is located a 5 minute walk from City Hal MRT station and within easy walking distance of the Marina Bay area with its harbour boat tours, (10 minutes) Marina Bay Sands Hotel skydeck (15-20 minutes) and the wonderful 'Gardens by the bay' sound and light show.
