(20 minutes). The large 5th floor lobby is a great open space area with access to two open air swimming pools. One is opposite reception and alongside a small gym. It is only 1 m deep but has glass sides making for interesting photo opportunities! the other is quieter and is 1-2 m deep. Both have sunbeds. Our bedroom was a corner room on the 14th floor. It had a large screen TV, shower, desk, cupboard for

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: centrally positioned and afordable
desc: we have just been there twice as stop over. The first time we were able to book in as early as 12 noon, the second we had complimentary late check out at 3 in the afternoon. In the time where you have not a room available thee is a large lounge next to the bar where they serve small tasty plates and of course wine

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent Hotel for short stays
desc: Nice hotel in terms of location and breakfast choices. Housekeeping is excellent. Neighbourhood across the street is noisy on Sundays. People are drinking on the street. Overall, my brother and I enjoyed our stay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location. Needs upgrade
desc: We booked 3 nights late April. Check in was very in personal with staff barely interacting with us. Very basic information was given .Room was on 7th floor.Damp smell was noted on exit from lift. Room was a reasonable size. There was evidence of repairs undertaken in relation to grouting etc on wet areas.This was very poorly done. Opened curtains to be confronted by large crane and construction work.Noisy! It was 7-00pm at night and no mention made at check in. The noise was audible from this construction.A saving grace in relation to construction works was that there was very limited work done on the Sunday. There was a large amount of dust under the bed indicating a very limited vacuuming. Breakfast food quality and variety varied from acceptable to poor. Some days items were

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Bad experience!
desc: I was in Singapore from April 16-20, 2018 for the medical follow-up of my husband. I chose the Penin sula Excelsior because of the location and reviews. What a mistake and waste of money. Definitely not worth it. The hotel is old and the room was not good at all. Pillow quality was bad, shower flooded in spite of several attempts of maintenance to fix it. I booked the premium floor because of my husbands condition and that did not help at all. The sky lounge had a good view which was the only good thing about it. There is massive construction around the hotel which they do not warn you about. There is a mall across the street that smelled so bad I couldnt stay longer then a minute. Do not recommend this hotel when visiting beautiful Singapore!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Awful hotel
desc: The hotel forgot to mention that the hotel is surrounded by building work. It's a nice enough hotel, with 2 lovely pools, but do not expect to sleep. It was massively noisy. I did complain and I was moved rooms but it was no better. Then, there were ants on the desk. I complained again but they refused to give me any monetary refund, which I was appalled at considering how much money I had paid. If you go to Singapore, just go sit in bar at the top of the hotel, which offers spectacular views. Don't bother staying here though.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Big rooms!
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights with family. Booked 2 superior rooms through a travel agency and requested for triple occupancies for both room. With the extra bed, it still felt like there was enough space for all 3 of us without getting cramped! The buffet was good too, just good enough to fuel you for the day. There is also a nearby Food Republic about a 5 min walk from the hotel. And Clarke Quay was just a 10-15 min walk away.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A very comfortable hotel with reasonable rates
desc: I arrived tired, sweaty and grumpy and immediately took the entire contents of the minibar into the bathroom so we could be alone with each other in the tub. The Peninsula Excelsior hotel offered everything I could reasonably expect, including, amongst a plethora of amenties, a very nice swimming pool. Breakfast was perhaps the only marginally disappointing part of my stay. The Keeper of Breakfast wanted to charge it to my room, even though I had proof I had already paid. Mine was a last-minute booking so I suspect her paperwork wasn't up to date. I wasn't double-charged so it doesn't matter. Having said that, though there was plenty of choice at breakfast, the hot items tasted a lot like they'd been waiting around for a while, such as tends to be the case with buffet

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location for exploring Singapore
desc: Handy to MRT station and Esplanade and Hop on Hop off bus stop.,Rooms on road side have good views of Singapore Flyer, two nice pools, friendly staff. Construction noise not too bad. Corner rooms which sleep 3 comfortably.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Downgraded to a smelly moldy room. Probably the worst hotel room i have ever stayed in, definitely the worst food
desc: After we had checked in and paid they told us the room (which we had just paid for) wasn't available. The room we were given was inferior to the one we had paid for and no discount or anything was given. (i have never gotten a free 'downgrade' before) The room was smelly and moldy and had 2 small single beds, when we asked them could they at least combine the beds they just pushed them beside each other. The bathroom was disgusting, the blinds were covered in mold as were parts of the ceiling and walls. I don't know how expensive shower curtains are in Singapore but ours was black with mold and they taught it was acceptable not to dispose of it and replace it with a clean one. On the first night we decided to eat (or at least try to) in the hotel restaurant. All we orderd was a

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Worst Hotel EVER
desc: i travel a lot in Asia and the price for this hotel (albeit during trade fair) was well over priced. it was noisy due to construction next door, there were bugs in the bathroom, I got a supposedly non smoking room - on a smoking floor!!! the finish of the room (as in paint work, tiles etc) was very very ordinary. I have never done a review on a hotel before and have never complained to management about a hotel in the 15 years I have been travelling - but I am compelled to do so now. DO NOT STAY HERE - FIND ANOTHER PLACE.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: Room was spacious but smelt a bit musty. All very clean. Towels etc minimum but requested more from housekeeping and they obliged. Breakfast good. No frills but value for $ and fabulous location. Would stay again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Noisy
desc: This was my third stay here and although I love the location, the view and the breakfast, the noise detracted from my stay. Even from the 16th floor, the road noise and nearby construction was loud and clear. I was also in a room where I could hear the elevators going up and down.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 3 night stopover
desc: Hotel is in good location, however it isn't recommended if you are a light sleeper. There is construction work taking place next door which starts early & finishes late. The noise from other rooms is rather bad, including their plumbing, showers etc. Also a lot of noise in hallways. The rooms are starting to look tired, especially bathroom. On the plus side, the pools are good & staff were helpful, especially concierge in excelsior tower.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good hotel
desc: Our room had fantastic views. Centrally located. All the staff are absolutely excellent. I would recommend the Duck Tour and the City Tour. 24 hour room service available. There is a fully stocked minibar in the room.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Pretty good
desc: It was my business trip in Singapore. This hotel's location is great as it is in the cbd, mrt accessible and easy to get a cab too. 5-10 mins walk to raffles city, where you can easily find f&b around. Room is clean and spacious, but a little noisy at night as I heard ambulance multiple times in the middle of night - very close to a hospital. Lift waiting time is pretty slow. Also the Check-in service was slow despite 3 counters serving not many guests in the queue.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent Location - Very Average Hotel
desc: The location of this hotel is excellent. Having stayed in a Singapore several times before we found this hotel fantastic for walking to well frequented tourist locations. We walked to Gardens by the Bay, Clarke Quay and also was in walking distance to the main shopping district near Bugis St. The hotel itself is tired and in urgent need of significant renovation. Our room although comfortable had well worn carpet with holes present. The room was reasonable and was a decent size. Our room had construction alongside us that started before 7am and continued until 6pm. I feel that this was bad luck but hopefully we werent placed here if they had better available rooms. I'm guessing / hoping that they were fully booked and this was all they had available. The pool outside of

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: We won’t be back
desc: Having booked this hotel 6 months ago it took 30 minutes at check in to find us a room at 7pm. Room was supposed to be a superior one but so cramped with no storage space and right outside the window was the building site! Huge panel missing in the bathroom. Another 30 mins before they offered another room which was much more spacious but still near the building site - we were not advised that there would be building works going on. Noise started at 4am and carried on til 9pm. Air conditioning was noisy too. A few issues with things in the room - safe didn’t work and neither did shaver socket and we think an apprentice did the grouting in the bathroom! On the plus side, we were a given a complimentary fruit basket and chocolates! The location was fine and central for MRT

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Do not recommend
desc: Cons: Loud construction underway right next to hotel. Walls between rooms very thin. Gym not very good. Have to walk through lobby to get to pool. Very busy and crowded. Pros: Room is decent size for the price. Bed is comfortable. Good location. I would not stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average
desc: Upon arriving the hotel, baggage was not taken out from the car quickly, had to call them and take out few bags myself. They must be alerted when guests arrive. And the room lock was out of order, the door never got locked when we went out (total negligence). Stayed in room behind lifts and there was constant noise of lifts operating. Still giving it 3 stars as prompt action was taken on the door lock and baggage service at check out was good. Staff behaved in a good way and the hotel room was tidy. Not a bad location to stay as well, Bus stop and MRT station are really close. The Raffles city shopping mall was on walking distance as well.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, good hotel
desc: We couldn't fault the hotel's location as it was accessible to many attractions. The room was comfortable, but they only cater for one suitcase with the other one having to be left on the floor. It's a double room, surely they can allow both people to keep their suitcases off the floor? Bed was comfortable, shower excellent, wi-fi pretty good too. We had breakfast at the hotel. Compared to other places I have stayed in Singapore, I thought the variety was inadequate and the bread was stale. We had booked a kingsize bed and got two singles which they pushed together. We had to ask for them to be made up as one. Not good attention to detail.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not a great experience.
desc: Construction going on right outside our window extremely late into the night and early next morning. We understand that that is not the hotel’s fault, but they could have said something or apologised and the rate really needs to drop for the room because of that. There is no chance to relax or have any form of quiet. The bed is extremely hard and super uncomfortable. Also the wifi is really hard to use. Only 2 devices can log on and seeing as it’s only the room number as the log on, other people can easily get on. We were too often unable to use the wifi as it said the maximum devices were already using it. Not a great experience here sadly.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Deluxe room?
desc: We stayed 4 nights at Peninsular Excelsior and about the only thing going for it is it’s central location. Our entire bedroom and bathroom was the size of our previous accomodations bathroom! There was not enough room for two suitcases, very little hanging space. Our room was right next to the lift so without the aircon blasting all you could hear was the comings and going’s of other guests all night. Room service is expensive but I’d assume the same across all of Singapore. I would recommend for singles or overnight accomodation only. It was so underwhelming I didn’t take a single photo of our hotel room.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Avoid at all cost
desc: This hotel is for you if you enjoy the noise of a large construction site next door. If you do not use internet because the wi-fi is terrible. It takes several attempts to connect (you need to call the front desk to reset the connection every time it disconnects). This is the perfect hotel for you if you enjoy slow checking in/checking out. The breakfast area is far too small for the capacity of the two hotels it serves.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, but thats about all.
desc: The location looked great on Google Maps, however noise, both internal and external, are huge problems. I’d suggest staying away from the ‘city’ part of Singapore when booking accommodation. Positives: Typical of large hotels, large rooms. Central location was good, however see negative comments. Negatives: Uninspired desk staff. Noisy! Décor very shabby for what purports to be a 4star hotel. We were upgraded to a large suite the second night after a noisy neighbour and lifts kept us awake, but the décor again was in desperate need of repair, as were some of the lights. Then the noise of construction workers on a building site kept us awake all night. Eating in the hotel and room service is very expensive $45 for a Laksa and small Caesar Salad room service, $12 for 325ml can of

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Had a Great Time!😁
desc: The Hotel 🏨 was really affordable,the Staff was friendly and helpful and The rooms were Clean and Tidy.I would highly really recommend them!😁😆😄.So have a great time and enjoy your stay with them!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Centrally located
desc: I chose this hotel because of its location. Overall not a bad experience but it seemed the room I was in was a bit old and just too small. Their lobby is very beautiful. I was there for a few nights and didn't have any complains.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ideally located 4* Hotel with good facilities and helpful staff. Recommended!
desc: This good value Hotel is perfectly located adjacent to the historical Civic District and St Andrew's Cathedral and only 10 minutes walk away from the nightlife centres of Clarke Quay and Boat Quay. It comprises 2 22-storey towers (unsurprisingly called the "Peninsula" and the "Excelsior"- we stayed in the former) with a common large Reception/Lounge area on the 6th floor, which also provides access to the swimming pools, Lounge Bar, Business Centre, etc. Typically for Singapore, our "Deluxe" room and the bathroom were smaller than we had encountered elsewhere in southeast Asia and the décor was a little "tired". However, our 17th floor room was well-equipped with large satellite TV, mini-bar, roomsafe, etc, and Wi-F- reception was very good. The room also provided an excellent

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Convenient location basic hotel
desc: This is a large hotel located near a shopping centre with a similar name. The reception is not on the Main Street but up a floor and it has 2 wings so to speak with 2 seperate lifts. I got a bit confused for a while. It is an average large hotel with its benefit being the location. The staff were very helpful and the amenities good

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Amazing staff
desc: We had 4 nights at this wonderful hotel - we cannot thank Ariane Rodriguez Garcia enough - she is the Guest Relation Manager - what a wonderful person, went out of her way to make sure our staff was amazing and it was - we loved the room looking over at Marina Bay Sands - thank you once again Ariane, hope to see you soon Grahame and Sue Adkins

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location close to Clarke Quey
desc: Read a lot of not good reviews, but have to say great hotel clean friendly staff room is very clean and well looked after you are close to everything Clark quey, China town the hop on hop off bus station just over the road of the hotel, a 711 just across the road in the Peninsula Plaza. One thing not happy about is the breakfast have to say not up to standard take the money you would have paid and go down to the exit on the right and eat breakfast a Sopinnis. Special thank you to Harry he helped us to change our pick up time for our flight back home very friendly. We will be back for a stay, yes their is construction going on but just look past it.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Stop over
desc: Average stay won’t be staying again. Construction work next door went on most of the night and kept us awake until early hours of the morning. The flood lights from the construction at night came into the room from the sides of the blinds. The bathroom could do with a make over looking tired and soiled. The hot water to the shower took about 15 minutes just to get warm - never got hot water. Breakfast was ok nothing to write home about. The staff were all lovely, friendly and helpful.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Pleasantly surprised
desc: I'd read some previous reviews so I was a bit worried about our stay here but was pleasantly surprised. The room was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious with a great shower and a bath! There was plenty to choose from at breakfast - the only complaint was that some of the dishes that should have been hot were cold or lukewarm. We weren't disturbed at all by the building works next door The hotel is in a great location; in walking distance to the river, Clarke and Boat quay and to all types of public transport. We would definitely stay here again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Construction very noisy
desc: During our stay this month the hotel was surrounded by major construction development. The noise level on the 9 Th floor was terrible workers were working till 5am most mornings. Our room requirements for a queen bed and three singles wasn’t adhered to as we were given 5 single beds . There was a short supply of towels for the pools my 3 children on numerous occasions were told to just use a wet dirty towel. I would advise anyone staying here to check what floor level they are on due to the construction works. The hotel is however in a great location it’s just a pity that issues like these ruin what should have been a great family holiday.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointed!
desc: I have been mislead by beautiful pics & 4 star rating which is nowhere closer when I arrived! The rooms were way too smaller than described & morethan that, the cleanliness need lot of work. Dirty sheets with spots, dusty windows were never appealing. There was a bad smell all over the hotel felt like sewer over flow. After several attempts of trying to sleep I had to ask for a room change at 4 in the morning. The second room was nicer & had more space although the first impression made me to book another hotel even tho I had paid for couple more nights. There were no compensation or monetary refund was offered which is very disappointing; although they tried to offer another room.. There were neither follow up nor any damage control was done from their end, which is

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: WiFi good, all the rest not so much
desc: Stayed in this hotel while on a conference, the good parts are WiFi quality, location and staff, which was very helpful and dilligent. Otherwise I was extremely disappointed, especially in regard to the 190€ price tag. The breakfast was about on par with an american motel, the rooms were, while clean, extremely damp, with humidity almost identical to the outside, which made sleeping very difficult. There was mold in the bathroom and next to the AC and the furniture was quite worn out.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Mr Achrekar
desc: We had v bad experience of the hotel.One of the reception Mr Harry misbehaved with us.We reached at 6.30 am and he made us wait without any reason asking for money.After shift change at 8 am we could get room immediately.He passed some bad remarks looking at my wife passport.We have complained to GM by way of feed back form asking to revert back on my e-mail regarding action taken.Hope they do so.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location and that's it!
desc: 1. Stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights. 2. Location is okay because it is just walking distance to various malls, MRT, 7-Eleven, and bus stop. 3. Their breakfast buffet is the worst. They served the same food for 3 straight mornings. For example, they just change the type of potatoes (day 1 - french fries, day 2 - wedges, day 3 - hash brown), sausage (day 1 - chicken, day 2 - pork, day 3 - franks). All other food are the same like the noodles, bacon, bread, lotus buns, rice porridge, pork and beans. 4. Room is small. 5. Toilet doesn't have bidet. 6. Sky lounge is nice because you get a nice view of the Marina Bay Sands. 7. Staff are not that friendly and accommodating. 8. TV in our room wasn't working properly. 9. The hotel needs to upgrade and refurbish its facilities because

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Mr & Mrs B
desc: We stayed ere for 5 nights must agree with most comments on ere, Construction Works going on both sides ok modern world but do really think Singapore Government should act no noise after 8 pm not going on till 4 am in the morning , Hotel dose need major upgrade all though we did up grade to a better room and breakfast for 300 spd great view see photos bed comfortable and clean shower powerfully and warm don't think lower floors will have much of a view after construction works finished, breakfast buffet style so much the same every day best choice fresh ommlets, would I stay ere again proberly not but if your on a budget It's clean and Comfortable

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Position to explore
desc: Room was fine - decent size and clean. Bed comfy - Pool great. Staff so so. Great place to explore from - walk to Clarke Quay, Raffles Shopping, St Andrews Cathedral, Orchard Rd - all within walking distance. Would stay again. We were in the Excelsior Tower and could not hear the building site.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Old and tired.
desc: I couldn’t recommend this hotel. The rooms are in dire need of an upgrade. Also at check in I was told only smoking rooms were available. They then decided they did have a non-smoking room available, unfortunately the smell in the room was disgusting, smoke smell would have been less offensive in hindsight. There are so many good hotels in Singapore - this ain’t one. Never again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good mid-level hotel with good service
desc: We stayed here for most of two weeks, the first week for work, the latter days for exploring the city. It's very centrally located and is an inexpensive cab ride or even walking distance to many of Singapore's attractions. The rooms are similar in size and amenities to a Marriott or similar hotel in the US, except they have a water boiler typically of all Asian hotels. The air conditioning worked fine and was easily adjustable. I had a small complaint about the tub/shower, as it was pretty narrow and keeping your footing while turning around was something I had to get used to. The hotel has a couple of nice pools and a large welcoming lobby. The breakfast, which you can have included in the hotel fee for "free" (but you pay a higher nightly rate) was decent, covering both

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Served its purpose
desc: We stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel as part of the Singapore Airlines stopover package. We arrived in Singapore in the morning and unfortunately could not check into our room until the afternoon (a little disappointing because we'd just flown all the way from New Zealand and I was sick with a cold so felt rather miserable). This of course was not the hotel's fault; (mental note, book later arriving flights or book an extra night to allow for an earlier check in). The hotel was in a good location, we were able to walk to most places. The room wasn't the cleanest though (the bedroom part was ok, it was more the bathroom). I'd read previous reviews and was a bit concerned about the construction noise people had spoken about. There was construction going on, however it

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A mid-range hotel
desc: We stayed at this hotel in June 2018 which we booked through the Singapore Stopover Holiday package. The room allotted was neat for the price although I would have expected a bigger room. I wasn't completely happy with the size of it. 4 stars for cleanliness. They had a kid-friendly glass-walled pool which my kids had a great time in. We didn't eat at the restaurants but I have to say food was over-priced. The hotel has a sky-deck which has an awesome direct view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel and their laser show(daily). The view of the Marina area just breathtaking. One other nuisance factor was the construction that was happening around the hotel and the noise that comes with it. Our room was in the 9th floor but didn't have any view of the city - we only saw cranes and

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Staycay
desc: Not the standard we expect of a hotel. Avoid this hotel there are far better and cleaner in the area. As you come out of the lift you are hit by the musty smell in the corridor to the rooms, our room feels damp, smells damp and is damp as mildew in bathroom. Lots of stains on bed valance, the room. Is grubby and smells dirty as well as being visually dirty, bathroom smelled of urine. This hotel needs a good deep clean and so will I when I check out in the morning. Aircon was noisy in the room! and move to another

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Pleasant oasis in the city
desc: From a very high floor the view of the Singapore river and Clarke quey are great, especialy at night, love the lights. The blockout curtains work well if you dont love the lights or the view. the room is comfortable and very quiet good for sleeping away those jetlaged hours. the staf are all helpfull and efficient allowing a late checkout. The bath robe was more for a asian size person than a european size me, and the slippers were poor quality, The bathroom ia a decent size and very clean.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Filthiest Hotel I have ever experienced
desc: I must start my review by being fair, the hotel is older and showing it's age, the hotel was definitely not expensive and the Guest Relations Manager, Ariane, was a shinning light in an otherwise terrible hotel experience. The location of the Hotel was central and very convenient and I was amazed at how cheap the Taxi's were to get around (less that half of what they cost in Australia). NOW....... On our arrival we were greeted by unenthusiastic staff who were slow and struggled with our most basic needs. On the way to our room we could see the build up of dust along the sides of the carpet and on the skirting boards. We arrived in our room and were met with an unfathomable amount of dust and grime in the room and the shower, there was even a 'skid mark' in the toilet..... When

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Affordable and old hotel
desc: Had a staycation here. Hotel is a little old although affordable. It is in a good location in city hall. My room had a view of the marina bay sands, esplanade. The view had a bit of construction in it too. The service was alright. The design of the rooms were a little old. My comforter was rather old too and thin. But I find it OK for the price. And it's in a good location.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Over priced with no value for money
desc: I stayed in this hotel for almost 20 days. It is an old property with rust in the bathroom and old flooring. The services were very mediocre. The bathtub hole was rusty. There was no body lotion in bathroom. The housekeeping cleanliness was gud. The hotel was at walking distance from my office so I stayed there. The skylounge was gud to take a city view. The bathroom faucets and showers are old and rusty. Tile grout was coming out. They need to renovate. I got a quiet room on request as there is construction going on in adjacent building. I was staying in peninsula tower and I am not sure if same is the case with excelsior tower. Last year I stayed in another hotel at bencoolen which was 40% less expensive than peninsula but the amenities they provided were so good. They

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: Very handy to Clarke Quay and a number of other well known tourist spots in Singapore. An older hotel , a little dated but very good value for money. We were talked into a breakfast which was ok. Very extensive offering but poor quality and hot dishes were barely warm. Great swimming pools which offer great respite from the extreme heat.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Okay for a good nights sleep
desc: Selected this hotel based on price and it's still true, you get what you pay for. The hotel is old and tired but rooms were perfectly functional and provided a good nights sleep. Our biggest,is take was choosing to have breakfast at the hotel. The food was limited in options and pretty mediocre but the performance of the staff was even worse. Most gave the impression that they weren't happy to be at work, but one waitress in particular stole the show for bad service. The restaurant was half empty but none of our used plates were cleared so we placed them on the table beside us that was completely empty. Along came a waitress, picked up the used plates and put them back on our table. Unbelievable! Mentioned it to the manager on the way out and was very apologetic so that was good.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent value for money
desc: We stayed 4 nights in a lovely spacious room on the Club level . Our tarif included an excellent breakfast and access to Sky lounge with breathtaking views of Singapore . It is central to many shopping areas and restaurant and many local attractions . Highly recommended

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Dirty,Musty and Mold
desc: Not the standard I expect from a Singapore hotel. Avoid this hotel there are far better and cleaner in the area.... so we are on floor 15, as you come out of the lift you are hit by the musty smell in the corridor to the rooms, our room feels damp, smells damp and is damp as mildew in bathroom. Lots of stains on bed valance, the room. Is grubby and smells dirty as well as being visually dirty, bathroom smelled of urine. This hotel needs a good deep clean and so will I when I check out in the morning....... and move to another

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Getting worse with every visit...
desc: Stayed many times here and, regardless of the (poorly and cheaply) renovated rooms, it's getting worse every visit... Rooms are small indeed, but I've seen worse in Singapore. 'Service' is Singaporean style, which means generally poor, but that's all over Singapore. But I draw the line at not having any more towels available... This time I had to wait 2 hours to get towels (of course I only found out I had no towels AFTER my shower...). When they came they had rags and were clearly from 1955, or thereabouts. If a hotel is not investing enough to such an extent itbdesnt have enough towels, you know there is a serious management problem. And it's visible everywhere, frankly. From the mildew stained shower curtains to the stacks and stacks of plastic yellow stuff they call 'cheese'

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good hotel, but with few adjustment, could be an excellent hotel
desc: Overall, it was a good stay. There are differences, though, between exceptional hotels and well, 'okayish' hotels. Perhaps it's not fair to compare against the JW Marriott and Hilton's of the world, but still, expectations are there... The Good: - For the most part, staff were nice and good. Housekeeping was very helpful, and most people try to help. - Location is excellent! Very near the Raffles City, and City Hall MRT. One of the biggest plus of the hotel is the location. - Have a gym and a pool. Didn't really use the pool, and the gym was small, but had running machines and free weights. Areas of Improvements: - Two of us checked in, but they wanted to charge breakfast for the second person. That is a first... Used to getting complimentary breakfast, but when we

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: I had been to Singapore in May 2018 for an International Conference and stayed at Peninsula Excelsior Hotel
desc: It had been a wonderful and pleasant stay. It was very convenient also as the conference was held in the same hotel. The staff and people are very straight forward and helping in nature. Especially the Manager who sensing our taste for a kadak tea, arranged a special British Tea for us. The amenities are excellent. The hotel is ultra modern and clean. It is also very near to Clark Quay, China town and even Marina Bay Sands is also visible.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Perfectly situated
desc: We spent four days in this hotel during our visit in Singapore. We loved the fact that it was in the center of everything, close to China town, Boat Quay, Clarke Quay, Chijmes, MBS etc - walking distance everywhere. Rooms: 4 stars - Nice and clean rooms and fairly big. Bathroom really fresh and wifi good. Reception and staff: very friendly and helpful Pools - they had two pools which were nice to relax by in the afternoons. Breakfast - we didn't have breakfast included but had breakfast there the first day. It was good and had a big selection of different foods but for that price we chose to eat at Starbucks and other places during the rest of our visit. For the good price we had on this hotel we were really happy with the hotel. For the price we paid we didn't get the view

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Dilapidated, gross and noisy
desc: This hotel looks fine from the outside, the lobby, etc. But the room that we got was just NASTY. It was tiny and the beds were rock hard. But I would’ve been ok with that if it was well kept. But it seems that the room hasn’t been updated or even taken care of for decades. The walls have stains all over them, there are cracks in the bathtub and there’s mildew on the bathroom ceiling. My bed skirt even has disgusting stains all over it. For some reason the bathroom has a glass wall so they put a curtain over it and that has gotten all gross from the water shower. To top it all of, there’s a building construction right next door so it’s super noisy the whole day (till after 6pm!!). I absolutely have no clue how this is a 4-star hotel because this looks like a no-star motel to me.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Well located hotel
desc: Nice hotel. Easy to walk to the main sites: China Town, Merlion Park, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Cloud Forest etc. Right near City Hall MRT. Helpful staff. Good value for the location. Room was clean. Clean bathroom. Good bed. Building works outside but did not disturb

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Sky Lounge Experience
desc: I visited sky lounge often for dining. Today I brought my friends for dining. I enjoyed my food and the fireworks. I always seen AC, Farah ,Sera and Susan the service of them is fantastic. I don’t need to look for them they always give a sweet smile I also met Arian the Manager , she is very attentive and always looking after us. Great deal with the price and ambiance

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Just the Location
desc: Conveniently located at the heart of the shopping and surrounding with in a easy reach. Busy hotel with different level check-in The concierge at street level was excellent, Rooms are little small but comfortable and nicely maintained Breakfast was ok nothing to write about. Didn’t offer much service and staff in the restaurant not helpful. They were in a rush to close the services and far away from famous Singaporean hospitality. TV was out of order and got it fixed on the next day.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location
desc: This Hotel is in a great location. We stayed there along with our two sons, one of whom is Wheelchair Bound, and a group of friends. We were a group of nine in total. We arrived early in the morning after A twelve hour flight from Copenhagen. Our rooms were not ready until after two pm, which made it a very long wait especially for my Wheelchair Bound son, however the rest of our stay more than made up for the long wait. The staff in the Restaurant were very nice to our son, even making him a special breakfast and freshly squeezed juice. We will Stay there again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The Excelsior a Great Hotel
desc: We stayed in this first class hotel where the amenity is thoroughly recommeded. From the first greeting to the final farewell the staff are professional and attentive. A special mention is given for Suga, a wonderful receptionist who was so helpful and patient with our requests and questions. The Singaporean people are gracious and genuinely generous in spirit. We will return to this hotel so conveniently centrally located in this great vibrant city.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average stay
desc: We stayed 3 nights at Peninsula excelsior Hotel with family and friends. It’s conveniently located but it’s little away from the hub. The plaza is in the Basement and upwards and has plenty of shops. Shops has many variety and good quality. Large hotel with basic facilities. The overall hotel lacks the professionalism and staff shows cold bloodied attitude towards its guest. Didn’t offer much service and staff in the restaurant not helpful. Had only B.B and food wasn’t that great either. The main thing that need to improve there was the housekeeping. While entering the room we noticed that the TV was ooo, and safe didn’t work. We were not that worried and both didn’t function until our departure. And the room cleaning was not at all impressive and need to improve lot.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Too poor
desc: The only good thing about this hotel is the location, apart from that very poor housekeeping, room service, poor breakfast and poor Wi-Fi. Not to mention the maintenance problems, the bathroom door not locking and not even closing, the room window isn't operable. The noise from the construction site next to the hotel was the smallest problem we had. Attaching photos of our room AFTER being serviced , by far this is the worst room service I've seen in more than 100 hotels I've been to around the world

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Short stay
desc: We only stayed here for 2 nights but that was enough. The hotel was perfectly fine for a short stay. The bed wasn't comfortable, too hard. The pools were nice but unfortunately due to the neighbouring construction it wasn't very peaceful or private. Our room was clean and well presented. The location of the hotel was ideal, only about a 10-15 min walk to the marina, the metro is also very close. 7/11 (food minimart) very close to hotel. Close to raffles. Wi-Fi was very slow during peak times, worked okay late at night and first thing in the morning but all other times you could barely check an email. Buffet breakfast yummy. Was given complimentary bottled water in room but its perfectly safe to drink the tap water in Singapore. Staff were friendly and helpful. There are smoking

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Educational stay
desc: My wife and I arrived just before 5am at this hotel for a week and a half stay. Our first impression was NOT good when the staff member attending to us requested we pay for the accommodation we had booked. This was NOT exactly the welcome we anticipated as the accommodation had already been payed when booked , two months prior. Unfortunately the discussion became somewhat stressful [for us anyway] before they checked their records. I am surprised that they were apparently unaware that we were arriving on that date although it had been booked, [and paid for], months before. This greeting was a distressful start to a much anticipated holiday. In summary at the end of our holiday I have given the hotel a rating of 2, not minus, because of the other staff encountered who were well

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: Stayed here for 5 nights. Rooms are ok but very dim. The safe in our room was not working, called the front desk but nobody came. Breakfast was good. You can request for bottled water anytime (just dial 35). Location is very good. 100 meters away from nearest MRT station (City Hall) which is also connected to Raffles City, Suntec, Marina Square. The hotel is also near Chimes and musuems. Wi-Fi is good. You can also leave your luggage at the lobby if you check out early.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location watching the Grand Prix
desc: Have previously stayed at Orchard Road hotels on previous trips but this hotel offered some excellent deals during the Grand Prix weekend and is very close to Zone 4 area for the Grand Prix - no taxis or MRT required. Its got all the facilities you would need for a short break and close to all the downtown attractions and MRT for getting around

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very central and comfortable hotel in Singapore
desc: Hotel is situated in a very central part of Singapore from where you can walk to Gardens By the Bay, catch MRT underground from City Hall station, Hop on and off a red tourist line of sightseeing bus of Hippo bus. There are two outdoors swimming pools,the room I had was a superior double and it was really superior. Excellent breakfast with the variety of dishes. Brilliant housekeeping service and the service at reception, bar, concierge etc. It was not cheap but nothing is cheap in Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The Two Towers
desc: This hotel has two towers and if you are in the cheaper tower you have an average room. The room looked a little dated. The WiFi was good and the staff were nice. I never used the restaurant as the prices seemed very high. If you are in the wrong tower you have to ask reception for a key to access the lift to allow you to get to the 20th floor. The AC worked very well, but was a little noisy.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average stay- serve the purpose
desc: Stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip. The room are smaller then expected with all corridors on the floors having a foul smell including in the room. The hotel has a entrance on road and you have to go to a lobby which is on different floor, and for breakfast it is almost hidden in between! Rooms were clean however at time find the house keeping team wont arrange the room properly after cleanup. Could not find the room service menu and had to go out for a bite. Average overall.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Lovely Stopover Holiday 2 Days
desc: Lovely clean hotel and room. Staff were very friendly and helpful from the people who carried in the bags to the reception staff. Walking distance to lots of attractions and the hop on hop off bus. Magnificent views over the harbour from one tower and views to the hills from the other. Used the pool and the gym. Enjoyed a varied breakfast downstairs

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice room!
desc: Stayed at this hotel for two nights on business. It’s located right in a busy area in Singapore, with lots of stores and restaurants around, and near the metro and bus stations. Check-in was fast. The room was nice and clean, with very nice king bed and very soft large pillows. It has a nice and clean bath area as well. The buffet breakfast was ok - not as much selections as other hotels that I’ve been to, but it has the staples that one would want to have for breakfast. Very fast check-out, too! Because of the nice room, this hotel is recommended.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great stay for the Grand Prix
desc: We stayed here for 5 nights for the Grand Prix. The hotel is in a great location and you can walk to the circuit which was great for us as the entertainment on track finished late. It was also walking distance to all the main sites in the city & there is a MRT only a couple of minutes away if you don't want to walk. No complaints with the room, was clean and had everything we needed - not luxurious but didn't expect that for the price we paid, especially when the Grand Prix was on!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good place, value for money
desc: I book the hotel in last minute for a weekend bash with several friend. We're just finishing our biz trip in HK and decided to spend one night in SG. Although it is last minute, the hotel oferred a very reasonable rate. Skeptic about the experience at first, but we going through with the booking anyway, did not put high expectation at the very least. To our surprise, we received a memorable experience, although the hotel was old, but the interior in the room has been updated to a modern style. We are greeted by a friendly receptionist, which to our surprise used our mother language, although she is singaporean, but she tru to converse in bahasa. A very good experience cause usually singaporean doesn't realy fond of using bahasa melayu to converse. The check in and check out

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Stayed for 5 Nights
desc: We stayed at the Peninsula post Singapore F1 GP for 5 Nights. The hotel was neat and clean, however its starting to show its age. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location is reasonable central with an MRT station nearby. I think its time for a major revamp of the whole facility.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Clean and Safe
desc: We stayed in the Excelsior tower of the Peninsula. It doesn't "take your breath away" but it is clean and a safe place to stay (so really what more do you need?) The staff are wonderful and the room we had is basic but we were out most of the days we were here so it didn't affect us much. The beds were comfy and the room was kept tidy. Free wifi also and it is good quality. Surprisingly the AC is super quiet which is a massive bonus

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: No Customer Service
desc: This hotel is nothing to write home about, The room was small and the bathroom even smaller. We were staying in the according to people the better tower but after being spoiled in Vietnam and Borneo this was certainly a come down. this hotel is supposed to be 4 star that is a joke. the only pleasant thing was a sweet lady who cleaned our rooms on our floor. The service counter was rude and very unhelpful and we gave up going to the restaurant for meals as the food was unappetizing. Certainly will not be staying there the transfer hotel village changi was alot better and very helpful maybe those upstarts in the Pennisula need to learn off them.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A proffessional massage from heaven
desc: We had just landed from a long flight. I needed a massage. I enjoy a massage twice to three times a week. I have even enrolled in a massage course to learn how a massage should be done. I was tired and noticed a number of massage shops were available. I noticed "URBAN SPA", appeared to be a professional massage shop and able to give me a good massage. Yes, I was very happy some of the staff in the shop called speak English. They laughed at my poor attempts to speak Chinese and even had the patience to assist me to be able to say the few Chinese words better. The customer service was wonderful and I felt special not just another person who had money for a massage. Jenny the owner of the shop sat me down and explained the services that were available to me. I knew this was

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointing
desc: We stayed here for 4 nights in the Excelsior tower. The rooms are in need of renovation as the carpet was worn and the bathroom looked very tired and was not cleaned very well during our stay. One of the swimming pools was closed but the other was clean and refreshing. The hotel is in a good location and walking distance to shopping, train station, China town, Raffles city, Boat quay. We didn’t find the staff to be very friendly which was disappointing after coming from Jogjakarta where the hotel staff treated us like family. Don’t think we would stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Hospitality!
desc: Wonderful night to spend at Sky Lounge in Peninsula Excelsior Hotel Singapore. With the A class hospitality from Fajar, Ariane, JC and the awesome service crews, I had such a memorable birthday night with my friends at this super night scene of Singapore, warm hospitality and yummy food even as simple as a garlic bread. Best in Singapore! THANK YOU to your awesome staff, they made everything possible and wonderful memory for life time!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excelsior tower
desc: Stayed in deluxe room in Excelsior tower. Nice room, spacious and room looks as advertised in photos. Bathroom layout could be better (toilet is positioned very close to the shower and the door) but this was not a big issue for us. Good location close to Clarke Quay and City Hall MRT. Nice pool area although gets a little bit crowded - this was perhaps because one pool is closed for a couple of weeks for renovations. Gym is adequate for what you need. Would recommend dinner at the sky lounge - great food and prices quite reasonable.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice Hotel but Large and Impersonal
desc: Quite a nice hotel, room is ok, bed comfortable, house keeping very good, but bathroom quite small. No doubt an upgrade is needed for the whole hotel, but a good enough stay, but not “blown away” Staff at check in very helpful and accommodating, good gym and nice enough pool, but only six beds around pool, also pool is visible from lobby area, so no privacy at pool area. A good location for exploring the city, lots of shopping, etc. Taxis in abundance and all cheap enough. Lots of construction going on on 2 sides of hotel and overlooking pool and makes the room noisy, all about timing, so not ideal. But enjoyed our stay, room was comfortable enough, hotel is nice, just something missing! Perfect for F1 weekend.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 2 night stay
desc: The location is OK, but this is dependant on what you have planned. The staff are great especially the luggage team. Only one negative the rooms could be a bit cleaner. Ensure you bring your paper work for your booking to allow any discounts etc. to happen.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great for F1 Grand Prix
desc: Perfect hotel for not only the F1 grand prix but travelling any where across Singapore. Very friendly hotel, great rooms and a very well stocked breakfast. The two swimming pools are great, but only have a few sun lounges. Very clean and tidy and would stop here again for sure.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location for Singapore Grand Prix F1
desc: Stayed 3 days in a deluxe room at the Peninsula. Great location, great views from my room on 10th floor at the older Peninsula block. Service was average, the breakfast room was crowded and the food was of average quality.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great position
desc: Stayed here last week. The position is just about perfect. It's close to the F1 circuit, and we could see a section of the track from our room. The National gallery is a couple of minutes away, and the Singapore River restaurant area is a few minutes walk. Then there's Fort Canning Park, various museums, Raffles City mall, MRT to anywhere on the island and so on. It's not too far from Gardens by the Bay, either by MRT or taxi, and well placed for the CBD. The beds are comfortable enough, and everything worked. We were on the 10th floor, and noticed that it took forever for hot water to make it to the shower head, so there must be a single hot water tank servicing the whole hotel...also the pressure wasn't great for showers. Didn't bother me, but my daughter wasn't pleased :)...

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location, reasonable
desc: Pros - Great Location, reasonable price - Rooms ok for the price Cons - AWFUL breakfast! Buffet with single wrapped processed cheese slices? Fruit from a 5 gallon bucket? - Service very slow - Concierge couldn’t find his way around block

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice location
desc: I spent 2 nights in this hotel, and it was nothing special about it. The room has normal size, the shower was good and strong. The bed was pretty hard and I did not like the pillows. The breakfast was included in my dayrate but there was nothing special about it. I used the business center and we had a meeting booked for us, the business service was very good and the staff was very helpful.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: F1 Grand Prix weekend
desc: This hotel is tired and in dire need of investment. Checking in was very slow, seen quickly but then she seemed to have tremendous issues in finding a room for us, despite booking 8 months before! Asked if we would accept a twin room when we booked a double. Eventually conceded to upgrading our room but if that was the upgrade I hate to think what we had booked! Room was basically ok but very tired. Not a single bracket was on the wall as it should be, shower tray leaned so much that the bottles just slid off. Pool area was the most concerning. It is dangerous with broken uneven slabs all around. This needs attention I would suggest. Rooftop bar was ok but pretentious. Had to go back down to the ground floor for the lift attendant to allow you to select the floor of the bar.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Beware - construction all around.
desc: Stopped here for a few nights early Sep. 1 room the toilet didn’t flush and wasn’t attended to - we changed rooms. Now looking straight into hard hatted construction workers so close you could almost touch them. Our daughters room the shower was broken. What looks to be a nice hotel from the outside needs a lot spending on it on the inside. Staff were friendly and location was good but couldn’t make up for the downsides. Because a ‘view’ of the construction we could see the almost constant pall of concrete dust from the building works. This floated over the pool deck rendering pool totally undesirable - even in 30+ degree temperatures. Demolition and construction work looks like it has been going in for some time and doesn’t look close to finishing in the next couple of

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A great stay!
desc: I was in Singapore a few weeks back for a quick trip and my husband and I were staying for a night at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel. The hotel is located right in the middle of the city, and we can attest that the location is perfect. The view from the upper floors of the city skyscrapers is absolutely brilliant. We arrived early on in the morning to Changi airport and found that the check-in process at the hotel was a breeze. The view of the Hill Street from my room was quite nice. Breakfast in the mornings was absolutely brilliant. I really liked the omelette's here - they were perfectly made and the fruits at breakfast were really nice. The hotel rooms are quite comfortable! The stay overall was excellent and we really enjoyed the view.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A week in SG
desc: My daughter and I stayed at a deluxe twin bed room with breakfast on the 13th floor. I was surprised as most Asian buildings do not have this floor. Anyway, we had a wonderful view of Marina Bay from our hotel window. The bell service was very friendly and attentive. The agent who checked us in didn't have a friendly vibe to her and seemed like she was just going through the motions automatically. Had room service a number of times throughout our stay. Servings were huge. I also availed of the hotel laundry service. I was disappointed and inconvenienced when I had to go all the way back to the front desk to pay for the laundry service outright. They made me pay for the room service outright as well, when they didn't even ask me upon check in if I would like to make a guarantee

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Perfect for F1
desc: Stayed here for attending the F1 grand prix. Perfect location for this and we could see the track. We walked to the track - above or underground (ac). Room was good size with good air conditioning and was quiet. We were on level 18. The pools were good, although there were loose tiles around the edges. We found the check in and check out very quick and easy. Good daily service to the rooms with free bottled water. The only bad part was that the beds were very hard.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not great
desc: This hotel is in two towers, depending where you are put can make a difference. In the morning I have to catch the lift to 5th floor, walk to the other tower via lobby then walk downstairs to the 4th floor restaurant. People stay in the first tower can catch lift to 4th floor. Then there is breakfast, I asked for a tomato and cheese omelette, not unusual, there is no tomato so I got capsicum and parmesan cheese. Yesterday I asked for two eggs over easy, again not unusual, they didn’t flip them. It’s this lack of detail throughout the hotel which warrants this rating. From someone else’s hair in the shower to the checkout process.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Memorable visit
desc: My first visit to Singapore and booked this hotel on line, was easy to find being close to the metro station and right opposite the cathedral. The accommodation was good and staff helpful throughout my stay. Our room was spacious clean and comfortable. we didn't eat in the hotel so cant comment on the food here but if i return to Singapore again i would certainly look this place up.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Confusing Name, Confusing Hotel Distribution, good Location, kinda old and dark rooms
desc: When you hear im staying at the Peninsula you think of a posh, high class, luxury hotel, well this is not the case. It has nothing to do with the Peninsula hence "Peninsula Excelsior". It is well situated, but the rooms are kind of old and dark. For the price it is a good stay for business or if you don't pretend to be in the hotel for a long time. I do believe there are a lot of better options for the same price. Also the distribution is very confusing as there are two towers that are not communicated so you have to get of at different floors for lobby and street access. Not a place I would recommend.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: We chose the Peninsula Excelsior for its location. It is so easy to access the MRT, get to the Riverbank, Fort Canning, Raffles and other local attractions. The room was spacious and we had a lovely view. The trip was for my birthday. On the day – to my surprise a small box of chocolates and birthday card was waiting for me. On another day a lovely fruit basket was waiting for us. These surprises were much appreciated and a nice touch from management. Our room was cleaned each day – sometimes towels were forgotten – but this was soon rectified. We will definitely be back again. Singapore has so much to offer – shopping and tourist experiences are superb!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Stopover enroute to Newzealand
desc: I would have liked to give the hotel 4* but it does not quite make it. When I did my research I was influenced by the pictures of the hotel and pool. Unfortunately these are misleading. The hotel has a most confusing layout. You enter from the street through the baggage handling area and take a lift upto reception which is located two or three floors above. The floors in between are occupied by shops. The reception area doubles up as a lounge. Not a comfortable or pleasant area to enjoy quiet time with a drink. The whole reception area is tired and could do with a refurbishment. Unfortunately there is a major building project going on right alongside the hotel and noise is always present during working hours. On the plus side, the hotel is ideally situated, the rooms are clean

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location, more affordable option
desc: Overall this is a decent hotel with the main benefit being the location - nearby Clark Quay. This hotel is a more affordable option for Singapore standards.The service was average and the room was well kept with nice city views. If you are looking for a more affordable option in Singapore with a convenient location this hotel is worth considering.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ruined by one staff member
desc: This is a nice hotel in a good location. I stayed here before about 10 years ago without any issues and thought I'd give them another try, however my most recent visit was tarnished by one staff member in particular. I arrived well into the evening after a long haul flight for a one night stay. I decided to order to some room service before going to bed. When the food was delivered, the person who delivered it (a man of west asian appearance, if it helps the hotel identify him) informed me that since I was checking out the following day, immediate payment in cash was required. I had not been informed of this requirement when placing my order, and due to the fact that I was only staying in Singapore for 1 night I had not bothered to arrange any Singapore dollars. I informed

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Go elsewhere
desc: Stayed here in an overnight stay. Have been to Singapore many times and this doesn't rate to what else there is around. I upgraded to a club room and the room was very small and old. Bathroom was something out of the 80s and very tired. For what I spent on the upgrade it definatly wasn't worth it. Service was very good though but much nicer hotels around.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Convenient Location
desc: Very convenient to get to all of Singapore's attractions. Shopping centres close by too. Friendly staff were very helpful. Taxi rank outside the property. We stayed in the Excelsior Tower. It seems to have undergone a 'cheap' refurbishment and it shows in the final result. But the rooms are a good size and comfortable. The menus in Colemans for breakfast and dinner need some more imagination!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Breath taking view
desc: The view from our room was fantastic 20th floor over looking the bay.We found the reception staff fast efficient and helpful the same same as the concierge. I wish i could say about the restaurant staff rude would be a kindness

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Refurbish required, nonetheless at a strategic location
desc: Strategically located at downtown but the building is quite old and the car park was pretty dark. Gym is available for simple workout, pool was clean but it can feel quite weird when passerby can watch you swimming from the side. Room was decent and comes with a bath tub. Hospitality wise most of the staffs were friendly but the receptionist's English was odd I didn't understand a word she uttered.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: It's a 3 star
desc: Older style hotel a little dated room wise and in need of an overhaul. In the case of mine (room 1234) mouldy grout in the bath tiling, patch up jobs evident here and there. However it's ok if you don't want five star and the prices on various websites are good in comparison to more expensive hotels. Beds as you would expect in a youth hostel, hard cheap mattresses. It's an average three star hotel in a good location and fine overall for a Singapore visit.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Avoid $28 cocktail 6-8pm Peninsula Excelsior
desc: A group of 6 friends partook in the $28 6-8pm cocktail deal at the club lounge. This was MEANT to be for unlimited canoe during the 2hrs. Canapes were not kept restocked. For $28 I had some cheese,dried apricot and a dim sum. At 730 I did nicely ask the lady in charge if it was to be restocked and she addressed it with a junior staff, however no food was forthcoming and 15mins later they informed us it was finishing. One lady in our party asked if the jug of water could be filled and was told she had to buy a bottle. As our group of 6 had bought 18 drinks in that time in addition to the $28 dim sum it seemed ludicrous.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 5 night conference stopover
desc: Had a great view of the marina bay sands from the hotel, I did ask at reception if it was possible. Never used the pool or other services, mainly used spinelli coffee house on the ground floor. Hotel has some work going on next door so a bit noisy going on til 9pm. Rooms walls are a bit thin as I heard my neighbours arguing and then talking most of the night. No blame to hotel for that. Convenient spot for the hotel, close to the marina 5 minute walk and Clarke quay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Return visitors
desc: We choose to stay here because of the friendly staff, great location and warm welcome extended on each visit. location is quieter than "touristy hotels" in Orchard road and riverside Planned to return in January 2019 and renew friendships with staff If possible try to have rooms above 8th floor for city views

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Service
desc: Well, we choose this hotel cause of the review from trip advisor anyway, what we experienced is different. We had our two years old thought they had child care or babysitter services but one of staff with short hair wast friendly at all to answer our queries basically ignore it and room was equipped old such safe deposit didn’t work internet didn’t work fridge light and all of this didn’t taken seriously well prob because customer all the time. Next time definitely not depend on review from trip advisor

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 3 night stopover stay
desc: This hotel was one of the choices given to us when we booked a stopover holiday with Singapore Airlines and we were not disappointed. Very central within walkig distance of many fo the attractions and on the route of the Hop-on-hop-off bus routes. A large comfortable room with all the facilities neede for our stay. The staff were very welcoming and helped us to our room. We had a light meal in Colemans restaurant as we arrived at 9.30 p.m. which was just what we needed. Breakfast was a full buffet service with the choice of dishes from around the world. The hotel has two pools and a gym. A number of hotels were being refurbished nearby but this did not impact on our stay. A good holtel for exploring this vibrant city.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Substandard Hotel
desc: Stayed here for 4 nights. Great location but hotel needs a major makeover. Security box was faulty (couldn't enter certain numbers) bathroom poorly designed (shower screen made it difficult and dangerous to enter bath) and poor service. This hotel needs a major makeover. Staff were helpful however slow to act on simple requests. Hotel looks very tired and dated

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good property, near to merlion park
desc: The first thing I would love to do is thank the Hotel staff for making my Birthday very special. They did send me a birthday pastry and a beautiful card. My room was spacious and had an amazing view to Marina Bay sands Hotel. Not only this the hotel has everything within walking distance and vicinity. The merlion park and Marina bay riverfront is just 7-10 minutes walking. Amust recommended stay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: On the slide
desc: I stayed a week at this hotel about 4 years ago and was more than satisfied with the room and experience and thought it was well worth the money. However, stayed there last week for five nights and I must say that it has deteriorated significantly. Had a great view but the room was very tired. There are a number of smoking or non smoking levels in the same building so the whole building smells like smokers. In addition the room was grotty as though it had a film over everything. Sheets & towels were like they had been used a million times and the internal dooner was brown stained all over. Don't like to speak ill of it but it wasn't good. Generally the service and response to issues such as getting out safe to work was responsive how ever. I get the impression that the hotel

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Stopover 48 hours
desc: Hotel is Central to all sites and shops. Lovely quiet hotel with pools and bars and restaurant. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was a nice size. Would stay again - no hesitation in staying here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Mid-range hotel in top location
desc: The hotel has a very central location and is ideal for accommodation for a few days. However, the complex is really old-fashioned and partly run down, which is even more noticeable in a modern city like Singapore. Thus, those who are looking for a hotel with flair or character will be disappointed. Those who are only looking for a place to sleep will be satisfied. But it is too expensive, there are certainly cheaper opportunities here. During my next stay in Singapore, I will book another hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Wii Return
desc: Stayed here 2 nights in late November 2018. Very Nice. Comfortable, Safe, Clean, Good Internet, Great Location. Helpful Staff. Maria M. in Sky Room very interested in us enjoying ourselves. Sky Room on 22 Great for drinks and dinner Jim Fitch Winter Park, FL

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great place to stay
desc: This is always a most welcoming and comfortable place to stay - we always chose it as our Singapore accommodation. Maria, Yoyo and Olivia in the Sky Lounge were extremely attentive with their service, and made us feel special and very at home.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: What a fabulous hotel to stay in and its my third time here
desc: I have stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel three times and I keep coming back, it centrally located and close to everything, the service is exceptional and they can't do enough for you from the people that clean your room the from desk to the Concierge down the from to welcome you here to get you cabs and to give you advice about what tours to go on. Iwould like to give a reviwe about the food and c the catering staff to the cooks they were fabulous and very welcomening when you get there in the morning they are like friends and it starts your day off with a smile but I would like to mention the head of catering Mr Noordin Aziz what a wonderful man every morning he was there to welcome me and with a very happy disposition which reflect on the hotel, and the food is fabulous

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Magnificent view
desc: We had a 3 days stay in this hotel, our room has the view of Marina bay sands, the view is magnificent especially at night. The room is cozy and the bathroom is huge. The staff at the reception, sky lounge & coleman were all great, very accomodating & friendly with the big smile all the time especially Noordin of Coleman, AC, Janet, Olivia, Maria & Farah of Sky Lounge. Definitely we will come back

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A small gift means a lot
desc: I informed the hotel that my husband's birthday was in the period of the stay and asked if they could prepare a small gift. We received no news from them when we were leaving Hong Kong. I supposed nothing would happen. On my husband's birthday, we were back to the hotel around 10 pm and we were so exhausted to find that our room card was not valid. Finally we realised that they made sure we were back and a piece of cake was delivered to our room soon after we were inside the room. A small box of 4-pc chocolate was also given to my husband. I appreciated very much the effort they put. Gift is not important and it is important how you serve your customers. Keep up with the good work, team! Last but not least, the hotel is located close to MRT (City Hall station), it is

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Location good, hotel nothing special
desc: Location is good, SMRT City Hall around the corner, 10min walk to Clark Quay. Hotel itself is getting old. We had Harbour view deluxe room but in the tower in the back, not the one towards the marina. View was still okay, the Durian and SG Flyer were in view. Room spacious but a bit damp; air didn’t seem great. Bed hard but good. Bathroom okay. All in all renovations should be in order soon. Staff was business like, not overly friendly. Price was ok for SG, but we won’t stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Mr
desc: The hotel seems to have a hard time retaining staff which didn't bode to well for me as the travel company always sen ds me there, the ceiling in my room has been altered quite a lot and the work done was very amateurish. Hard to fathom how they could count as being a luxury hotel as the hotel room could be in my opinion a 2 star at best.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A proper hotel
desc: A hotel not connected with the Peninsula group but offers the same ambience and comfort at almost half the price. The room was big but a little dated but it still offers comfortable amenities. Food was great at popular price. I would like to thank Mr. Noordin Bin Abdul Aziz for the assistance and the warm welcome. That lava cake was so delicious :) We will definitely come back on our next stay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Friendly efficient service.
desc: We booked club rooms....good sized rooms and we had a wonderful view across the water to Marina Bay Sands. These rooms are definitely worth the extra cost as guests have access to the Sky Lounge Day and night, a great happy hour each evening and delicious breakfasts. Not to mention the breathtaking views from the Sky Lounge balconies....especially at night when Singapore really sparkles. The staff were super friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The construction going on around there atm is a bit off putting but hopefully it will all be finished by the time we visit again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Sleepless
desc: Good location, close to Raffles and to MRT. The breakfast was also quite good but if you stay for more than 2 days the variety is not satisfactory. Had a very bad experience with the room due to some humming sound at night which resulted in a sleepless night and a massive headache the next day. Had to change the room the next day at night when the same noises were prevalent the next day. The service was good with the staff being quite helpful. They gave me late checkout with some hesitation. The rooms were clean but the phone didn’t work properly at first. Hotel itself is a bit old and needs a refurbishment. It has a small pool.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointing
desc: Although we found the hotel to be in a great location for accessing Singapore city centre I would find another. Good points. We were high up and got a great view of the downtown city. They left chocolates for my husbands birthday. Poor points. Bathroom was mouldy.
