Shower curtain and the curtain that covered the window between bathroom and bedroom was falling down and black with mould. We got here late on our first night and not knowing the city ordered room service. It was overpriced and poor quality. Breakfast we went on the first day and didn’t bother going the rest of the days. You can hear the lift from our room all night. Can hear other people coming and going into their rooms. Building work was going on beneath our room and although 15 floors up woke us up. Bed hard but

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disappointing
desc: Location is great. The room was ok, the breakfast was ok. However the “Japanese Bar” had a lot of female staff and refused to serve us. The hotel bar was the lobby and closed very early. Reception, concierge and housekeeping staff were lovely, food and beverage staff were mostly disinterested. Very much a transit hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hotel has let itself down
desc: The construction work adjacent to this property seems to be on a 24 hour basis.....I have searched the website and cannot find any warning of this by the hotel....I would not have booked and paid had I known and I will never book here again or recommend the property.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: It could have been better...
desc: The hotel has two towers, Peninsula and Excelsior Tower, but I do not know if there is a significant difference in the room quality between those two towers. I stayed in Peninsula Tower and the room was actually fine. It was generally clean and spacious in Singapore standard. However, the curtain in the bathtub can be renewed to give more clean impression. Also, adding ironing equipment and alarm clock in the room will improve the guest's experience. Providing an on-the-go gadget to wander around Singapore can also be a plus point. The real downside of the hotel was in the breakfast area, where it could be very crowded and quite chaotic. You could leave your table for just a moment to grab another food/coffee, with your unfinished meal still clearly visible in the table, just

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, needs renovation
desc: Good location and was probably a very nice hotel 3-4 years ago. But its age is showing now...the rooms are nice size but they look aged now and the carpets make the rooms look perennially dirty. Breakfast was ok, and facilities in general were ok. Not worth the money paid.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, smoky smelling room
desc: Disappointed to wait for a nonsmoking room only to find it smelling of smoke, as another reviewer has experienced as well. Elevators were confusing as we and other guests took the wrong tower at first - then watched other guests doing the same during our stay. Confusing. The club rooms may be better, but our room did not have a very comfortable bed and there were drainage problems with the sink and tub. Views of Singapore were good, and we did enjoy being near the metro and walking distance to Chinatown.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Location Easy Access to the CIty, Entertainment and Other Attractions
desc: A few bad things we noticed: - a - Rooms are old and especially the bathrooms need a lot of updating especially the hot water to all facets and drainage from the basin. b - Hot water was not stable either too hot or too cold c- Basin never drain properly the whole time we were there d - Beds not comfortable could take a leaf out of W (Westin Hotels) beds are always comfortable since rooms mainly used for sleeping this is important Good Things are: - a - Close to everything even though you have to go by taxi to the shops many are only 5 to 10 mins from the hotel b - Boat and Clark Keys you can walk to these especially at night its safe and about 15 mins walk. Great Bars and Restaurants in these areas c - The Big Wheel and Marina Bay Sands both worth seeing e - Food in hotel

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel
desc: This is à great hotel close to city and transport. . friendly staff . Fantastic views . train station around the corner.shopping center across the street walking distance to boat quay where bars and restaurants looking over the water

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Poor service
desc: Requested a large bed beforehand, receptionist still asked if I was fine with two small beds.. Booked the hotel for the view shown in the site only to be told I would face elsewhere.. In the midst of a 1hr wait cos the room is not ready yet.. Horrible service..

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location and friendly staff
desc: 地點很方便，旁邊有多線公車。 捷運city hall 站也非常近。 走路可到克拉碼頭。 櫃檯人員非常親切而且盡力幫忙。尤其是Iza. 房間本身乾淨但普通，不是特別漂亮奢華的那種房間，但我很喜歡，景觀也不錯。 Location is good. With many bus line and metro station around. Clarke quay is in walking distance. Staffs are very friendly. Especially a lady named Iza. She is amazing. Room is not the luxury style, but I like it.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel
desc: Location is the best: This Peninsula Excelsior Hotel is in the city centre of Singapore, which is next to the City Hall MRT Station and St. Andrews Church. It has a twin towers structure. The check-in counters are on the floor L. Staff: The staffs are helpful and kind. Room: Clean and tidy, but the toilet is smelly. The air conditioner is okay, cool enough. It has the water drop on the floor. Television: not every channel can see. Swimming Pool: 2 swimming pool, quite small and shallow water level. Sleeping Quality: Not good, the bed too soft

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Mediocre
desc: Decent location, rooms tiered looking. Not much has changed here since the 90s, very standard. Wifi was decent, electricity in the lifts was a issue we had to wait on 3 occasions to access the lift. Buffet breakfast very expensive at 45pp, room service equally overpriced. Perfectly average mid range hotel. Hopefully Singapore joins London and New York soon with decent basic business hotels such as Citizen M or Travelodge.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Fabulous Hotel
desc: We stayed here for 2 weeks as we were in Singapore on a work trip, the hotel was lovely. The room was very clean and spacious, well decorated and with everything we might need. A little box of chocs was a lovely touch. The room was cleaned daily and tea/coffee replenished etc. It was always done really well, with the bed made nicely and bathroom cleaned well. We could have had clean towels/sheets daily but chose not to as we felt it unnecessary. All the staff were pleasant and helpful, and greeted us with a smile, particularly the lovely lady who cleaned our room (room 1301 if hotel would like to pass on our comments). We would definitely stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice view from the room
desc: Extremely comfortable window-side couch, enjoying the sunrise ocean view. Nice amenity bath goods of citrus flavor. Great location for morning walking, 10 min walk to Fort Canning Park, Merlion, riverside restaurants, respectively.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: good location (near china town - shopping mall city hall & clak quay for the night life
desc: A good location if you want to visit chinatown (3 stations away by bus) - near a metro and a shopping mall (direct to orchard road) - near the night life area (clark quay) we stayed only 1 night between our 2 flights - a big gain of time to do many things and visit many places wihtin a short time frame Also there is a rooftop bar with a view of MarinaBaySands Hotel etc.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ideal for a few days in Singapore
desc: The staff at this hotel are exceptional, nothing is too much trouble. My room was clean spacious and comfortable, with a little fridge or mini bar. The restaurant served nice food, and the room service was quick and tasty. There are always taxis outside so it is really easy to get around if you don’t want to use public transport. Taxis are very cheap in Singapore The hotel is within walking distance of Clark Quay and China Town. There is a small parade of shops and an ATM opposite. If you leave the hotel after check out time, you can have a shower using the swimming pool facilities and the hotel happily provide you with a towel. Swimming pool showers aren’t hot, unfortunately!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: New Years Eve sleepover
desc: Although living in Singapore we decided to treat ourselves to a nice hotel near the Marina to watch the NYE fireworks without having to worry about getting home after. Our first impression wasn’t great - all our communications and booking were with the hotel, all emails from them were about money ( even though we’d paid). I guess we should have known the Sky Bar would be chargeable on NYE and you’d need to book but they never offered us the chance. We even phoned before to ask if the Sky bar was open and was told someone would ring us back - needless to say they didn’t because by then it was fully booked. The hotel was ok, a bit dated but comfortable and well located. The chamber maid on the 19th floor was by far the friendliest member of staff we met. We certainly didn’t see

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: The location of this hotel is walking distance to everything! There are so many malls around the area. The MRT is just outside the hotel. You can walk to Merlion Park as well. We stayed in this hotel for 3nites before we took our Asia Cruise for 14nites. The front desk is helpful and the wifi is strong. They have a breakfast buffet and there's plenty of choices. The concierge is very helpful as well.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: We had 7 nights here & enjoyed the whole time spent here, the staff from the front desk to the cleaning staff were very pleasant & very helpful. The front door staff were also very helpful with your luggage & always greeted you as you arrived back at night. Breakfast was always very well presented & plenty of variety to have. The view we had had was fantastic as we watched the laser lights from the Mariner bay side from our window great show.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: WARNING - AWFUL HOTEL
desc: Do not stay here! The most atrocious customer service. They just want your money! I recommended this hotel to a colleague of mine. Unfortunately he had to spend the night under a leaking air conditioning unit to which the hotel reception deemed “not to be sub-standard”

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location and fairly priced
desc: We have stayed here before and it does not disappoint. It's position is excellent to get around from, short stroll to the river, close to Fort canning Park not far from Raffles, shops and restaurants close by. Large bedrooms two nice pools. We usually use the one overlooking the fire station which provides us with some action now and again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Quiet street near to the commercial hub
desc: Checked in for two nights on business. The service was pleasant. Someone knocked on the door to ask how was the service. I was presented with some chocolates as a welcoming gift. However, when I called for the ironing board, it never came.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great position
desc: An ordinary hotel but in a great spot. Two pools, acceptable but generic hotel room, ok reception but only a block from City Hall MRT (direct link to airport), the river, Chinatown,Merlion, Raffles etc.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Smells like cigarette even its nonsmoke
desc: Just got to the room and ir smells a lot like cigarette, the room is kind of dirty and there is cigarette ashes in the table. Disappointing thats the last thing i expected to find coming from the airport. Although they reacted quite quickly, thats a good thing.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Service.....if only they had any
desc: It took more than 25 minutes to check in. I had paid for the room online and advised the time I would be showing up in the evening, but for some reason it was like a surprise that anyone was coming to stay. Anyway I got to the room and tried to order room service but I figured that after 18 rings I would give up...they did deliver the iron and ironing board to my room however so maybe I will eat that !

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, hard beds
desc: We just stayed as a group of 8 people across 3 rooms for 3 nights. Location is great, pools were good, restaurant for breakfast was ok and the staff were friendly and welcoming especially the concierge team. But the room we had (1325) smelt a little off and the beds in all 3 rooms we booked were so hard as to be uncomfortable. Not sure why the need for rock hard beds?

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Total Lack of Organisation
desc: If you are staying at this hotel after an overnight flight into Singapore, find somewhere else to stay. My wife and I flew into Singapore early on Monday Jan 7th after no sleep on a Singapore Airlines flight. We were hot sweaty and very tired. Arrived at the hotel tell to be told no room until 2pm. Really what a hopeless response at 8am in the morning. No Internet as well. A room was found after I made an issue of this with reception. Suddenly they found a room. When we stepped out of the lift on level 10 the floor stank of cigarette smoke, So much for a non-smoking floor. Then got to the room and the fridge was not working. Totally unacceptable considering the money being paid. Within an hour they magically found another room but I should not have had to complain

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not quite there
desc: This has the bones of being a very good hotel but there just not the attention to detail as one would expect in a hotel like this. Our room was neat and updated but it was just not cleaned to the standard one would expect. There was no real pride taken in the serving of breakfast, no one was cleaning up after guests. A bit of a disappointment.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Small rooms but good value for money
desc: Nice hotel, large with two swimming pools, in a good location to walk to Clarke Qauy, Chinatown, Bugis Street, Raffles and city hall train station, plenty of shops near by and within walking distance around the bay to Marina Sands. Rooms were fairly small though but had everything we needed. Would stay again and in terms of cost for accommodation in Singapore it was value for money.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Super old outdated with lots of noises
desc: Old hotel which reminds me hotels from the 80s. They try to make it more modern with flat screen tv and a new sink but the old low American bath tub, the step to take to get into the bathroom, the switches and the safe have it all away. Worst of all is the noises you get from the neighbors not because they make too much noises but the isolation of sound is very poorly managed. Plus you have the fire station opposite that wakes you up whenever it has services to send firefighters out which you can’t complain much about. The air conditioning is also old and noisy. The only good thing is it’s location. So not coming back.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, rooms need update
desc: We stayed in 2 rooms in the Peninsula Tower. Staff nicely upgraded us to the 18th floor as we were staying 9 nights. The Peninsula Excelsior was in a great location as taxis were about $10, even to Sentosa and close to convenience storesand moneychangers. Rooms were a bit tired and we had a tiny fridge. The biggest complaint I have is about the TV where reception staff told me I had to fiddle with the plug every time we wanted to watch TV - annoying over 9 days.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: good location but pretty average
desc: we stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while we were in Singapore. The location was a good one. close to the Hop on hop off bus stop and not too far from the river restaurants and the gardens, The hotel has two pools and it is because of the pools and location I gave it 3 stars. We had breakfast included each morning and were excited about that, but this also proved average or below. Its the little things that they could do better really. worn out towels, hard mattress, room furniture looking tired. All in all it was ok, but prices in Singapore for accommodation aren't cheap, so I suppose we expected a better standard for the money.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Still needs improvement
desc: Stayed at this hotel in Singapore. Has improved with the quality of furnishings in room but the restaurant on level 5 still has a long way to go. Unfortunately the selection of foods needs to improve especially for night meals after a long haul flight.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Seen better days unless you are in the tower
desc: We stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior for a week and it was a pleasant stay. We stayed in the older part for 6 days and then took a 4 day cruise and returned back to the hotel for one day .. on that day, we stayed in the newer tower part of the hotel. The original hotel was a bit worn out and needed some TLC but the rooms in the new tower were great. In our original room, the air-conditioning was non-existent but as we were out most of the day and only slept their at night, it was bearable. On the days we were having drinks at the bar in the lobby, there were ill behaved Chinese children running amok and I would have expected the staff to say something but, alas, it wasn't to be. The tower bar has a nice view of the river and the Marina Bay Sands hotel but it is a bit to far

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Tired hotel but good location
desc: Our second stay at this hotel en route for Australia, this time for two nights, The location of the hotel is perfect within walking distance of most downtown places and close to a metro station. However, on checking in we could only have a twin room if we wanted non smoking, double bed rooms were on « smoking » floors. Room allocated was very small so glad we were only staying two nights. WiFi in the room was non existant. There was no hot water for a shower in the evening. Seems to attract coach loads of visiting students. Big disappointment and won’t be staying here again on our next trip.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not my first choice for a business hotel
desc: ROOM I stayed here on a business trip for 4 nights. I think I got upgraded to a corner room with windows on adjacent sides of the room so I had a nice view of the water and the side view (an office building). The room itself was ok though a bit dated. The carpet... well let’s say thankfully there were slippers because I wasn’t so crazy about walking on that old carpet. The bathroom... was what I’d expect from a 3-star hotel. Very basic, a bit run down. Amenities - the normal business hotels will give you 4 bottles in the shower - shower gel, shampoo, condition and body lotion. This hotel had 2 -shower gel and combined shampoo/conditioner. (Makes me feel like I’m in a motel). Sorry I wish I had kept photos of the bathroom but i couldn’t bare to see them anymore. I only took a

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Centrally located, clean but a bit tired
desc: Overall a good place to stay, well placed for the MRT at City Hall and minutes from many of the downtown attractions. The ‘deluxe’ room was fine - clean, comfortable and well air conditioned - but the bathroom was tired and in need of a refurb. Again it was clean and everything worked, just the standard and finish not matching the room. Free bottled water every day was welcome and the room service was quick and efficient.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Amazing
desc: Guys this Hotel I recommend it 100%.. The bedrooms is really big, the pool the staff and everything it was more than perfect.. thé breakfast super good... I come every 2 month in Singapore.. and this is my 2nd best hotel in Singapore.. Thanks you for make all my nights perfect !!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great service and rooms
desc: we were very impressed with the room service and cleaning every day. Great amenities but our shower would leak into the bathroom and flood the toilet floor area. Apart from that it was a great experience. In room dining was awesome and we could get yummy food at any hour of the day or night. Great prices on the room service food and the servings were large which was awesome.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Pleasant hotel in a good location
desc: This hotel is conveniently located for the Singapore sights including the Raffles Hotel (which is undergoing refurbishment at the moment although you can still get a sling in the Long Bar as that is still open). The room was clean and was a double aspect room which was nice although the decor and bathroom were a little tired but they were clean. The reception was on the fourth floor so unless you had need to go there you didn’t really get much interaction with the staff because the exits were on the ground floor. Good location for the Raffles City Shopping Centre which had a big selection of eateries in the basement.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Experience was mixed
desc: We stayed here as part of a Singapore stop-over package. Room was good - pleasant and clean. Bathroom was very good. Staff mostly friendly and helpful. Well located hotel. Could walk to points of interest or catch the hop on hop off bus , buses or nearby MRT. The downside was the bed was VERY hard. Our room was also noisy. Every time the people in the next room left their room the door slammed. We apparently had breakfast as part of our package but were not told, so can't comment on the breakfast. We discovered this just before we left. We weren't too concerned but did inform the person at the desk that this had happened. She was not concerned nor apologetic. Fortunately, this was the only time we had experienced this on our entire holiday. Probably wouldn't stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central Location and a great roof bar to watch the light show!
desc: this was our first time in Singapore and travel agent recommended this hotel for us.. it turned out to be in a great location - central to all the things that we wanted to see and do. they also have a roof bar that looks front on to the Marina Bay Sands hotel and its a great spot to have a cocktail and watch the night show at 8pm. the rooms are modern and clean and the pool is a beautiful spot to cool off after a long day of adventuring! the staff are very helpful and friendly too. all spoke English so asking for directions etc is a breeze. its not the place to stay if you want to have an amazing view from your hotel room as there are high rise buildings all around but its a great hotel for a great price.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice view and great location
desc: The hotel is a bit aged but still decent. The room is rather spacious and the bed quite comfy. Although for the similar price you may be able to find something more premium. It is in a great location, right in the middle of everything so easy to reach places on foot. Definitely don’t recommend breakfast. My breakfast order hadn’t been taken from the door at night so had to chase up in the morning and the lady at the reception appeared as if i woke her up at 7am plus seemed to be surprised there was a breakfast order tag in the room. When the breakfast arrived (very quickly after following up) I actually regretted I had ordered it. Croissants were appalling - didn’t even finish one of the three, orange juice had never been close to fresh oranges (orange-flavoured drink rather)

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good Location
desc: We stayed for 3 nights and found the location really good to get around. The city hall MRT station is close by. There is a small shopping area across the road with a seven11 and other convenience stores. Raffles city is a few minutes walk and has great shopping and a food hall and supermarket.. You can walk down to Clarke quay and boat quay and we even walked to Chinatown (about 16 minutes) But there are lots of buses in the street which takes you straight there. Our corner deluxe room was a good size. It was clean except needed a good dust. The bed was hard but when we complained they supplied a soft bed topper which was appreciated. The breakfast and drink prices were too expensive (even in happy hour) . So we ate and drank elsewhere. But would still consider this

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Smelly Room, Pipe problem, Unreasonable Room Upcharge
desc: I stayed here for 2 days on business trip. This hotel look and feel dated like its back to the 1900s. I originally booked a Single Bed, it was quite ridiculous when I enter the room and I saw two twin bed pushed together. This was at 11pm after long day of work. Needless it took me 45 min to get this sorted out. The check in receptionist was not helpful at all. She just stared at the computer screen typing away and ignoring my questions. The room itself smell like the humidity have destroyed it. Wall paper falling apart and water damage is evident on wall. If you want a quiet night sleep, dont bother staying here I was on the 21 floor and the water from the pipes around me were making sounds all night long. Breakfast was mediocre that I dont even want to talk about it.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Face lift is needed
desc: This Hotel is very well located. When I arrived, I saw people were getting off the pool which is located in front of the lobby on floor 6, everyone was wet and entered the elevator. I didn’t know that there are two separate buildings for the guests until I was told ‘you are in the Peninsula Tower’. I was in a club executive view room 21 Fl. GREAT VIEW! The building is really outdated, our room was very dusty and the bathroom wall and shower head had mold in there. The dryer was really dirty, toilet paper holder was filthy as well. I know the price was great but still these just don’t justified anything.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: One to avoid
desc: They call themselves a 4 star hotel. My word the rooms were dirty and smelt of mould. They changed us after complaining to a larger room and a touch cleaner. But wallpaper peeling and shower tapware lose. The last issue was we were charged for someone else's bar bill. One to avoid.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Tatty and in need of TLC
desc: Had the pleasure of staying here three times in three months. The first was in a superior room, high up, second was a standard room with a pool view, third a standard room with a view to a wall (816). Regardless, you cannot fault the location, right smack in the middle of the bustling city. A stones throw from Chijmes (food and bev Mecca). That being said, the property is showing age and really needs a make-over soon. The standard rooms look tatty and worn. Particularly the bathrooms. E.g. fixtures are not fixed properly, fungus is showing on the ceilings and in the shower - the finish is just not there anymore. (Also the towels were worn so thin, I would have torn them up for rags 100 washes ago) Negatives: Rooms are aged, tatty and worn Overpriced for what feels like a

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of March, mainly as a visa run from Thailand, but also met an old friend who works there First impressions are important, the receptionists didn’t really come across as particularly welcoming. I got to the reception 16 minutes before the check in time and they wouldn’t allow me access to the room until the advertised check in time, which I found incredibly pedantic. They could do with a customer service refresher course and maybe try and learn to smile when welcoming customers. in terms of value for money this hotel really is in a fantastic location and the rooms are of a decent size with big comfy beds. The bathroom was tiny and I can only imagine the architect had Peter Dinklage in mind when the bathrooms were being designed. The

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central location with Singaporean efficiency.
desc: The big advantage was the central location of this hotel on Coleman Street. The room was a very good size, comfortable and quiet; the bathroom was adequate and very clean. Service was of a similar standard, A large dining room with a very good choice of food at their breakfast buffet. A minor point - they were very accurate and reliable with their early-morning wake-up calls for my whole touring group. Value for money was just average.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ideal hotel
desc: Stayed here for two nights..a great hotel very clean.rooms spacious beds comfy and shower really good. This hotel is quite central to everything .we didnt use the restaurant as so many places to eat..outdoor swimming pool is really good.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Best Location
desc: A little escape to spore last April for my Birthday and couldn’t be happier that we found this Hotel. The location is sooo perfect, near to any attractions and shopping spree locations. The staffs were so friendly, our cleaning lady is so sweet and lovely, I hate that I forgot her name. We got a lovely chocolate and greetings bday card from the staffs too, so lovely. Skylounge is a place you have to go, gorgeous night view. Will be back for sure.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Solid hotel that is centrally located
desc: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Lobby was nice and our room was OK and we were given a free upgrade at check-in as an added bonus. Location is very central with the nearest mrt station just a quick 5 min walk from the hotel. There's also a currency change place in the complex directly across from the hotel, as well some shops close by offering convenient access to items of need. Raffles City Mall is very close by, while the hotel is within 15 to 20 min walking distance to Clarke Quay, Chinatown or Marina Bay if you do choose. Otherwise the strategically located mrt station will provide quick access to anywhere you want to go via Singapore's efficient and world class transit system. I'd stay here again the next time I visit Singapore, as the hotel is reasonably priced

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Club room good value for money
desc: Located in little Burma on Colman St the Penex is the best located hotel in Singapore. To the North are Raffles, Bugis St, little India, and Arab St. To the East is the Marina bay complex and Suntec, to the South the Quays and Chinatown, to the West Orchid road. The hotel itself is older but is well maintained. It has shopping and restaurants around it and these can be very good value for money. As it is older it suffers from poor plumbing in the shower (21st floor) however the shower was quite functional. We booked at club room which meant we were allowed to use the Sky lounge at the top of the Peninsula tower for free. This was fantastic. Not just a free cocktail every evening, 2 free items of laundry per day and included breakfast in a lovely quiet spot almost to ourselves

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Popular Hotel
desc: We have stayed at this hotel previously and quite happy to stay here again.We had a 2 night stay before a cruise to Rome and found everything as good as before. It is in a good location and the service of all the staff was excellent. Our room was large and the bed very comfortable. We have booked another cruise from Singapore next year and will be staying at this hotel again. Highly recommend.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Check-in
desc: We arrived very early to the hotel at 9am after an overnight flight from Europe. From entering the hotel we must have been told 10 times by different hotel staff before we were able to speak to reception that check-in was 1400. OKAY we’ve got it!!!! Reception didn’t seem to keen to help either. We left our bags and returned. In Singapore seems rules are rules. Hotel however was very nice it’s true what previous people have written that it’s a little run down but it’s acceptable. There are two nice pool areas but not enough sun beds so you’ll be lucky to get one. Breakfast buffet was very nice great selection of foods catering for all cultures. Location is perfect MTR at City Hall just 5-10 minute walk and there is a tunnel route if you want to avoid the heat. Would I stay here

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent location
desc: Excellent location to be on foot or the MRT in Singapore. Only 30 min in a taxi from the airport. Decent walk to the Marina Bay Gardens but worth it. Walk to Clarke Quay or La Pau Sat Hawker Market for dinner. When we got to the hotel about 10pm and got to our room, the single bed needed for our young son was not in the room, so we had to wait for it to be delivered! The room itself was fine, although we were a family of three and the only way we could fit the extra bed in was to move the sofa from the bottom of the double bed and put it under the desk type table otherwise the bedroom would not work. Breakfast wasn't cheap but the food on offer was good and set up up for our busy tourist days.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Meh Experience
desc: I stayed at this hotel and as it was my first time in Singapore and the reviews were decent. Unfortunately this hotel is somewhere between a 2 and a 3. It's passable because I had a bed to sleep in but the cost simply was not justified by the poor service (I didn't get my room cleaned once in my 4 days staying there), I had to pay 80 dollars for laundry, and the conceirge up front was not good about explaining why I was being charged as many times as I was. She also didn't seem to care either about the customer. If you are staying in Singapore I would give some of the other hotels a try first...

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hotel needs work
desc: We booked into this hotel for three nights upon booking in they could not find the room we had booked. Offered us a room with twin beds and said they would get them made up to a big bed All they did was push the two beds together. The TV didn’t work for two days phoned the front desk on first night waited an hour then gave up we had to remind them the following day. The room wasn’t the cleanest and really needs updating, the breakfast I would not pay to have at Tyne hotel again very average I would go to one of the eateries outside hotel. We won’t be staying at this hotel again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent location for Singapore layover
desc: A wonderful short layover at a great location in Singapore. Less than S$20 from airport, MRT close by, easy walk to Clarke Quay and Chinatown. We have been staying at this hotel since 1991 and it improves and impresses every time. Well appointed comfortable rooms with all amenities. We were fortunate to enjoy Sky Lounge access this time and it was exceptional. We look forward to a longer visit next time.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Older style. Great location.
desc: If you want an older style hotel with rooms that are a bit bigger than the new generation of hotels, that is close to Chinatown, Boat Quay and the Museum area, then consider the Peninsula Excelsior. A short walk from City Hall MRT also. Comfortable rooms and efficient and helpful staff too.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central location
desc: As our first time staying in Singapore we found this accommodation to be central to all things we needed. Staff were pleasant and helpful, the room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Plenty of places to eat in the area as well as the hotel eateries. Would stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ideal for a short stopover!
desc: We stayed here again for a 24 hour stopover on the way to Europe. On arrival, check-in was completed by the courteous receptionist in a fast and efficient manner. Our room was very similar to the one which we had occupied during a previous stay. It was in need of some refurbishment, being a little dated and tired. However, it was fine for an overnight stay being clean and comfortable. The hotel was very busy during our short stay with many people including obvious business conference groups coming and going. The location of the hotel was ideal for our needs. It was an easy walk to Clarke Quay. There is a bus stop for the Singapore Airlines hop on, hop off bus situated just around the corner. There are a number of casual eating options located nearby. Check-out was as easy as

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The Good and the average!
desc: The location is in a good spot. We had a room in tower 2 which did not have a balcony and the bathroom smelt. Rooms need a refresh as the paint on the walls is brown and peeling. Breakfast was good, a variety for all nationalities to choose from. Level 22 was amazing and the staff are absolutely delightful - a special mention to Fazyira, Sera and AC for their hospitality

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Peninsula Excelsior
desc: Two of us had a two day stopover in Singapore and on our way to Europe and were pleasantly surprised at our hotel being right in the heart of the city. Older style but perfect for us, we enjoyed drinks and a cheese platter for a late dinner with drinks after arrival in the Lobby Lounge. Well equipped rooms including all mod cons, especially wifi. Our accommodation at Peninsula Excelsior included transfers to and from the Airport, with helpful staff on hand at all times of the day. We enjoyed a great buffet breakfast in Coleman's Cafe on Level 5 in a lovely setting with an amazing array of cuisine. Would definitely recommend this hotel to any travellers wanting everything close by.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hotel Stay
desc: Great place to stay, good location within walking distance of many local attractions. Rooms are good, clean and we had a wonderful view of the city as our room was on the 18th floor. Facilities are clean, food in restaurant & café good and the staff are very friendly. Would stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Bad shower
desc: This hotel needs an update. The room we stayed in felt old and in need of an update. The room was also dirty. The bathroom was what I was most disappointed about. The shower was dirty and was not working properly. It did not have consistent hot water, the water coming out from the shower and tap were both running alternating hot and cold water. We called the front desk wanting to switch to another room, only to receive an answer saying they would get the pipe guy to the room and have a check up. After he check the shower he stated that it was caused by the boiler and he was going to have another check on the boiler. Nonetheless, we could not get our room switched and the problem persisted. The hotel in a great location which is the only reason I give it 1 point. I would not

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Awesome views
desc: We had a very enjoyable stay at PE our room was 1518 and the view was outstanding, could not believe we were so lucky to get on this side of the hotel overlooking the harbour & marina bay. Good small hawker centre at bottom near hotel called sidewalk hawker centre , the bathroom was lovely , the room a little small And the bed was extremely firm which is why I rate 4 star . Staff were friendly , I would stay here again for the view And location

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central
desc: This is a very large hotel in the centre of Singapore. Hotel is very close to the MRT, shops, restaurants, walking distance to Garden by the Bay, River,National Gallery. Large clean rooms, serviced daily, friendly & helpful staff. If breakfast not included in accommodation they offer full buffet for half price approx. $15 pp. Discounts are offered on other meals and spa treatments

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great stay via one championship experience
desc: Nice hotel .; good ambiance . Perfect 👌 nice surroundings . Good food . And easy access to nearby tourist attraction . Great stay for us . Thanks guys . Must comeback again . All the staff are details to their work routine and thoughtful gesture

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: All you need in a hotel.
desc: Clean and spacious rooms in a great location with a cheap beer and food centre at the base corner of the hotel. What more does a traveler need in their accommodation. I stay here every time I go to Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: BEWARE - Do Not Stay at this Hotel
desc: My friend and it had booked and pre-paid for our accommodation prior to leaving Australia but on check-in were informed that we would have to pay an additional $50 a night to cover incidentals but were then informed that this was not necessary. We were then allocated rooms on the 8th floor of the hotel which were disgraceful to say the least. The room was old, dilapidated, dirty, stank and the entrance door had obviously been broken into as the lock was hanging off. I won't even begin to describe the bathroom which was disgusting. And why the request to pay for incidentals as there weren't any! Totally unacceptable so my friend and I complained to reception and were allocated much better rooms on the 16th floor. The only other thing to mention is don't expect to get a lift

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: Located near central Singapore and was a good choice for a twenty four hour stop over. Two nice pools but weather was not suitable to use. Good food options close by and new shopping mall next door Staff friendly

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 3* hotel masquerading as 4* hotel
desc: Overpriced hotel. Deplorable buffet breakfast - would be lucky to make 2* - tea is pre-made so guests have no choice of what tea they want nor how strong or weak. Awful awful awful food choice. Despite being in the tropics, very poor selection of fresh fruit (if any). Tinned fruit salad, noisy staff whilst trying to eat. Reception staff were rude. Would definitely never stay here again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent service
desc: My mother and I stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior for a few nights on our way to and from England. We have stayed there many times over the years. This trip was to celebrate my mother’s 90th birthday. From the moment we arrived we were given personal assistance and made to feel most welcome. The staff at the Sky Lounge were so obliging and helped with bookings etc. We enjoyed cocktail hours and a meal in the Sky Lounge and were very impressed with the food. The staff presented Mother with a lovely cake plate and sang happy birthday to her. Watching the light and sound show and the rehearsals for Singapore National Day from the observation deck was very special. A couple of issues with room included baby noise from an adjoining room, which when mentioned Sky staff noted and

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Value accommodation in Singapore
desc: Our booking agent arranged this hotel largely because it is literally within walking distance of many of the attractions and it included breakfast in the deal. It’s clean, comfortable and more than adequate breakfast to set you up for the day.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A disappointing Stay !!!
desc: Booking was done through the website for 2 nights from June 7 to June 9, 2019 respectively to attend the Annual Convocation of District Grand Chapter & Half-Annual Communication of District Grand Lodge. We proceeded to Level 5 , it was slow at check in counters. We waited and the lady at the Premier Club Check in Counter was free ,offered to check us in. Subsequently she found out our reservation was for Premier Club Rooms, she told us we should check in at the 22nd Floor Club Check In Lounge, but if we do not mind, she could help to check us in. To cut the waste of time, I allowed her to do the check in. It was a disaster !!!! She was slow, could not explain the club rooms benefit properly for she explained she did not have the Club Welcome Letter. She wrote our room numbers

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent destination
desc: This hotel is central to singapore’s main attractions. Easy walking to restaurants, and shopping centres. The hotel facilities are excellent with the most spectacular views from the Skye Lounge. The staff are not only friendly and helpful but extremely professional.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not a good option.
desc: This hotel resulted not very well located, the staff is not friendly or helpful at all, the room was very low category and I wouldn’t recomend it. I’m sure there must be better options to try for same price

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Conveniently located but otherwise average
desc: We had booked the deluxe room. It is quite small. The bath tub (cum shower) is very narrow & therefore uncomfortable with very little elbow room. The water temperature too was hard to control. The breakfast spread was average. The area around is interesting with shopping centres, Raffles City, Chijmes (a pleasant out and indoor dining venue) within walking distance.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Could do better
desc: It is a little confusing getting to the check in counters once you arrive at the hotel. You have to take an elevator to the L level and walk across the mezzanine floor to the counters. Would have been good if there was someone at the elevators to guide first time visitors. Check in and check out was quick, staff could smile more probably. Was upgraded to a deluxe suite. Had asked for a smoking room and they have those on the 19th floor. Room was well appointed. Shower was a little cramped and water temperature could not be adjusted. It was either boiling hot or ice cold, nothing in the middle. The higher floors overlooking marina bay sands and seaside have great views. Tried the buffet lunch, spread was good. Few things could be improved upon but overall I would say it was an

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central to everything
desc: A very central location and comfortable for the traveller. Walking distance to all tranport options, shopping, hop on hop off bus across the road. Found staff at hotel very helpful and good variety for breakfast buffet.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central Location
desc: We stayed here from the 19/6/19 to 24/6/19 before a cruise from Singapore. Both the Check In & Check Out was quick with the staff helpful & friendly. The Reception is actually located on Level 6, so you need to take the lifts from the ground floor. There are 2 towers to the hotel and our room was a Premier Room on the 17th Floor in the Excelsior Tower with views of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The room was clean & tidy with all the amenities provided. The shower was located over the bathtub (See photo) which had very high side & a wide edge which made it difficult to get in & out of safely without having to sit down on the edge. The towels provided were not of a very soft texture. The bed mattress was also very firm to sleep on. The air conditioning temperature was cold and hard

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: It's inexpensive for Singapore and well located
desc: This hotel is large, inexpensive for Singapore and well located. Our room was clean and quiet, but the breakfast was horrible, absolutely awful. There was a very small selection of fresh fruit (and some very sweet, canned fruit), the pastries and croissants were dry as paper, the coffee was a big urn of instant coffee and the hot food... I just wouldn't touch it. The only thing I could eat there was the omelette as they do have a chef making it (but I wouldn't touch the scrambled eggs on the counter.) Also, the breakfast room is freezing cold and other than the omelette chef, the staff don't really look too happy in their jobs. Not a smile in sight. If you don't mind a very poor breakfast experience, this place is OK.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Wedding Anniversary Staycation
desc: My wife and i were celebrating our 4th wedding anniversary in this hotel. i would like to give a big thank you to Miss Jumie (FOM) knowing that its for a special occasion and she took all the extra effort in coordinating the surprise for room decorations for us. The room is awesome and beautiful that my wife cant stop taking photos. When Arrive at the club floor, we were greeted by the friendly Relationship Manager Ariane, Vivian from the club check- in desk to ensure that we were well taken care off by ensuring all my books are reservations were correct. During our dinner at sky lounge, there is staff name AC that her excellent service in F&B is so steady and attentive towards our orders. she constantly check to make sure our drinks were never empty and even check with us on

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very convenient
desc: The hotel has 2 pools open already from 7 a.m. Our room was really good - a big bathroom, two separate beds as we required, the view from the window could have been a bit better though. The hotel is very close to two shopping centres, a 10-minute walking distance away from the Marina bay, very safe neighbourhood. We really loved breakfast at this place! Very big choice, definitely something for everyone.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Holiday 3 nights
desc: The hotel was centrally located, the room was spacious and clean. The air conditioning worked well. We didnt have breakfast there as there were numerous much cheaper eating places nearby. The swimming pools were great and the staff were friendly. If we were staying again, we would try harder to get into the front tower for the views, but our room overlooking the foyer and pool area was good. We did learn for the first time though about pushing a button for room service after we wondered why they didnt do for the first couple of days.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Promises much but fails to deliver
desc: A very average hotel. Rooms small but tidy but need renovation. Plugs and furniture not working, Bathroom a bit small and shower temperature changed all the time. Whoever designed the mirror positions has never shaved in their life. Breakfast food good selection but hot items often just warm. Other meals I always came away still hungry. Wi Fi woeful Offered use of Skylight lounge but lift key never took me there. Only good thing is the staff are very friendly and helpful There must be better places to stay

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Sky Lounge
desc: we had dinner there last year and I returned this year with 3 lovely ladies for a couple of drinks I would like to mention the staff were great first class service from Sera Ko and Vivian so polite and friendly

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location – close to food courts and public transport.
desc: We have now stayed at this hotel at least 3 times, all be it till this trip 8 years ago. On reading recent reviews prior to booking this hotel we had very low expectations for this hotel. We were staying on a Singapore Stopover package and this hotel was our second choice in a moderately (for Singapore) priced location. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted at the registration counter by a less than friendly team member as we had remembered from 8 years ago (not all reception staff had this trait). The cleaning staff were much friendlier. When we arrived in room 1431 in the Excelsior Tower we were pleasantly surprised. Our room was a reasonable size and being on the corner of the tower we could just see past the Peninsula Tower and get a view of the Marina Bay Sands

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Bad experience with Dinner at Sky lounge
desc: It was unfortunate that we had to accidentally donate several dollars for our dinner at sky lounge. Firstly they mentioned that they don't have vegetarian on their set menu. Does this hotel think that only meet eater customer would come to their restaurant? Very pathetic... They charged us super high price for just 2 cutlet and mushroom soup. That too the soup was so lousy. Unfortunately don't want to create issues since we are with the family and rather we walked out patiently just paying our donation. Excelsior Hotel, Please try to be genuine and do a fare your customers.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Fantastic stay, location & service
desc: We stayed at Peninsula Excelsior Hotel and upgraded to the Premier Club with Sky lounge. This was for a very special occasion so I requested the best room possible and wow did I get granted with amazing views across the whole of Singapore and the Marina. The staff in the Premier Club sky lounge were fantastic and couldn’t do enough for us. A big thank you to Vivian and Fazyira who were both brilliant and looked after us very well. The views from the lounge and balcony in there were amazing. Excellent choice of breakfast options. 2 pools to choose from. Perfectly located hotel close to MRT and 10 minutes walk to Marina. Only area for improvement is the dust that was clearly visible in the rooms. Other than this we had a perfect stay and would definitely recommend and can’t wait

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Best Birthday Staycation
desc: Received a warm welcome at the Sky Lounge by the Guest Relations Manager, Ms Ariane. The sky lounge ambience was nice, cosy and needless to say the view was spectacular overseeing the Padang and the Seaview horizon. Upon checking into the room, I was surprised that a simple birthday celebration layout in the room. The room was also facing the Padang where you can lie lazily on bench window sill to see the upcoming parade in the evening. We are there at the sky lounge early in the evening in anticipation of the NE show. With lights flashing across the skyline, the rest is beyond words of description. It is just perfect. We will be looking forward towards our next Staycation at Peninsula Excelsior Hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Time out before work commitments
desc: Reception let us down unfortunately,. Was told to come to counter and waited 15/20 minutes before recognised. Booked early and still no room allocated. We were upgraded but if room better than booked ... still not the best . Very dated so star rating not as stated. Singapore has great ratings in regards to hotels so you believe all great but not the best. Could be great but no.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: This Hotel has 2 towers. We booked 2 twin rooms (girls trip). We were put in different towers !!!! They are quite a distance apart and we could not get to each other's rooms! Apart from that, Hotel was ok. Rooms were clean, although maybe a little dated. Roof top bar had spectacular views. Drinks very expensive. We did not eat at the Hotel, so not sure what meals were like. The Hotel is within walking distance to a lot of things. There is a brand new shopping complex next door. It's huge. Great place to eat and shop. Overall, the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel was just ok but in a great location.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Mixed
desc: 4 star for location. This is our second time in Singapore and we have used The Peninsula Excelsior as a stop over to the UK on both occasions. On the last occasion, our first two nights were lovely and quiet, as requested. However, the third night, with the need to rise at 5 the next morning, the family next door allowed their children to run up and down the passage between 9:30 and 11 pm! They apologised when I put my head out the door at ten but allowed it to continue. Also, we booked the night before so we could sleep when we arrived on a 6am flight but though the room was supposed to be an upgrade, we froze until we had the air conditioning fixed and also had to have the safe fixed, so our sleep catch up was rather shortened. The room wasn't up to the standard of the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Peninsula Excelsior Hotel Singapore
desc: Our family of 2 adults & 2 teenagers stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel Singapore in July 2019 for 6 nights for our son’s 18th. We booked direct & Mimi in Reservations was fantastic to deal with. We booked interconnecting rooms and were upgraded to the 21st floor of Peninsula. Very impressed with the staff and our son received a piece of cake, chocolates & a lovely card on his birthday from Fazyira & the Sky Lounge team. Highly recommend this hotel for location, services & value for money. Request room in Peninsula side of hotel with views of Singapore River & Marina Bay Sands.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not that good not so bad!!
desc: Stayed in this hotel with colleagues for attending a meeting of our Company. Possibly this is my second time stay in this hotel and the first one was a few years back. The staffs are very polite and well mannered people and extends all possible cooperation to its guests I found. Specially I would like to mention about Ms. Sarah, a staff in the front desk /reception who was very kind and helpful. We are indebted to her because our Managing Director un-mindfully left behind his small hand bag in the desk after checking in the hotel. She kept with utmost care and we received it back within next half an hour or earlier may be. This kind of staffs are really assets to the property.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not even close to 4 star
desc: This hotel has one thing going for it - location. The rest is only average at very best so my advice is to find a better one in a similar location. We (14 in our party) stayed here for 4 nights over a 4 week period (once at the start and then at the end of a longer holiday). Safe to say we won't be back. The concierge guys are great with the exception of an older guy who is just surly - get rid of him team as he is bringing you down. There were 14 of us - yes it will be a handful to store our luggage - get over it. Baggage and taxi organising service was well done otherwise. Reception was very disappointing to us both times. I completely understand the concept of check outs vs having the room available etc and we were patient. On both occasions we had early long

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great spot
desc: We stayed at Peninsula Excelsior Hotel in Singapore for three nights as a stopover on our way to Europe. It was selected for us by the Accor Vacation club. Initially we wanted to use club points but... that’s another story. Anyway getting to the hotel from the airport was really easy. Get in the MRT and, with one change of trains, get off at City Hall. A short 5 minute walk got us to the door. Cost only $5. It took longer to check in at the hotel which we found disappointingly slow. Having said that the location is great and the room modern. Wi-fi was available but it keeps on failing. I wouldn’t recommend the breakfast either. Whilst it was nice, it is very over priced at $32 a head. Better to go to the cafe at the front of the building for less than that price

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location but a very tired hotel
desc: We stayed as a stopover for 24 hours at this hotel and thank goodness it was not longer. Concierge very good. Check in was ok but they failed to mention where the breakfast restaurant was. The hotel itself is quite old and it shows in the bathroom. Shower is over the very high bath with no grab handles and in my opinion quite dangerous. I had to sit on the side of the bath to get in. Bathroom has been regrouted many times and they haven't bothered to remove the white grout from the brown wall tiles! The rack over the bath was crooked and nearly falling off as were the hooks on the back of the bathroom door. Breakfast buffet was just average. Great location but I was disappointed. Would not recommend this hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Superb views & dining experience @ Sky lounge (top floor with balcony)
desc: Had dinner here and watched the national day parade (preview) @ padang and fireworks. The aerial view is awesome, able to enjoy the national day atmosphere without much crowd! Felt like the red lions and planes were all so close and right above us. We could see the fireworks near marina bay sands and boat quay! ^^ would totally come here again for the views. Took lots of pic perfect family shots and videos. Staff service was awesome! Sera & Jacy were really nice, friendly and helpful. Food wise was alright. 4 course meal - nice salad, mushroom soup with truffle oil (would be better with more mushroom taste), Steak was ok. Tiramisu dessert feels abit too creamy. Aircon can sometimes be abit too cold and makes the food cold easily. The food might have tasted better if it didnt

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Jims Hol
desc: excellently located hotel but not 4 star. bedroom excellent and also bathroom excellent. rooftop swimming pool was in the other tower to ourselves, there floor did not want to traipse from one wing to another to use the pool. concierge and check in very poor. concierge far to small. elevators inadequate ( 3 ) check in, think we may have had a someone new on the desk but instead of someone helping with registration the receptionist had to keep asking for help. No information given about the hotel on check in. Another guest had to tell us that in order to get the lift to our floor we had to show our room card to a reader.Checked out asked about ordering a taxi, receptionist said ask the concierge, concierge showed us the taxi rank. Breakfast adequate, no great shakes but I

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: Stayed for one night en route to UK. Very nice room with some harbour views and views over Clarks Quay. Ate in the restaurant at the top of the hotel. Magnificient views over the city. Good food, selection of chinese food. Swimming pool that could be seen frim reception looked very inviting. Used the gym showers prior to leaving for late night flight which was very handy. Handy for China town and Clarks Quay restaurants. Would definately stay there again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very poor choice of hotel
desc: Singapore has an abundant supply of hotels and we made a very poor choice by booking Peninsula Excelsior Hotel. While under $200aud per night, it is still not at the cheap end of the scale, but I was horrified to see the mouldy blind and bath in our bathroom! Surely, removing the blind would be a far better solution than just drawing attention to the problem?! Friends had booked in the evening before and had a wonderful view of Marina Bay Sands (maybe I was envious) but as we had booked at the same time and the same room type, I called reception for clarification. The excuse given was our friends were given an upgrade as their room wasn't ready (they arrived at 7pm) even though my friends were not advised they had received said upgrade or that room was not ready. Lucky for

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but poor service
desc: We stayed here for 2 nights on our way home to Australia and NZ. Check in time is strictly 2pm, so in spite of a long, tiring flight from London and arriving early morning we had to sit and wait for several hours before we could access our rooms. Even then, the check in process was very slow and tedious. And the lifts couldn't cope with the volume of traffic. We had to try several times to get to our floor. On the positive side the rooms were comfortable and spacious and the best shower ever after 7 weeks of travel. Good central location and within walking distance of shops, eating places and the Singapore river. However, I wouldn't choose to stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: personal holiday
desc: Arranged accomodation thru a travel agent but had stayed with this hotel on previos occasions. Hotel is centrally located and is within walking distance of a lot of tourist spots. Clark whalf, Merlion park, Raffells Hotel and Fort Canning and the Battelboxl to name a few.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice Hotel and helpful staff
desc: This is not our first time stay at Peninsula Hotel. However on this last visit, we arrived at the hotel in the morning and got advise we have to wait till after 2 pm as the room is full. Then we wait at the lobby but fall a sleep at the lobby chair as we are very exhausted since our arrival flight was midnight. Suddenly the Duty Manager come and help us. He then giving us an upgrade room at free of charge. We really are appreciate and thankfull to Mr. Melvin's help and kindness. The Premier room at Peninsula Tower is very good and the view is wonderfull. We will deffinately come back here again and would also nominate this hotel as one of the best.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but poor service
desc: I would say this hotel`s location is fantastic. It is in the center of the city. There are many shops and restaurants around the hotel. So it is easy to find some place to have breakfast. 10 minutes walk to the Merlion Park and Clarke Quay, and 5 minutes to the Fort Canning Park. I have to say the room service is not good. It`s always no towel after the housemen cleaning the room. I had to call housekeeping to give us towels everyday. At last I would say the TV is not working. And Shower head cannot adjust height.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not truthful on the description
desc: The Hotel description never mentioned a deposited to be made at the hotel. Special services mentioned were not part of the hotels value added services. Hotel was rated a 4.5 star but the service was really bad

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Expected more.
desc: Upon reaching my floor, as soon as the elevator doors opened I was hit with the smell of stale cigarette smoke. For the duration of my stay, the smell never disappeared from that foyer. Luckily the smell was not present in my room. I can't recall if I had inadvertently chosen to stay on a smoking floor. Perhaps it's my fault for thinking that by default I would be given a room on a non-smoking floor. Anyway, I'll be more careful next time. Room was OK. Looked a bit old, but then again this is a rather old hotel and I think in need of refurbishing. There are a lot of hotels at this price point in this area so I may give those a try the next time I'm in Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Give it a miss
desc: We were booked into this hotel as part of a stopover. The check in was what I would describe as woeful, the girl had no idea about anything, we were tired, jet lagged and just wanted to get to our rooms, we had two booked. I’m not sure if she was new, or what the problem was, we were basically given our keys, after what seemed like a lot of paperwork shuffling, (all paid upfront) We weren’t told one thing about the hotel,nothing, she didn’t even, tell us about restaurant, pool,or internet. I think we were in the old tower,both rooms, had the most disgusting smell of mould, the carpets were thick with dust, the fridge was disgusting, the fridge area& tray were filthy.....(see photos) The little girl doing the room cleaning was quiet delightful, but it seems she was the only

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location and Friendly and Helpful Staff
desc: Traveled with a friend and we stayed in a room with 2 twin beds. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and we especially liked Hairi at concierge who helped us plan our stay there. Pros: Friendly staff! Hairi and others at the concierge was super nice and gave us lots of advice to help us plan our stay. We bought tickets to Garden by The Bay and the Obeservation Deck at discounted price through a vendor there. No issues with checkin and checkout. Hairi and others were quick to help with our luggage. Swimming pools are nice and clean. Towels available in the gym. They have sauna and locker rooms downstairs in the basement which kind of out of the way. Great location to MRT (rail transit system). About 1.5 blocks away and MRT is easy to use. Use the Singapore MRT

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Be careful the staff is super rude/ inhuman
desc: I am writing this review as I am sitting in the lobby of the hotel waiting for a room endlessly . I landed here after an overnight flight with a prior request for an early check-in . I understand if rooms may not be available , however basic human courtesy is missing in the staff. The check was akin to the staff barking at me and talking rudely . For the first time I was asked plz give cash as collateral even when I had paid for full for my booking in advance. Refused and asked them to take a block on my card as is the practise the world over. I have a conference to attend at 1 pm and when asked for a room for wash and change . They Have asked me to use the gym.No question of them even offering a glass of water for waiting guests. When asked when the room will be ready.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good central location
desc: I stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel in August 2019, in the Excelsior tower. Upon arrival I was greeted by very friendly staff and the check in process was swift and painless. The room was nice and appeared to be clean, with cleaning service every day. The mattress was a little hard, but I have stayed in other countries within Asia with the similar problem so it might be just different to what I’m accustomed to. The hotel is centrally located with close proximity to the City Hall MRT, walk to Clarke Quay and walking distance to the Singapore Museum. It was the national day long weekend and the staff had wonderful recommendations in lieu of the booked out sky lounge. The staff were great, always extremely helpful and greeted with a smile that no task was too hard or question

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Everything you need
desc: Great Singapore stopover Hotel. Just meters from Hop on Hop off bus stop. Easy walking to Clarke Quay. Super comfy bed and well appointed spacious room. The view over Marina Sands was spectacular and we saw the laser show for free from our room.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location
desc: Great view from room on the10th floor.....walking distance to many of the hightlights.. friendly helpful staff...had everything that is required from a city hotel...full access to pool and roof top bar......enjoyed our stay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but can find better
desc: Second stay in Singapore and Stayed at this hotel recently for two nights. Great location, located near a close MTR and shops, so you can easily get around Singapore using the train, that’s pretty much where the pluses of this review stop. Arrived and noticed that the rooms where not cleaned properly, containing mould and dirt, on the floor even found a toe nail clipping from a previous stay, not the best thing to walk into. Noticed that we had also had our room key taken by a member of house keeping and had to go down and change keys, which was easily done, also requested no house keeping to enter room but they still entered. I wouldn’t stay here again if I visited Singapore in future.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Disgusted
desc: Our baby boy was crawling on the floor of our hotel room, when I lifted him, he was covered in hair, definitely not ours. We were shocked when we looked underneath the bed and saw lots of hair, dirt and all sorts of waste, not ours. Hotel promised twice to properly clean the room, which only happened after a third complaint demanding to speak the manager in loud voice in front of other guests. On the last day we woke up with cigaret smell in our room which came from the adjacent employees elevator shaft.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: The Peninsula Excelsior is a good value for money hotel with the big bonus being its location. Within easy walking distance of Raffles Hotel, Raffles City shopping mall, the MTR, Clarke Quay, Art Gallery , South East Asian Museum. For those who like to walk a little further Orchard Rd and Chinatown.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Birthday Staycation
desc: Went there in Sept 2019 to celebrate my birthday. Was greeted by Vivian. It was a smooth & pleasant check-in. Was invited by Ms Ariane to the Sky Lounge during evening. And it was indeed a pleasant surprise. I was greeted by Ms Ariane & AC who happened to surprise me with a small slice of cake & birthday song. I was taken aback but at the same time, I really appreciate all the surprises that they have done including decorating the room. My kids love the room as much as I do. Am looking forward to another staycation in Oct 2019, to celebrate my wedding anniversary. Kudos to Ms Ariane, AC & Vivian. Thank you for making it happen. We will & definitely be back again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: Just stayed here 1 night en route to Sydney. We've been to Singapore several times but not since the Gardens by the Bay were opened, so mainly wanted to visit these. The location of the hotel is very central with easy access to Clark Quay & the Marina. We walked to the Gardens by the Bay which was a pleasant stroll of about 25 minutes. We also had couple of drinks at the 57th floor of the Marina Bay Sands hotel, which is often seen on pictures of Singapore. Great views, expensive drinks but good vibe. Worth a visit and not too far to walk from Peninsular. The room we had was fine & comfortable although the bed was quite firm. Breakfast was fairly bland but average. Staff were friendly and helpful. Bistro on the ground floor was good for a lunch or breakfast.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Enjoyable stay
desc: We stayed here for 2 nights on a stopover holiday. The rooms were spacious and beds very comfortable. The bathrooms need to be cleaned better. Unfortunately, the staff in this hotel are incredibly rude. (Except for the check in staff who were friendly and helpful)

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but underwhelming experience
desc: I stayed here with my husband while visiting for both work and a long weekend with family, and we were very underwhelmed. The location is very central so I could walk to the office and the Sky Lounge bar has excellent views over the city, but unfortunately that is where the compliments end. The furnishings in the room were old and tired with stains in the bathroom, and the room didn't have some of the conveniences I've come to expect from other businesses hotels such as an iron. The staff were unhelpful and at times actively rude to both us and other customers. One morning it took me 3 attempts to request an iron before one was bought to the room, and they were unapologetic when I complained the delay had made me late. The reception staff also were surly when our key card

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Still in a great location for the Grand Prix
desc: As with my previous experience during Grand Prix weekend the hotel provides a great location to base yourself at affordable prices. Close to everything you need during a major sporting event weekend and good rooms. Thanks to all the concierge staff for arrival and departure services - great to see them dressed in the various F1 team gear again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but the rooms could be improved
desc: We arrived early due to our flight and we unable to check-in early but we were able to leave our luggage. On returning at 1pm, check-in is 2pm, we were allowed to check-in but the process was really slow especially as there was only us in reception. We were also told nothing about the hotel or what was close by, which was disappointing. The person on reception seems like they didn't want to be there and wasn't bothered that we were checking in for the first time. We were in the Excelisor tower and I was surprised at how small the room was. We had issues both of us having our suitcases open at the same time! The bed was so hard and the bathroom had seen better days. One evening we wanted to visit the Skybar for a cocktail, which is in the Peninsula Tower, so we got into the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Sky Lounge - Great team, great night. Thank you Miss A C and her team.
desc: Absolutely perfect night. The manager miss A C and her team made our night prefect. We had great service and great food to. Miss A C and her team were fantastic.
