Welcoming, helpful, professional and fun to. You can ask for no more. The food was great and the view from the balcony is perfect for the sights and sounds of the city and the F1 circuit. We will be back again for sure.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Perfect. Not much to fault
desc: Was a bit surprised by the reviews online but this hotel is great. Great location right in downtown and perfect for people attending the F1. Rooms are much bigger then others in Singapore and nice and modern in the excelsior tower. Upon check in I was told there is no double beds unless I want to stay on a smoking floor but after a short 15 minute wait was was available on a non smoking floor. Rooms are clean and tidy every day. Pools are a perfect spot to cool off and the gym is nice and new! Will be back!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The location is the only thing this hotel has going for it
desc: I recently stayed at this hotel. On booking it was requested that we have a non-smoking room. After waiting 45 minutes to check it we were advised that we had be "upgraded". However our room was on the 19th floor which is a smoking floor. The room was so bad that our eyes watered with the smell. When we requested a non-smoking room we were advised that my husband and I would have to stay in a room with 2 single beds. After much discussion (some 2 hours) they were able to accommodate us. The staff were unhelpful and rude. If you had breakfast included, do yourself a favour and skip it or go elsewhere, you will not be missing anything. The room was in dire need of attention. The bathroom was so old and mouldy that we thought it best to shower with thongs on. The

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Return trip to favourite city.
desc: I normally stop in Singapore after every trip to family in Holland and recharge before last leg to Australia. This hotel is ideal situated to walk to china town, Clarke’s river front, museums, the Flyer or the bay if you like walking. Staff helpful and point you in the right direction. Plenty of places to eat local as well. View from room magic.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hotel rooms tired and dilapidated
desc: We stayed here as part of Singapore Airlines package. After reading all the negative reviews we checked in with an open view. Front staff friendly enough and our room was adequate for a 2 night stay. The hotel and rooms very tired and dilapidated. The bathroom looked liked it had been very poorly renovated. The shower over the bath worked well but the hand basin took forever to drain. The towels were threadbare and frayed at the edges. Two of the towels on first night had dirty marks on them, not useable. A Buffet Breakfast was part of the deal. It was very average and the staff in dining room were not a happy bunch. The location was the only good thing about it. I would not choose to stay here again or recommend

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Friendly staff
desc: We had a stopover on the way to London and another on the return trip to Australia. Both stays we had good rooms. All the staff are friendly. We had breakfast on our return trip and was very good. The hotel is round to the famous Raffles so handy for that. Only a 20 minute taxi ride to the airport.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: It’s a well located business hotel
desc: The Peninsula Excelsior is quite comparable to other business oriented hotels in Singapore. It’s not extremely luxurious, but my room was clean, reasonably maintained, and comfortable. It had high ceilings and a big window to let in the light, the AC worked well and the water was hot. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was standard fare. The location is the really good aspect, with the MRT within walking distance, Clarke Quay an easy walk, and the new Funan shopping centre next door.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
desc: After a quick check in procedure, we went up to the room to find ourselves allocated in a smoking room. We both don't smoke so we left the room right away and asked for a different room. They moved us from the 19th floor to the 10th floor and although the view from the room was way less, we were happy with the move. Unfortunately, the new room had two single beds which they have put together. The set up of the outlets and light switches was not designed for this and one light switch was directly behind my pillow. Thanks to this I've woken up multiple times during the first night because I accidentally hit the light switch a few times. The bed itself was very hard. After the second night we left a note on the bed where we requested for a topper which they placed and made it

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Non a 4 star hotel
desc: We stayed in the 9th floor of the excelsior tower for 2 nights which were unacceptable. First and basic was the awful smell of the bathroom which was smelling from the door of the room. Secondly the hard bed and the noise of the roof top bar till 2.00 at morning, couldn't let us sleep well. Thirdly the breakfast was OK but with small variety of things and the room which was the breakfast had damages at the roof. All these showed a non 4 star hotel they supposed they are, together with the price per night which was too high for the offering. Too disappointing, never satay in this hotel again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Needs help
desc: Hotel was quite exceptional back in the mid 90s, however hotel needs a serious update. Buffet was average, rooms dated and service was so so. Location is the only saving grace of the hotel. Will most likely stay at a location on orchard road next time.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Family holiday
desc: Great rooms, large and cool considering it was 35 degrees outside, Staff very helpful and concierge was very helpful with helping us to store our bags for the day and arranging a taxi to airport We had a view of the flowers on the bay and the science museum which was awe inspiring Close to the bay and walking distance to most city centre attractions including Raffles Is my choice of accomadation when in Singapore

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Pleasant surprise.
desc: The Peninsula Excelsior was a pleasant surprise to us when we arrived. We were booked into the Excelsior side...the Peninsular is connected via the lobby, so make sure you get into the right lift. The room card wont work in the wrong lift, at least from the lobby level. What was good was it was very central to all the things we needed to access. The Big Bus tour stop was across the road, then by chance we realised the Big Bus terminal was a short diagonal walk past the WWII Civilian memorial. It is also a short walk to Boat and Clark Quay, Chinatown, Raffles, Canning Hill, Singapore Museum. Along the way are malls and food shops as you choose, and a nice little coffee shop on North Bridge Rd (past Starbucks) before the Elgin Bridge. The amenities were clean, though the rooms

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average
desc: Average hotel but value for money, Its old and not well maintained. Reception staff never smile. Would not go again. For the price its ok. Location is fine next a very nice mall. Taxi easy to get and airport is 20 mins away.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The worst service ever!!!!
desc: The staff is so arrogant when you ask anything!! We wanted to sit on an area while having breakfast where the air conditioning wasn’t that strong and all we ever received were bad faces from the staff and they prohibited us to sit in some tables because that area was “still closed”. The food was terrible as well, cold, too salty, the tea looked like pure water, the toaster didn’t work... overall it was such a bad experience. The only good thing was the views to the marina bay from our room.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: great location in City centre
desc: We stayed here for 5 nights on the 21st floor. The staff are helpful and friendly. There are 2 pools you have access to. The bed we had was very hard but they placed a full size pillow mattress down which made the bed much softer to sleep in. The buffet breakfast was very good with a large variety of Asian and European foods. A large selection of hot and cold dishes as well as pastries. The shower was good but it was a little awkward to get the water to be at the right temperature before you stepped under it. A great start to the day. The MRT (train) station is an easy 50 metres away and transport is so simple to use. The Funan shopping centre is 20 metres from the front door and has eating and shops as well as a 7/11 store. Go to Suntec City, about 800 metres walking distance,

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great stay
desc: I booked this hotel via Singapore stop over holiday unfortunately rooms allocated for this holiday don’t have great views and don’t allow access to the Sky lounge which was disappointing. However, I would like to thank Aleena who was a wonderful receptionist she helped us upgrade. The extra money was well worth it to us to have a magnificent view of Singapore and access to the Sky lounge. The hotel was in a great location 5 minute walk from City Hall Station easy walk to Clark Quay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Hotel exceeded my expectations
desc: Hotel is located conveniently in downtown Singapore and nearest MRT (subway) station is nearby. I stayed at newer Excelsior tower at a room which had excellent views over Singapore. Pretty long wait to get checked-in in the afternoon - more staff required? Room itself was of much better quality than I was expecting for a hotel of this age. Decent quality breakfast offered with some variety. I truly suggest to make a pit-stop at Sky Lounge at 22nd floor - it offers stunning views over Singapore harbour area.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average service
desc: The location is well located and room is comfortable. However I didn’t have good experience with their services. The front end counter staff are not friendly. The TV broke down twice and I had to call multiple times before they attended to our request.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: My Home in Singapore
desc: Most of the staff are very warm and kind. Particularly Ariane excellent Manager and all the Skylounge staff are very kind that’s why I always enjoy my breakfast. They know preferences and every time I come back they always greets me. Farah at Yaxiya always taking care of me. All the Skylounge are very good Vivian Liying Belle Sera ,Yuna and new staff Shanti. I recommend this hotel to try. My booking is under Their sales manager.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A Hiccough at the Beginning!
desc: Booked into this hotel by an angent as part of a package trip to Singapore and the Maldives. On check with friends we were given room keys to adjoining rooms in the Excelsior Tower. Our friends entered their room but when I opened our door I was facing a very suprised female guest who had been given the same room and just been settling in! Needless to say after apologies I went straight to the hotel reception to express my dismay. No manager on duty but the young lady who dealt with my complaint could not have been more apologetic or helpful. Eventually our friends and my wife and I were given new rooms on a high floor in the Peninsular Tower. Great stay from there on in with later check-out before we had to head to Changi Airport for our flight to the Maldives. Included

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Ageing tourist hotel
desc: We booked through Singapore Airlines, we thought the rates were reasonable, but on arrival and staying in the room allocated, we thought otherwise. This tourist hotel has an overall tired look, the check in staff, not very friendly and to a point, officious. Our room had carpets that needed a good cleaning, the bed was comfortable, the linen clean, however, the bathroom had seen better days. Position of the hotel is good, one can walk to most places of interest like the museum, art gallery, Chinatown etc. Wouldn't stay here again though and would book independently like we did before on our last visit to this amazing city.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Wasn't too impressed
desc: We arrived at the hotel an hour before check in and they did not let us get an early check in. They told us we were upgraded however the room was much worst than expected. We did not feel like we were upgraded at all as we were in the older tower with old rooms/bathrooms. Not sure if the hotel was worth the price. On a more positive note, the concierge were helpful and friendly and the location is very convenient both for walking downtown and reaching the metro.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Hotel With Awesome Ppl
desc: Went there in Nov 2019. The team did a great job in surprising my daughter as she had graduated from her kindergarten. She loves it so much & enjoyed herself as much as we do. Then, we went there again in Dec 2019 (X'mas Eve). And again, the team did a marvelous job in surprising all of us. The deco is so nice. The team took alot of effort in surprising us especially Ms Ariane & AC. We SURELY & DEFINITELY be back again for our future staycations with Peninsula. Great view on Sky Lounge LVL 22 & an awesome team (Ms Ariane, AC, Vivian). Thanks for making us your family at Peninsula 😍.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The word 'Rude' is also put to shame by the receptionist
desc: What is the first thing we look forward to once we enter into a hotel - Smooth check-in. Keep aside smooth check-in but if you are faced with RUDE (and may be overworked) staff calling you 'selfish' and showering with all expletives just because you have placed a request? Shocking is the word. Let me briefly explain the check-in issue we faced. The check in time at the hotel was 2pm. We checked in at around 9.30am. Since this is the first time I was travelling with my senior parent and small kid, I checked-in at the reception and when I conveyed the booking name the staff bluntly told - There is no booking in your name. I was shocked as the entire trip was planned through an agent. Keeping my cool I asked what other information you will need to re-confirm whether the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Peninsular Excelsior
desc: We wasted a day waiting for safety deep box to be ..thefixednà told it "couldn't be until tomorrow" then tired & stressed our bedlight wouldn't turn off..more waiting and ineficiency. $265 pn not the advertised price i booked, anqd twin beds instead of 1 as pmpromised.. so they pushed them together still made as singles. Would never stay here again and warn anyone not to as well.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: The location was good, walking distance to the marina which is spectacular at night. The open top bus tour stop is just round the corner and walking distance to Raffles. The room was fine apart from there was insufficient space for 2 of us to hang our clothes, very small 'wardrobe'. The water in a morning for a shower was cold, although in the afternoon it was very hot, I had to wash my hair in a cold shower which was not pleasant. We reported the cold water on the first day but it did not improve.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Bit old, but better than expected...
desc: Was quite worried before arrival as I’d read multiple negative reviews about the hotel. Turns out, all was fine during my 4-night stay. Booked a premier room, got upgraded to a top-floor executive club room on arrival — Leny was very helpful on check-in; thank you. On entering the room, it felt rather old-school. Clean and tidy nonetheless. Mattress was comfortable, at least to me. Housekeeping, though quick in answering my requests, needs standardisation: one day there were two flannels, other days there were none; different numbers of bottles of shampoo on different days; one pair of slippers one day and two pairs the other day etc. Breakfast was alright. The omelette station was good. Coffee was very weak; the instant coffee provided in the room was more drinkable, to be

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Perfect located for walking in the city of Singapore
desc: The hotel is in center of the city. Walking distance to many things you have to see. Big windows in the room with beautiful view. Top floor have this nice bar and restaurant with the best sight over The Singapore Flyers and Marina by Sands hotel and the watershow every evening.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Bed comfort
desc: This hotel had a great location, staff friendly, etc. Everything you would expect from a hotel with it's current ratings. However, a word of advise for those who bed comfort is important. Their beds (stayed twice, two different rooms) are HARD - and I'm not exaggerating. I think a campers foam mattress would be softer. If it wasn't for disturbing my husband who was already asleep (he also concurs on this issue), I would have shifted to the window seat! As it was I propped all the spare pillows around my body. I did sleep but had sore hips and back the next day, which I was able to walk off thankfully. I don't know if all their mattresses are the same, but maybe you could make enquiries if this could be an issue for you.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 1 night stopover
desc: Stayed here for 1 night through Singapore airlines. The receptionist tried to say our check out was 4pm however we had paid extra for 6pm late check out, when she corrected it she made us feel like she was doing us a favour. We saw some dirty sweaty men in the lift who went straight into the swimming pool,is no-one making sure people are showering before they go in? Room 1023 excelsior tower, the bathroom grouting and sealant in the shower is disgusting, and the bathroom is very small. The carpet in the room needs a good hoovering. The ceiling vents in the corridors outside the lifts are covered in mould, it is worrying when you are breathing in the air. We took photos and showed them to management/receptionist but she didn't seem interested. We will be contacting singapore

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: 3 days in Singapore
desc: Crazy entry lobby, not big enough Only 3 lifts servicing over 20 floors, totally inadequate for the amount of people. A small bar tucked away in the corner of the lobby, not everyone has access to the sky lounge. Our room was on the 18th floor it had been recently refurbished badly, paint drops cracked and chipped tiles , the shower fluctuated between red hot and cold it’s a good job you had to run around to get wet as you would get scalded if there was any pressure. On a positive note it is reasonably well placed.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Dust, small, old
desc: The staff were not very helpful, the upgraded room given to us is small, worn out, dark and with dusty carpet. Wont be able to sleep due to allergic to dusty carpet, but too tired to move to other hotels.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: It was hell on earth, ruined our new year holiday
desc: 1- The lobby is level 5 and there was only 2 small lifts - you needed to wait for a lifetime to get out of the hotel or go to breakfast 2- The rooms were extremely small, so if you had a child with you, it would feel like we were on top of each others at all time 3- The wardrobe was so small, we could not even put one thing in it 4- The bathrobes were see through and stained 5- The Bed was so hard, forget getting a good night sleep on it 6- The room blinds does not close properly, so forget it if you wanted to sleep past 7am 7- The bathroom was so dirty, we demanded that it needed to be re-cleaned so we can actually use it and the bath curtain stunk 8- The flour we were at (15th flour) it stunk of smoking, and people just having a jolly good time our of their rooms 9- We

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but ...
desc: We stayed at the hotel as part of a Singapore Air stopover package arriving on the morning of New Year’s Eve. The day may have had a bearing on the service which was almost nonexistent. There was very clearly no chance of getting into our room a moment before the official 2pm but the hotel did take our luggage. When we finally got into the small room it was old and more tired than us! The sheets and bathroom were generally clean but that was about as good as it got. The air conditioning had two working settings, freezing or off. Most definitely would not recommend staying here.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel
desc: Initially after reading some comments about this hotel, I was quite concerned. After staying for a night during the new year I really think it was great. It was new year eve and the lobby was crowded. The manager at the lift lobby never fail to put on a smile on his face. The front desk staff, Ella, was friendly and accommodating too. Breakfast has quite a variety. Only the house keeping was abit slow. We have requested an extra towel during check-in. After we came back from our dinner, the towel was not there yet. Nevertheless, its a great hotel and I hope to come back again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: We arrived at the hotel before 11AM - check in time 2:00pm. Left our luggage with the concierge on the street level went to check in on level 4. Very polite employee - wanted to now what kind of beds - room we would like told them, clerk went to another desk, came back and told us they had a room available and checked us in. We went to our room and five minutes later our luggage arrived. Good sized room - great view. Good choice of restaurants.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Perfect location
desc: I am always mindful of the price of the hotel when writing a review and in view of this find that this hotel surpassed expectations. It is literally on the main square within walking distance of Raffles etc, 1 minute from the subway and next to a great food centre, where one could find ample choice of the freshly prepared delicacies Singapore is famous from. Lovely rooms, lovely swimming pool, very good value.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Check in sucks
desc: Check in absolutely sucks. Online says check-in after 2pm. Was told to come back at 2.30pm. Queued for 20 mins only to be told that room MAYBE available after 3pm and I have to re-queue again. Wasted good hours of new year's eve queuing. Fantastic.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Total shambles
desc: Booked this hotel in early October for a one night stopover for a family of four (kids 9 and 11) en route to a relocation to Australia. We requested an additional bed in the room and an early check-in as our flight arrived at 7am. We received confirmation that the extra bed could be provided. Early check in was subject to availability. We are still sitting in the lobby way past the official 2pm check in time with no room on the verge of requesting a refund. As it is, the hotel is very grubby, tired and run down. Loads of other guests who arrived after us got rooms straight away, including those with families. Truly awful service.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Please don’t bother !
desc: The hotel is a 2 star not a 4 it is dirty the furniture is tired and grubby the floors are dirty and staff are just plain rude , and then just pretend to not understand English !! To say singapore is amazing this hotel is far from it . Take a warning and book elsewhere there are some lovely hotel , we are now going to find a better one just don’t want to stay in dirt

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Peninsula hotel Singapore
desc: Please don’t bother booking this hotel it’s at best a 2 star nit 4 the furniture is grubby the lobby is dirty and the staff. Are just plain rude .... they could not care left if you are staying or not the hole hotel is just one big disappointment and dirty . So please in a beautiful place like Singapore please don’t book here try somewhere clean !!! The photo z are nothing like what it is either, I asked for decafinated coffee or tea as my tablets I have to take won’t allow me to have caffeine but the whole hotel doesn’t have them ! So no drinks for me !!! They won’t 30 pounds for a below average breakfast well I’m sorry but that’s over the top . Me and my partner stay all over the world and not always in 4&5 star but I know 2 when I see it sorry but that’s what it is and with

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Depressing in all ways
desc: The only good news about the Peninsula Excelsior is that it is an interesting part of Singapore. However, that is the end of the good news. The ground floor entrance is small and the two elevators are inadequate for the size of the hotel. Take the lift up a few floors to the lobby which reminded me of an airport... large with no atmosphere. My room was on the executive floor and had been recently renovated (I guess). The TV was broken and required 2 visits by the hotel engineer; there were no washclothes and I had to call housekeeping for them.... at 11:30 in the evening after a long flight, I didn't need this. The next morning I found the hairdryer didn't work so I called housekeeping and asked for a hairdryer. Nothing. I called again, nothing. 45 minutes elapsed and,

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Poor Facilities
desc: I stayed in the hotel last week and it was far from my expectation. I feel very cramped in the room. The worst thing was the complimentary Wi-Fi was suck. I called the operator and the phone was not connected and I realized that it only worked with the speaker phone on. I talked to the operator and they directed me to the front desk. The front desk then redirected me to the Operator for assistance. Finally, they asked me to go down to the lobby to get it fix instead of sending someone to my room. I spent more than half an hour just to make the WI-FI connection work. Then I sat down and turned on the beat-up TV to watch the news! Fine! It got no signal at all. I asked attendant to come and repaired it for me. He fixed it but it stopped working right after he stepped out of the

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Vacation with my Sissy and the Kiddos!!! R&R to the fullest!
desc: The hotel lobby is quite confusing as you have to take the lift first before you get there. We arrived about half past twelve but didn't get a chance to have early check-in. Upon waiting, we enjoyed the free refreshments at the lobby quenching our thirst from the hot weather of SG. We have loads of luggages plus stroller so we asked for a bellboy but we were escorted by a front officer instead. He's quite confused that he took us to the wrong lift before we got to our assigned room. He was very apologetic though and he was talking to us suggesting where to go and where to eat nearby. Our room was great with a view of skyscrapers but the wifi is very slow which is so annoying. Bathroom is superb we got a nice tub and of course hair dryer is a must! :) We went for a swim at

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Breakfast choice
desc: A lovely clean spacious room, comfortable bed. No problems. A huge choice of breakfast food, catering to all tastes and cultures. Very happy with my stay there, all were courteous and extremely helpfu.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Loved L5
desc: Smallish rooms. But location is nice as walk to Clarke Quay and also to the Singapore Museum we found good. Mass Transit Railway at City Hall is close by. They also have transfers to and from the Airport. Level 5 is the nucleus of this hotel. Loved Level 5. The problem is that noise insulation is non existent. Did not have good night's sleep.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Old Hotel but excellent location
desc: My partner checked in to the hotel and we stayed there for about 3 nights. The first room we were in , we couldn't sleep at night. The room was tiny but still bearable but the toilet was big. The bed was very uncomfortable with every movement felt whenever the other person moved even an inch. Airconditioning was either blowing too cold or not cold enough throughout the whole night, was loud as well so both of us could hardly catch a wink. To top it off, TV was not working though we called 3 times for an engineer to come fix it. They only come end day and said cannot fix,said will come back tomorrow to try again. Really? We called for a change of room the next day and we moved to a bigger room but very tiny bathroom. Can't have both of both worlds when the room comes at a very

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Convenient location and mostly comfortable stay
desc: I was looking for a central base in Singapore so that I could check out lots of different sights by the bay and further afield They don't come any more central than this one. It was so handy for being able to take the MRT from City Hall station. If you're like me and a hotel is basically just a place to sleep so that you can explore by day, this place is superb and has a really affordable price tag. A couple of small problems arose during the stay, and all were quickly rectified by attentive staff. What did disappoint me was the single bed. When you pay for a hotel for a solo stay, you always dream of a nice large bed to spread out and sleep comfortably. Unfortunately, the single bed just didn't quite hit the mark. Staff placed two single beds together, but the bedding was still

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Experience, Best Location
desc: The hotel is located in the center of the city. We would like to compliment the Sky Lounge team especially Vivian and Vasanthi for their service and kindness. The Sky Club is located on the 22nd floor with beautiful view of the city and very quiet atmosphere.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location but needs rennovation
desc: Great location but room is rundown and old. Stains on the wallpaper and some furniture. Elevators took forever. At one point the queue started from outside the lobby. Breakfast was decent. Time for some rennovation.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: I never be so disappointed
desc: The room is tight, old and ....the most disappointed is.....dirty!! The desk and sofa are dirty, the bed is very wet and the bathroom seems never be cleaned. It ruined my holiday. I like this garden city but I will never choose this hotel. 4 star hotel? Are uou kidding me?

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Group
desc: Excellent location, breakfast variety, helpful staff, rooms are good and clean but needs renovation, very good pools, wifi, safety box, check in process was very smooth, view from the 22nd floor was marvelous

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Celebrate a amazing Birthday @ Peninsula Excelsior Hotel
desc: Our stay at Peninsula Excelsior Hotel Singapore was above and beyond our expectations..I want to say thank you to Vivian and Vasanthi to take the time and bring personally celebrated my birthday with a amazing presentation of a slice of cake to my room. Highly recommend Peninsula Excelsoir Hotel. Must mention the view is breath taken..just love it❤️

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent hotel and staff
desc: Moved to this hotel after disappointing stay elsewhere. Booked a club room and was given a room on the 22nd floor next to the club lounge. The reception staff were efficient and helpful. The room was spacious and had a large window with a view of The Marina Bay hotel. Many thanks to the sky lounge team, Ariane, Vivian, Liying, Vasanthi and Mahrane who made by birthday an unforgettable experience. If I return to Singapore I will certainly stay here again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: At last arrived tired weary and warn
desc: We arrived after 2 days travelling due to storms in UK After getting our rooms showering putting on lips we staggered to eat something Down to the restaurant in a ‘mind of it’s own lift’ we reached the restaurant where we came back to life!! Meal beautiful ...squash soup and Chocolate lava with ice cream Mmmmmmmmmm The service was good ,the waiters full of humour and the surroundings very pleasant Then up to 27 th floor to see a magnificent view of Singapore at night...what a feast for the eyes...lights every where But the rain poured down so we hastily retreated from balcony and into bed sleeping 13 hours..phew we are human today

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: money stolen from room. unresolved by hotel. disappointing end to holiday.
desc: most disappointing was that money was stolen from the hotel room and the staff did not report the follow up until checked with the reception staff. around S$200 was taken from the bag left in the room while the guest went out. the hotel staff explained that after investigation only the cleaning staff & hotel guest entered the room. so who took the money? the response to simply claim from insurance is unsatisfactory. this means the hotel staff know that there is no way hotel guests can prove the money was stolen by staff so they can continue stealing without any penalty by the law. this is terrible. would not recommend this hotel to anybody else. the room size and toilet etc is a standard hotel, aircon is very cold in the room and the thermostat seems to be not working or

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice, but little dated hotel, on an excellent location !
desc: Having read some of previous comments I thought even before I entered the hotel that it would be terrible.. And yes my first "deluxe" room made all my worries come true :(.. The room was very small, the bed hard and I looked as if I saw stains everywhere.. Sio I went to the front-office and Mr. Khairi took a good look in his available deluxe rooms and was able to give me smooth transfer to a deluxe room at the front-side of the hotel and this room was excellent! beautifull look at the Marina.. This made my 4 day stay very pleasurable and I am looking forward to return to this overall a little bit dated hotel.. time for an overall overhaul of the hotel.. :)

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Craft Wine & Bistro
desc: I'm writing you this review for the wonderful service experience me and my friend had with Farah from Craft bistro on 29 Jan 2020. We were wandering at the lobby area deciding where to settle our dinner. Farah was alert and and spotted us. She was very patience in answering all our queries. During our dining, she was very attentive to us and her warmth hospitality made us feel very welcomed. As it was raining heavily and we couldn't get to outdoor for our puff, we approached Farah for the nearest indoor smoking area.  She was quick to act upon our request and allowed us to use the club house balcony which was meant for hotel’s guest upon checking with the club manager.  We were impressed by Farah’s excellent customer service who went the extra miles for us.  Research has

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Hotel location and staff
desc: Great location from all the Area, that's why it has City Hall MRT, Friendly and helpful staff make your trip worthwhile at reception like (lifeng) . Hotel is bit old, but if can be renovated than, will be key prime property in Singapore. If you happens to be lucky like me to get the MBS view, than you have beautiful view from your room. Staff is always helpful to understand what exactly needed, they will take extra step to make it happen. I happens got offer to club floor and was delighted by happy faced girl Vasanthi providing the needed items in the room (if not available).

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Loved it!
desc: My partner & I stayed here for our 3 night stopover on the way home to Australia after a tour of Vietnam. From the moment we arrived at the check-in counter we felt valued. I'd left my phone on the airport shuttle but they very quickly contacted the shuttle company & I was reunited with my phone within the hour. As an Elite Member, our Deluxe room that we'd paid for was upgraded to an Executive room. It was perfect for us. It wasn't the biggest room, but it was big enough for us. The bathroom was quite spacious, with separate bath & shower. The real feature of the room though was the view. Our window overlooked the National Gallery & we had spectaular, picture-perfect uninterrupted views of the Marina Bay Sands complex, Theatres on the Bay, the Singapore Flyer & the city

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: Hotel is in a good location. Food court very near. Recommend that guest get access to the Sky Lounge. Nice pool. Reception is on the first floor but this presents no problem. Thank you to Assistant Duty Manager, Melvin, for ensure our stay was pleasant.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location
desc: Stayed here for two nights , we have stayed here previously years back and thought our room was tired looking it was quite small but had everything you needed . The staff were helpful even whilst going through the covid 19 crisis. The location is good across the road from the metro station and an easy walk to Clarke quay , sun city and a 25 minute walk to gardens on the bay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Was not impressed
desc: I hate leaving bad reviews, but I really was disappointed about this hotel given the cost. The location is good as it is centrally located and close to metro and other major attractions, but the rooms are not impressive. The bed was comfortable. The biggest mistake we made was prepaying for the breakfast buffet. This needs a huge improvement. The food was no better than a Marriott Courtyard hotel. It was pretty obvious the fruit was canned fruit. I highly suggest to save your money and go to one of the many places near the hotel. I also felt like I was being forced to eat at the sky lounge as we were "given access". The view is spectacular, but it's really "access" to the restaurant where everything is overpriced.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location!
desc: Situated just a stone throw away from clark quay and the Marina, the best thing about the hotel is its location. The view from the top of the hotel is just amazing and a thing to look out for. The room was spacious and neatly made but could need some refinement. Would definitely recommend for the location.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: WARNING - AWFUL HOTEL-Poor customer service!
desc: Saw the review title from the previous review from other guest and just copy paste and add poor customer service. Normally I do not give bad review unless its really bad. Well, it was not me to choose this hotel willingly but was force to stay here. Anyway just wanted to say that the customer service, helpdesk,even the manager on call is not up to expectation. Helpdesk did not check before answering my question, manager on call did not direct my concern and issue correctly but raise her voice to me and force me to made the laundry payment unwillingly. Poor customer service!!!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great services
desc: Awesome services and a excellent compliment to staff Ella. She is very helpful and provide fantastic services. Overall good hotel to stay and very helpful. Should visit again to this hotel, most convenient place to stay.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Quarrantine Period from 13th May to 25th May
desc: Receptionist Vivian , Shanti & Fatin is very professional and would try their best to accomodate to my needs. Everytime when my grab food or Food Panda arrives , i will call the reception counter to let them know that my food has arrive. Sometimes i will need to split the food into rooms as i couldnt get out of the premises . They will take down the room no and will inform the conceirge team to seperate it and send it to the individual rooms . Thank you for the service :-) . As well as Operator Nini & MiMi . Thank you all for the professional services .

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Quarantine Experience!
desc: Me and my mum served our quarantine at Peninsula Hotel. A big shout out to the team - Yana who handled the situation well, team who answered our calls when we pressed "0", and those who helped to deliver stuff to our room and answer all our queries all the time! Every staff that I met was very friendly and helpful :) Had a great experience!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice place
desc: We stayed for 3 days. I liked the place. A little bit run down in places but all in all a very nice place. Gym is good. Pools are good. You definitely get the feel it’s past it’s best days and probably the rebuild after the pandemic is still happening. But the place is so close to 5 star. The hotel is built on top of an older shopping centre which is below ground. Opposite a shopping centre for the Burmese apparently so that interesting. The hotel is right next door to a flash shopping centre. About 2 blocks for the river eating district. Walking distance to China town and little India or $7 by taxi. I loved the place. Room was clean and large. Bathrooms renovated. The bed is huge. Bigger than our King size in Australia. The beds very firm. Firmer than we’re used to be we slept

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location and friendly staff
desc: My second time staying at this hotel. It’s not a 5 star luxury hotel but it can’t be beat for location and price in my opinion. Waking distance to Clarke and Boat Quays. Close to City Hall MRT station. One block from the National Gallery. Friendly staff who went out of their way to ensure our anniversary was special. I could only find one fault and that is the shower not maintaining consistent temp. Other than that minor inconvenience our stay was perfect.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great stay but 1 problem
desc: The staff are friendly and make sure that our needs are met. The room we got had the view towards the float at marina so we could the performance both live and on TV. The problem is the food. I ate at sky lounge. There weren’t that many choices, only bread fruits, salad and 5 trays of other food most of which were frozen food. There were only 2 choices of cold drinks which were freshly made juices.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great stay !
desc: I stay in this hotel from 14- 17 August and definitely is great stay ! My room was with view of the marina absolutely super ! The hotel have great location walking to everything and very good price like for Singapore ! Room was well furnish with all the amenities ! It is great to stay in Peninsula hotel with great location and good price ! I know it is difficult time for hospitality and all hotels trying to moving on even experience shortage of staff ! Peninsula staff was very friendly helpful especially thank you to reception lady’s who check me in ! absolutely amazing defiantly will comeback and recommend to others thank you

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Beautiful Proposal!
desc: I did my wedding proposal here - The staff were super helpful and supportive! They had great initiative and responded to my requests swiftly and efficiently. The room is super comfy too! Best hotel stay ever. 10/10 will come again!! Very very good!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel in perfect location with amazing staff!
desc: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of a couple of months of travelling. The location is right in the centre of the action, close to the shops, restaurants and bars. My room was amazingly well equipped with a beautiful view over the city and Marina Bay. The two pools are beautiful and I loved the gym. The staff were incredibly professional and friendly which absolutely made the trip for me. Big shout out to Anne, the Assistant Manager, who was incredibly accommodating, went the extra mile to make sure I had a great stay, gave me lots of amazing advice on places to visit and even helped with running routes!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: I'd stay here again
desc: Great location near City Hall subway and amazing Raffles City Mall, one of the best in town. Easy MRT access to Sentosa and fantastic food options. Good pool, laundry and street bar. Our room is was a decent size, small bathroom but pretty good.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Memory honeymoon The Peninsula Singapore( 25 years back)
desc: I'd a happy memory honeymoon The Peninsula hotel Singapore on board duty airhostess senior /IfS RA Sahansila newly married couple along with my cabin crew team captains Intercontinental treatment. We'd all amenities sweet memory well trained hotel staff mostly chinese boys and ladies well served happy treatment behaviours begun from receptions.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Basic ! but good location
desc: This hotel is very basic not new ! but large rooms ! Hotels in Singapore are overpriced ! If this hotel price is below $200 I will take if above then NO ! The bathrooms in hotel rooms need good cleaning ! the Bathroom floor looks like was not clean for long time ! bathroom tiles and dust ! otherwise I had what i need ! I would not pay for the hotel more than $170 a night ! I don’t care about haw new or haw great the furniture are ? for me number one is cleanness !

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very central for almost everything
desc: We stated here many years ago in the Peninsula Tower and returned a week ago hoping for similar experience but with the development of Marina Bay we were allocated the Excelsior Tower where the view was the city fire station and surrounds. No complaints of the view but the noise every night from the pa system and alarm bells t tge station made for very poor sleep quality. Everything else was really good and housekeeping was amazing . Cannot say we would think of staying here again due to the sleep disruption.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not Returned to Full Service Since Pandemic
desc: Couldn't fault the room, modern, bathroom renovated, and on a quiet lower floor. Staff went out of their way to be helpful. Unfortunately there is no tour desk. There are no newspapers or room service menu. This has to be found on the TV. Also disappointingly the best pool was closed for maintenance though it didn't appear to be worked on. If you stay here expecting it to be like before the pandemic you're in for a shock.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Worst hotel in Singapore
desc: If I could give a zero I would. Worst hotel in Singapore, the pictures used in their advertising do not meet the reality of the rooms. Check in time is 1400hrs but even if you show up 3.5hrs after the time set by the hotel your rooms won't be ready and when you do receive the rooms they won't have any amenties set up in them. So be prepared to go back and forth for about 2hrs after you check in to get the bare basics. The staff have no ability to help, any thing that happens just gets escalated around individuals who have no ability to do anything, their plan is to take you in circles untill you get tired and just accept the crap they're giving you. Don't stay here, it's old, it smells old, everyone here is effectively useless, they use misleading photos to get you to

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: DO NOT STAY HERE - DO NOT BE FOOLED BY THE PICTURES OR WEBSITE
desc: In my honest opinion, this hotel is miles off the mark. The 3.5 rating on Trip Advisor is extremely generous to say the least. The hotel is very tired across the board from the entrance to rooms, toilets and it's in need of a complete refurb. We had to move rooms twice in 8 days due to noisy neighbours, a window that you could not see out of as the exterior coating had failed and it was virtually opaque, noisy elevator electric motors on the top floor directly above the room and rooms being used by prostitution gangs. The windows are also very poor at keeping out the noise from the city, so be prepared for a poor sleep. Avoid at all cost, shocking for Singapore city centre, worst place I've stayed in a long time and couldn't wait to leave.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good location, but Peninsula Tower is a bit old
desc: Hotel with good location. Taxi stop right outside the lobby, but not very easy to get a taxi during rush hours anyway. The rooms in Peninsula Tower is a bit old and shabby. Some also smells of the humidity. Breakfast is good.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent choice for a city break
desc: Hotel is in an excellent location, close to the MRT and shopping and Raffles. We had a lovely stay here and breakfast was included, good choice of food and drink and prepared freshly. The room was nice and the bed comfortable, toiletries included in the room were of good quality. Staff were pleasant and helpful and there is currency exchange available at reception.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Central district. yes. Hotel for me no.
desc: Rooms are old. They have to renovate. I just gave 2 Points because the employees on the front desk are nice. Would I recommend this hotel to any person? No! For this price range they have to renovate and provide room service. It’s feel like a Appartement building with check in counter. Not like a 4 Star hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Thank you To hotel peninsula
desc: It was really nice to stay here and awesome few of marina bay from my room . It’s makes alive n super excited . Terrace view is so so amazing and Anne is there on terrace lounge to make your evening so memorable. I would like to come again with same room when I get the chance. Great keep it Anne n all hotel staff. Cheers Regards Jaspal

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Be Aware
desc: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights last month. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are very good. My room was on the 9th floor of the Excelsior Tower and each night from approximately 11.00pm until exactly 3.00am the next morning I had the continual sound (bass only) of music. On investigation I found that it was coming from a disco on the 2nd floor, 7 floors below me. I would hate to think what the noise was like in the rooms on the floors, or for that fact, above me. I suggest if you stay at this hotel you ask for a room in the Peninsula Tower as it may not have the same problem.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Refurbished Hotel with a Vintage Charm
desc: If you enjoy hotels built in the 70s to 80s, you will enjoy the somewhat vintage charm of this hotel, convenienetly situated in the bustling City Hall district. We spent a night there as we were going to catch a musical at the Marina Bay Sands Theatre. We were pleasantly delighted to have been upgraded to a next tier where we were able to get a room facing St Andrews Cathedral as well as the bay. The convenience of the mall is a very big pro, especially when its walking distance from the train station and right next door to Funan Mall. The room was clean and surprisingly spacious. The king sized bed was comfortable and felt plush. We had a slight issue with the room being a smoking room but the view made it all worth it. Sadly, it was only after the stay that I learnt that

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very good central hotel
desc: We stayed here 4 nights en route to Thailand. A very enjoyable stay, room very clean and comfortable. Very helpful door staff and so central to all this clean and wonderful city. Would recommend this hotel

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great ambience and staff
desc: Been a regular staycationer, we chose this hotel primarily because of its good location to many food areas and shopping areas nearby. Yes the hotel had a old school charm but is well maintained. Rooms are good. But above all else, what can destroy a festive mood are the presence of disgruntled front desk staff. The staff you have at the concierge like Ms Lifeng, are reasons why you have regulars like me coming back. Her ever so bubbly and pleasant disposition are a rare find these days. I'm sure you are very proud to have staff lime them working. Kudos and keep it up Excelsiors!!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: For Singapore price benchmark it was ok
desc: Stayed here for one night. Arrived at 7am and was told to wait till at least 9 or 11am. Been to the counter at 0830am and was told to leave, but when I said that I am here for 24 hrs then they gave me a room. Bed was awesome but room was old, still clean. Shower very small, can't even open the doors after taking the shower. Paid 120usd, which is ok for Singapore benchmark. Close to MRT city hall

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Business Trip to Singapore
desc: - The location is great. - The rooms are well maintained and serviced - The view of some rooms is the Marina Bay which I was lucky to have :) - Special thanks to Anne Leyran - Guest Experience Manager who was very helpful and supportive through our whole stay in the hotel

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: If you want to be threaten by staff, this hotel is for you
desc: Aside from the pretty good location and one nice senior female staff who accommodated us upon check-in, everything was a disaster. First, all the wooden furniture/interiors are chipped and cleanliness is obviously not their priority. Just how dirty a tea spoon could be? And not all staff wear mask, even a maintenance that fix our tv didn't wear mask when entering our room. The worst thing was the staff. On first day, we asked for a nail clipper and scissor and the front desk said they could only provide the scissor so we borrowed that. A male staff who delivered the scissor shoved the sharp object pointing at us while in open position. Imagine opening the door to a man holding a scissor like he is ready to cut your finger. And whenever we asked for something, we have to call

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, good view
desc: Centrally located, ask for room with the view though its in a smoking zone. Front desk staff took too much time for checkin and were very slow. However, they were courteous and friendly. Hotel is a very old property and requires upkeep. Decent breakfast options. Quite pricy as well.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Unable to use the laundry service and smells of cigarets in the rooms
desc: I've stayed here approximately for a month and so far it has been a moderatly bad experience. There is no coinwash nearby and when you go for the reception, the arrogant staff will tell you a random time it might be avaliable, however if you are not at your room at the excact time they call you, you will have to wait for days again. For a four-star hotel, it is one of the worst service experiences I've ever encountered so far. Besides that, the room smells of smoke so if you're a non-smoker i recomend that you book somehwere else, as there are plenty of nicer opportunities than this outdated hotel in Singapore.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Average with scatterings of Tired
desc: Having visited this hotel a number of times in the past, the ability to see that this facility has suffered the effects of the Covid lockdown in NOTICABLE and SAD. The staff continue to deliver excellent service, however, maintains of the rooms on the Excelsior side appear to be non-existent. Our bed - had a broken leg, causing the head portion to dip downwards. The shower - had many issues such as the hot water tap never really got HOT (we reported this issue and yet nothing changed in the 5 days that we stayed here). The bathroom facility was VERY pokey! and as for the hairdryer - overheats within 45 seconds (yes, I timed it), and would take roughly 5 minutes to cool down and work for another 45 seconds. The room itself is an acceptable size, just requires a little T L

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Choose room 1818
desc: My first time stay here. This is old hotel bul well maintained. Ask for room 1818 like i did and you'll get the best view of MBS.. Price is reasonable, location just beside Funan Mall and bear City Hall MRT. Breakfast is tasteless unfortunately :( But overall welldone!!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Nice hotel, conveniently located, spacious room
desc: The hotel is nice and convenient to get to from the airport by taxi. First impression was a bit underwhelmed as the entrance on the lower ground floor has just got a sign of the hotel name and a few sofas. As you enter, the concierge greeted us warmly and directed up up the lift to the lobby on an upper floor where you check in. As you exit the lift, the lobby area is spacious. Check in was friendly and quick. The room is quite spacious. The bathroom is a bit tight. The air conditioning is very good. The bed is firm but comfortable. Wi-Fi is good with fast internet speed 80mb. The hotel is conveniently located with good access to public transport. Overall I found this hotel to be nice and adequate, good value for money and clean. You can say it is a bit tied in places especially

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: You don’t get what you ask for
desc: We booked long ago with request of kingsize bed/non-smoking room. The check-in process took over 1 hour only to be told there are no non-smoking rooms available and only twin beds. The staff didn’t seem to care about our disappointment. Really sucked!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location
desc: Good location, breakfast is not bad, buffet style with reasonable selection. Hotel pool and gym. Lifts get a bit confusing and it has several entrances so tricky at times. I wouldn't eat nearby but get a bus or taxi to little India or Chinatown

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Glad I'm going home tomorrow!
desc: Me and my partner arrived late in the evening (we gave the hotel warning via email and that was received). However, upon arrival the porter seemed reluctant to do anything with our luggage and made us drag it all the way to the 6th floor reception. Which brings me nicely to my next point... the reception is nowhere to be seen on the ground floor. You'd be forgiven for thinking you'd stepped into the lobby of some private apartments. It's not welcoming either. They decided to build the hotel and then put a load of tacky shops selling watches and food right next to it. It's a poor look by anyone's standard and it gives you the impression that they just don't care. Well, they don't care, but that's besides the point by now. Anyway, we're on the 8th floor, so that was another

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The view Hotel was nice
desc: Gud view for the room and there was three single bed very compatible for group friends. Amenities very complete and room size so large. Staff very friendly. I wll come again to stay here. Around the hotel there was central shopping mal and crowded.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not a good atmosphere but good location
desc: Check in took absolutefly ages. I arrived at 3 on the button as did loads of other guests and there simply wasn't enough staff to cope and it took a long time to get checked in. You could feel the staff felt under pressure. My room was adequate with a modern bathroom but again a theme of Singapore seems to be that if you request a double bed you end up with 2 singles pushed together. The carpet was not properly clean which was disappointing so dropped marks for that. It was a good location but the staff are not as friendly as in other hotels I've stayed in and always seemed under pressure. I got to use the gym showers after I checked out as my flight was in the evening which was good. Its a busy hotel with a busy feel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Well
desc: It was adequate, the rather bizarre splitting of the hotel into two towers, means that one is never really sure where you are. The elevators at archaic with a system which randomly selects a floor. Rooms are of their time not bad but suffer from having in bath showers that involve being drenched in cold water to use.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: An enjoyable vacation
desc: First thing, Singapore is crazy expensive. I had a good deal, about US$1000 for six nights with breakfast, that is cheap for a 4* hotel in Singapore. Great location, and do use the cheap MRT (subway, underground train) to get to places. It is excellent and cheap. The hotel is very good. Iiked the breakfast, but the bacon was grilled until it was like a biscuit. Otherwise very good. Lovely large room. Excellent bed, one of the best I have ever slept in. Housekeeping staff are lovely (Vietnamese), front desk staff less so. A good hotel, I will recommend.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Friendly staff and prime location!
desc: This hotel located in the center of the city, within walking distance to the subway station of "City Hall" , 1.4km to Bugis Street, 1.3km to Chinatown and 3 stops away from Orchard Road. There is a big shopping mall "Funan“ in the corner with many restuarants and a big foodcourt in the basement. We loved particularly the local restuarants along South Bridge Rd, must try their spicy crab, Our room is reasonably big and bed was comfy. Front desk staff are so friendly and professional , I must take the chance here to thank Miza, she's the manager of Housekeeping dept, she helped me to find the items I've left behind and sent them back to me, Highly recomended and would definitely stay again.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Truly awful! 😕
desc: This hotel is in desperate need of a renovation (or just knock it down and start again). I’d read some bad reviews, but decided to book a higher room type (Premier Room), in the hope that the reviews were representative of the cheaper room types. Boy, was I mistaken. Stepping out of the elevator, it was very clear that we’d made the wrong decision in booking this hotel. The corridors are dark and dingy, the carpet is worn, and the air inside the hotel is musty and stale. We found our room on the 15th floor of the “Peninsula Tower”. This would seem to be the older of the two towers. Not that we got to see inside the “Excelsior Tower”, but it certainly looked to be newer from the outside. Aside from the view out the window (of Marina Bay Sands, no less), there was nothing

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: View the fireworks performance
desc: Check in on 26 Dec'22 - 01 Jan'23 and stay for 12 room nights. Uncle at the check in counter was helpfull and then ww can stay at the room that view the MBS ... Gratefull because we can see the gorgeous fireworks just from the our room window dan we enjoy the moments.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Hotel excellent location
desc: This hotel is great, firstly it’s in a superb location close to all attractions near Clarke Quay and very close to MRT. All staff are excellent and helpful - very friendly. The gym is good and the two pools are very clean and decent size. Rooms comfortable and decent size with excellent bathrooms and comfy beds! Good price too via Expedia (what more can you ask for)

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel very central
desc: We arrived early on the 11th January got a taxi from the airport. Downstairs entrance then a lift up to the main lobby this was now 0645. I asked if anyway we could check in early and would be willing to pay. The guy said come back at 1000 and we should be able to check you in. We arrived back at 1030 and our room was ready such a great service. We had room 1404 which was a large room with 2 huge windows overlooking the city. The bathroom had large walk in shower and a separate bath. The position is superb 10 minute walk to boat quay and Clarke quay. China town was about 5 minutes more. We walked to little India which was about 20 minutes walk. We also used the metro which was super efficient used it to get to Sentosa. Raffles was literally around the corner and I lots of eating

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Very humid and old- needs an upgrade
desc: The location of the hotel is excellent, staff also very nice. But the hotel is really old and needs an upgrade. Bathroom was not good, small insects in the roof, small size of the bathroom. Had to shower in the bathtub, with a way to low positioned shower head so I had to sit in the tub to wash my hair. And it was not a good smell the smell in the bathroom. It was also the same in the bedroom, the smell of humidity and old room. I tried to put on the air condtition on full power but still there was a very smell in the room of humid environment. I got an upgraded room because of this, the smell got into the clothes. The room was on the top, the air was more fresh in this room, but it was located next to the elevators, and you could hear the sound of the elevator going up and

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good place to stay in Singapore.
desc: Older hotel but you gain in room space, clean and comfortable 2 minutes to city hall MRT station, don’t use the bar outside the hotel, expensive,go left and left again at the end of the street, little bar/ food centre facing the fire station good value beer and food, hotel has a couple of swimming pools, nice hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not all that
desc: Now let's start with the positives great central location and breakfast was plentiful staff very friendly except one female reception staff. The negatives not 4 star at all have stayed in many hotels the superior room is far from superior tired,drab fittings,shower curtain badly stained tiling in bathroom.needs looking at.mediocre tv with one English channel that only plays first dates on the evening no mirror in lounge area to straighten hair and apply make up.lack lustre hotel have stopped in better 3 stars management need to give their heads a wobble and address the decoration we stopped on 8th floor.pictures showing stained table lamp and standard lamp stained shower curtain along with door and poor tiling in bathroom.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Kindly Staff, Good view and facilities
desc: I stayed for 3 days from February 1st~4th. I arrived in Singapore at late dawn and chenked in as the last guest, so I was lived to the remaining room because there was only one room left. I reserved a double bed, but we stayed in a twin bed room, so we asked to change it to a double bed the next day, and the staff kindly changed it to an upgraded room. They upgraded it to the room of Marina Bay Sand view, and they always responded kindly even though I requested it two or three times. I had great time for 3 days thanks to the good view, good facilities, and frendly staffs. If I visit Singapore again, I'll stay at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel :)

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Excellent is it!
desc: We stayed here for four nights and enjoyed very much. Stayed on Club Floor which is worth the additional cost. Great views,nice food and most helpful and pleasant staff. Room was comfortable and great to get views looking to Marina.The location is great and easy to get around. Understand hotel is renovating the rooms which will give it new look! Thanks to our room attendant who was pleasant and made our room spic and span! Look forward to return trip and see new rooms but definitely on Club Floor. Must try one of the bikes available for guest use. Thank you to all the team!

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location either for a short or long stay as we where there for 11 days
desc: From the moment we arrived we where welcomed with respect and kindness From the Reception, checking in, but most of all the staff throughout from the G.M. To the catering staff in the sky lounge We upgraded to a club room and the views where fab

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Needs an overhaul
desc: This hotel is in a great location and the lobby promises much hope, however once you enter any of the floors it looks like nobody has done anything in it for years. Our room had a musty smell and there were small hopping bugs in the bathroom, after the first night we asked to be moved, eventually this was arranged late in the afternoon but only after intervention by a supervisor, It could be a great hotel.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: A very great location suitable for family
desc: This is an old hotel. The room is spacious and very suitable for family with one baby and toddler like us, they also offered us a baby cot for our baby. Staff were nice and helpfull, breakfast was quite good.. We really love the location on city Hall area very convenient near to MRT, Funan Mall, The Capitol and just walk distance to esplanade and marina Bay..

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Peninsular Excelsior Hotel Singapore
desc: An amazing hotel in Singapore which was very central to the city and a short distance to the airport. Very comfortable, nicely decorated with large windows to enjoy the fantastic view of the river. There are two swimming pools along with a hot tub and a well equipped gym. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the food was nicely served.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: We feel like we are going home
desc: We feel like we are going home to our family when we stay at the Peninsula Excelsior hotel. The Reception team led by Aleena Soong always take care of us very well. Bill the manager and the men at concierge always greet us with happy smiles. The view from the skylounge is the best way to see Marina Bay and the CBD. Our daughter is 18 months old and she know most of the staff very well. They love to see her smile for them.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great Location and excellent staff
desc: The hotel is in a great location being a short walk to the City Hall MRT, Clarke Quay, art gallery, museums and a host of other scenic places. The staff at the hotel are extremely courteous, helpful and responsive to guest requests. The view from the room (17th floor) was spectacular looking towards the Marina and the harbour. The only thing I would mention on the negative side would be the bathrooms being very small and the shower being in the bathtub which made it a squeeze and difficult to get in and out. The other facilities, cafe and sky bar were very good and reasonable. Definitely recommend.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Lovely hotel
desc: Had 4 nights here and loved our stay, very central to everything. The guys at the front door were brilliant and nothing was too much trouble, they would arrange a taxi on request or knew where to send us to get what we wanted. They were so friendly and every time you see them it is a warm welcome. Rooms are neat and tidy and serviced daily. Restaurant on level 22 was great too.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Not there fault
desc: Not Bad great location, rooms clean and staff very good. Had a bit of a problem with our booking due to JetStar cancelling our flight but but not really there fault. The only things I thought were off we we asked for a double and got two beds pushed together with separate sheets. I also couldn't get to grips with the knifes, sounds strange but if you go you will know what I mean

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great pools
desc: Two beautiful pools to enjoy. Great breakfast Good location Good service Rooms ok. Bed and pillows very comfortable. Overall good place to stay. Walk in shower was unexpected and great as some hotels have to stand in bath Would stay again

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Reasonable value for money
desc: We only stayed for 1 night on a multi-destination trip around SE Asia. Overall, it was OK, but not great by any means. It’s a bit dated, and needs some modernisation in design, but otherwise it is very clean, the staff are friendly and nice, and we didn’t feel like we were missing anything. The rooms themselves are probably a little too big, though, given that the bathroom was tiny! We could barely fit two of us in the bathroom at the same time. The breakfast also leaves a lot to be desired, especially given Singapore’s reputation for good food. You might want to just avoid it and instead find your breakfast on the go or at one of the many restaurants or cafes in the city.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Beware!!! Worst Hotel Experience Ever
desc: BEWARE!! This is the most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed at! My flight was delayed so I didn’t get into Singapore until 3am. First of all the guide that picked me up was absolutely horrible. I’m travelling solo and it was after 3am and she dropped me off, took my luggage out of the van, left them on the sidewalk, then took a picture of the hotel sign then drive off. I stood there in a foreign country in the middle of the night I front of this hotel. The concierge saw me through the window but just sat there. I carried in my 3 suitcases alone and had to take the elevator to the lobby floor. I finally checked and headed to my room. All I wanted to do was sleep, but what I witnessed in my room was absolutely the most disgusting thing that I have ever seen. I have included

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: The only Hotel we stay at when in Singapore.
desc: Great Hotel. Great views. Friendly professional Staff. Central location to everything. Start your day with a fantastic choice of breakfast in Coleman's Cafe welcomed by fun loving Amin and his friendly Staff. Nothing is too hard here.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: peninsula excelsior hotel
desc: I really enjoyed my stay here! It's centrally located and was very easily walkable to most of Singapore's attractions. The rooms are a bit dated, but the bathroom was newly renovated and I had a great partial view of Marina Bay. The staff were very accommodating and generously provided a late check out for me. The breakfast had a huge variety and was delicious.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Good value
desc: Had a great stay at this hotel. Yes a little tired which is certainly showing in the shower but it was a great price comparatively speaking in a fabulous location, exactly where we wanted to be. It was my second visit to Singapore so had stayed close by previously- the other hotel more than double the $$. I enjoyed both pools after the heat of sightseeing and the staff were lovely. From checking in, to a drama with our case lock, nothing was too difficult. Special shout out to the older, shorter doorman- sorry I didn’t get his name but always helpful and smiling. Would certainly recommend.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Terrible rooms great location.
desc: Please do not waste your money on this hotel. Due to flight times we checked in at 9 pm ( check in time is from 2 pm ) we were told to take a seat while someone checks to see if our room was ready. Once it was we went up to our room to find it was dirty, and so old, like it hadn't been updated for 40 years. We promptly said this is unacceptable so they moved us to another room. This room was equally old with curtains falling of the rail, wall coverings falling of the walls and stains on the carpet. The room was bigger but this was the only plus to the move. The beds are the hardest I have ever slept in. It was like sleeping on the floor for 3 nights. The hotel photos are obviously so very old. I would rate my stay as a 2 star and no way near the 4 star they say. The only way

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great hotel
desc: A fantastic hotel...close to mrt and shops....very clean and staff fantastic....our housekeeper MOE was amazing.thankyou...beds very comfortable.bathroom very clean....would stay again close to money changers and across the road was a food hall...great food and very clean

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Great location, friendly staff. Excellent for a 4*hotel.
desc: This hotel is ideally located near many places one would like to visit - like the Merlion, Marina Bay Sands, Gardens by the bay, the Clifford pier, China Town, Little India and the Arab Street. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and the managers dealt with the issue we had with our room promptly and went out of way to make sure we were happy. For a 4* hotel, it is reasonably priced and amazing location.

hotelname: Peninsula Excelsior Singapore, A Wyndham Hotel
title: Our stay at Peninsula Excelsior Singapore
